loan.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny V. is 43 years old and lives with her husband, who she married in 1989, about 20 kilometres south of Phnom Penh. Together they have raised four sons and two daughers; two are married, two are students, one works in another village, and another helps Ny and her husband sell meal to local villagers. For over 13 years their family has worked together selling meal, which they cook themselves each day and sell in their village every evening. In order to expand their business by purchasing more meal and equipment, Ny is requesting a loan of $300.

loan.use: To purchase more meal and cooking equipment.

loan.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham. Every day, she works alongside her husband in their restaurant selling wine, beer, and many kinds of meat, and earns about $10. Sam believes that their restaurant would attract more customers and therefore earn more profit if they offered a wider selection of beers and wines. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to expand the refreshments available at her family's restaurant.

loan.use: To increase the selection of drinks for sale.

loan.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem C. is a widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of her children have full-time employment in Phnom Penh and other two study in a local school. The family live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Kem has been farming for fifteen years. She grows many types of vegetables such as gourds, ridye gourds, morning glory, and other green vegetables in her farmland to sell in Ta Khmao market. She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to work in Phnom Penh.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to work.

loan.name: Bo

texts.en:
Mrs. Bo R. is 38 years old and a farmer. She started her business over nineteen years ago, growing rice. She is married to Mr. Thy Trin, 35 years old, who is a farmer. Bo is the mother of two children, both of whom go to school. The cycle of yearly business of Cambodia's people always grows rice.

Bo has decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 Riel (US$ 300) to purchase rice seed and plans to use any remainder of the loan for plowing her farmland. The loan will help them to work better and without so much effort. They all live in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province.

loan.use: to purchase rice seed

loan.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., 41, works selling Khmer traditional medicine in her village. People who live in the province mostly believe in traditional medicine, rather than commercial drugs. On average, she makes around US$2 each day. Her husband is a police man and makes US$1 per day to contribute to the family income. This couple together has five children, three of whom are students and two others who are employed as garment factory workers.

Long N. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to breed a cow and to purchase more medicines for her business with the rest of the money.

loan.use: To breed one cow and buy medicines.

loan.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida has been selling food in Dodoma, Tanzania for two years. She is currently earning a profit of approximately US$ 45 each month but hopes that taking out her first loan will enable her to increase her profit. If she succeeds in earning a greater profit, Farida intends to put the money towards paying her children's school fees and buying more food for her family. She is 37 years old and married. Farida has 7 children, ages 3, 5, 7, 9, 13, 15, and 18. She also cares for two additional dependents.

Farida hopes to buy more wheat, flour, rice, sugar, oil, yeast, and charcoal with this loan. She will sell some of the items and use others to prepare food that she will sell at her shop. She will be sharing this loan with her sub-group members Elizabeth and Amina.

loan.use: To buy more wheat, flour, rice, sugar, oil, and yeast for her business.

loan.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban P., 52, is a farmer and lives about 125 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she typically makes US$ 3 each day. She says planting rice is difficult as the weather conditions are often bad. She uses a lot of labor but earns little to support her family and sometime face up problems with the water supply.

Ban P. told a loan officer that it is strange because in the rainy season sometimes there is not enough water for planting. Inflation is a main factor that contributes to every single farmer's making less profit. The price of everything has skyrocketed including agricultural products such as fertilizer and rice seed. Most farmers can not afford the high price of fertilizer; that is why they make less output.

Ban P.'s husband works collecting palm juice to refine to sugar and makes US$ 2 per day. This couple together has seven children, five of whom are students. Two others are employed. Ban P. is asking for a loan of US$ 900 to rent two hectares of farmland to grow yams.

loan.use: To rent two hectares of farmland to grow yams

loan.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 32 year old mother of two, ages 3 and 6. From 8 am to 10 pm she sells firewood to supplement her family's income. She earns $45 per month. She hopes to expand into more profitable products. This is her first loan from BRAC Tanzania.

loan.use: To buy more stock to improve her business

loan.name: Say

texts.en: Say R. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in Kampong Cham. As a pig farmer, Say's business has suffered from inflation, which has doubled the costs associated with feeding animals. Nonetheless, she earns about $2 each day while her husband, as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh, earns about $7 each day. In order to move away from pig farming, Say is requesting a loan of $700, which will be used to purchase a calf for resale in the future, as well as more tools for her husband's construction business.

loan.use: To purchase a calf and more tools for construction.

loan.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat P., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Na Vet, 27, who live in a small village off of National Road No. 2 about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 2004 and have no children.
Phat has been a mason for five years. He does his work in Phnom Penh and near his village. Na has been a garment factory worker for two years. Currently, Phat travels to work by motor taxi and the cost is very high. So he needs to buy one motorbike but lacks the money. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$600 to buy one motorbike to drive to work.

loan.use: To purchase one motorcycle to drive to work.

loan.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang S., 38, lives about 124 miles from the capital city of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Living in the Kampong Cham, she typically makes $7 USD each day selling bananas. Her husband is a horse-cart driver and makes $8 USD in revenues. This couple has five children, three of whom are students and the other two are garment factory workers. Mrs. Meang would like to take out a loan of US$800 to rent the banana farm to bear the fruits. (Her husband is pictured.)

loan.use: To rent the banana farm

loan.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima has been in business as a bicycle taxi owner in Dodoma, Tanzania, for five years. She is now looking to take out a loan to buy an additional bicycle which she will rent out to a driver. Bicycle taxis are a common way of getting around in rural Tanzania, with the passenger sitting on a cushion that is added behind the driver's seat. The business currently nets a profit of approximately $70 each month, but Halima hopes that by adding another bicycle to her business this profit will increase. With the increase in profits, Halima hopes to continue to invest in her business to aid its expansion.

Halima is 44 years old, married and has two children, aged 22 and 7. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will share this loan with her fellow group members, Melea and Fatuma.

loan.use: To buy a bicycle to rent out as a taxi.

loan.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mr. Chin C., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Phally Tep, 43, who live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1984 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in a local school.

Chin and Phally have been fishing for six years and have been rice farmer since they married. They do fishing from a lake in their village to sell to wholesalers in Ta Khmao market, and they grow rice in their farmland in the village.

Chin is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to buy a boat with a motor for fishing.

loan.use: To purchase a boat with a motor for fishing

loan.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun S., 42, is married and lives with eleven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$4 each day and are supported by four children working in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nun S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizer and a water pump. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Her husband is pictured).

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer and a water pump.

loan.name: Chap

texts.en:
Chap V. sells fruit in Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about three years and she makes US$ 8 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions sometimes are not conducive to a good growing season.

Chap V.'s husband works in construction in Phnom Penh and makes US$ 7 per day as well. This couple together has four young children, one of whom is a student. She is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a motorbike to transport the fruit to market; sometimes her husband can use this motorbike to operate a motor-taxi. She sees this investment as an opportunity that may increase her daily income. (She pictured with her family members.)

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport fruit to market

loan.name: Ashura's Group

texts.en:
Ashura has been selling charcoal in Dodoma, Tanzania for 9 years. She works 12 hours each day and is able to earn approximately US$ 70 every month. She hopes that taking out her first loan will allow her to increase her profits by expanding her inventory. She will put her increased profits towards further growth for her business.

Ashura is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children, ages 22, 20, 17, 13, and 4. She also cares for 5 additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Colletha, Aisha, Mwanne, and Ziada.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loan.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Sokhoeun C. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, who are both students, across the Mekong River from Phnom Penh. Having learned the trade of silk weaving from her mother eleven years ago, Sokhoeun is very productive and sells her products to a merchant who eventually distributed them in Phnom Penh. Her husband, on the other hand, has worked as a taxi driver for about eight years. In order to purchase more silk material and increase her productivity, Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of $500.

loan.use: To purchase more silk material for weaving.

loan.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok H. lives with her husband and their four children, three of whom are students, in Kampong Cham. She works as a vendor selling vegetables in her village's market and earns about $7 each day, while her husband drives a taxi between Kampong Cham and Phnom Penh and earns about $10 each day. In order to increase her profits from vending vegetables, Sok is requesting a loan of $400, which will be used to purchase vegetables in bulk for resale at retail prices.
Sok H. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loan.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk for resale.

loan.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon P. is a 57-year-old widower who lives with his six children in Kampong Cham. As a pig-breeder, Thon earns about $7 each day and is occasionally helped by his daughter, who works in a garment factory. Because pig-breeding is no longer a lucrative business in Cambodia, Thon is hoping to start a new business repairing bicycles. In order to achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan of $400, which he will use to purchase an air pump and other necessary mechanical tools.

loan.use: To set up a mechanic shop and purchase tools.

loan.name: Roun Hem's Group

texts.en: Roun H. is the leader her borrowing group, which includes Saream H. and Sopheap C.. They all live and work near each other across the Mekong River just south of Phnom Penh. Roun is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has worked as a silk weaver for 20 years, and recently her husband began working alongside her as a silk weaver, as well. Saream lives with her husband and their three children, and has also worked as a silk weaver for five years, while her husband works as a house builder. Finally, Sopheap lives with her husband and their two daughters, and has worked as a silk weaver for six years, while her husband also works as a house builder. Roun, Saream, and Sopheap are together requesting a loan of $900, which they will split evenly and use to purchase more material for silk weaving.

loan.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loan.name: Say

texts.en: Say S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and their small child in Kampong Cham. She works as a grocer, earning about $7 each day, while her husband works as a taxi-driver between Sihanouk-Phnom Penh and earns about $3 each day. Say believes she will earn a greater profit if she can buy grocery items in bulk and sell them at retail prices to villagers in her area. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase greater quantities of groceries.

loan.use: To purchase grocery items in bulk.

loan.name: Nasy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nasy M., 42, and her husband, Mr. Phat Pheng, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married twenty-one years ago and have six children: three daughters and three sons. Two of their children are silk weavers and other two sons are workmen. Two children study in a local school.

Nasy and Phat have been raising pigs and producing rice wine for five years. They sell the pigs and rice wine to the middleman in their village. Nasy is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase feed for raising pigs and producing rice wine.

loan.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs and supplies for producing rice wine

loan.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun T., 42, and her husband, Mr. Thon Mi, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have three children: two daughters and one son. All of their children are studying. The oldest son helps his mother raising pigs when he is not in school.

Yun has been raising pigs for five years. She sells the pigs to the middleman in their village. Her husband Thon buys silk products from villagers for re-sale in nearby provinces. Yun is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase feed for raising pigs and buy silk products for re-sale.

loan.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs and buy silk products for re-sale

loan.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth has been seling kanga and vitenge in her shop in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years. She is hoping to use her first loan to buy greater quantities of the two local fabrics so that she may sell more and increase her profit. Kanga and vitenge are large pieces of fabric in bright colors that contain an elaborate pattern and often have a local adage printed in Swahili. They are used for everything from clothing to table cloths to baby-carriers.

Ruth is 46 years old, married, and has 7 children, including two sets of twins. She also cares for two additional dependents. She currently earns approximately $85 per month and works for 12 hours every day. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Saada, Zabibu, Zubeda, and Fatuma.

loan.use: To buy more local fabrics for sale in her shop.

loan.name: Say

texts.en: Say I. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham. Every day, Say bakes Khmer cakes and sells them in her village's market, thereby earning about $2. Her husband works as a rice farmer, and must labour exceptionally hard every day to overcome the difficulties presented by poor weather conditions, a lack of rain, and inflation, which has increased the prices of fertilizer and rice seed. He now earns only $2 each day. In order to increase her family's income and overall prosperity, Say is requesting a loan of $350, which will be used to put one of her daughters through a school for professional tailors and allow Say's family to begin the construction of a tailor shop for their daughter.

loan.use: To pay the fees for tailoring school.

loan.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun M., 36, and her husband, Mr. Senghong Khoen, 36, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1993 and have four children: two daughters and two sons. All of their children study in local schools. The oldest son helps his mother raising pigs when he is not in school.
Aun has been raising pigs for ten years. She sells pigs to the middleman in their village. Her husband Senghong has been a mason for eleven years. Besides raising pigs, Aun sells rice as well. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase feed for her pigs and to buy rice for re-sale at her home.

loan.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs and buy rice for re-sale

loan.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling fish in Dodoma, Tanzania for five years. She is now hoping to take out a loan so that she may expand her business by selling a greater quantity of fish. If she is able to increase her profits from her current monthly income of approximately $70, she will put the additional profits back into her business so that it may continue to grow.

Rehema is 44 years old, married, and has four children ages 3, 8, 10, and 13. In addition to her own 4 children, she also cares for 7 dependents. Rehema will share this loan with her fellow group members, Mary and Dausi.

loan.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loan.name: Mwanaidi's Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi has been selling alcohol in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 20 years. For the first time, she is taking out a loan so that she may increase her inventory. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children, ages 18, 13, 10 and 8. In addition, Mwanaidi cares for eight dependents.

Mwanaidi typically works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $240 each month. Any additional profit she earns as a result of her loan she intends to invest back in her business so that it may continue to grow. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Mwamini, Halima and Tabu.

loan.use: To buy more alcohol to sell in her shop.

loan.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora has been selling chips and other foods at her shop in Dodoma, Tanzania, for five years. Chips, known as 'French fries' in other parts of the world, are as common as rice and ugali in Tanzania, and all three starchy foods serve as filler to accompany lighter foods that would otherwise not be enough to make up an entire meal.

Nora is 37 years old, married, and has three children, aged 8, 10 and 14. She works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $70 each month. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya, Stamili and Halima.

loan.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loan.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel has been buying and selling fabric in Dodoma, Tanzania for six years. She is now hoping to take out her first loan so that she may increase her inventory of cloth to sell. She works for 8 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 20 each month. If she is able to increase her profit, she will put the money towards buying more food for her family.

Rachel is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 19 and 13. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Kibibi, Devotha, and Ashura.

loan.use: To buy more fabric for re-sale

loan.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice has been selling cosmetics at her own little pharmacy in Dodoma for two and a half years. She works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 160 each month. She is now taking out her first loan so that she may expand her inventory and increase her profit. If she succeeds, she will put the additional profit back into her business to help it to continue to grow.

Beatrice is 32 years old, married, and has three children ages 4, 12, and 13. She also cares for 3 additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sarah, Lucy, and Selina.

loan.use: To buy more cosmetics for her shop

loan.name: Ejla

texts.en: Ejla was born in 1989 and she lives in Bijeljina, a rapidly-growing town in northeast Bosnia. At 19, she is unmarried and lives alone. She works as an employee at a cosmetics store, where she struggles to make a living on just 300KM/month. She requests a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women International to buy cosmetics and perfumes that she will re-sell to family and friends. She needs this business to supplement her low income, and she hopes that it will help her to someday open her own cosmetics store. Her friends have already expressed interest in buying her products.

loan.use: To purchase cosmetics that she can re-sell to family and friends.

loan.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea was born in 1989 and she lives in Bijeljina, which is a rapidly-growing town in the northeast of Bosnia. She is young, ambitious, and hopes to someday open her own nail salon. She currently works as a manicurist, earning about 400KM/month. She is requesting a 1,200 KM loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase a machine that helps paint complicated patterns on nails. This type of manicure is growing increasingly popular in Bosnia and should help to bring her many new customers.

loan.use: To purchase a machine that helps with complicated manicures

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 28 years old and married with three children, is a furniture painter in Saida, Southern Lebanon. Very energetic and eager to improve the life of his family, Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to help his father, the owner of a mini market, to purchase extra products in order to increase his customer volume. Ahmad is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Al Majmoua and Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To help his father purchase new stock for his grocery store

loan.name: Josephina's Group

texts.en: Josephina has been selling charcoal and snacks in Dodoma, Tanzania, for four years. The shelter she has been using is in need of repair so she is taking out her first loan in order to repair the roof. Josephina is 30 years old, married and has three children. In addition to her 1.5, 7 and 10 year old children, Josephina cares for four dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Happy, Rose, Zena and Juliana.

loan.use: To buy a new roof for her shop.

loan.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a 24 year old mother of three. Her children range in age from 5 months to 4 years old. In 2007, she started a small grocery that is open from noon to 7 pm. Mwanaisha has been earning $45 per month. This will be her first BRAC Tanzania loan.

loan.use: To expand products and improve business

loan.name: Saada's Group

texts.en: Saada has been keeping livestock in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years. Now, she wants to take out a loan to try to diversify her business and begin selling charcoal. She is currently able to earn approximately $45 each month. With her new business, she is hoping to increase her profit and pay her children's school fees. Saada is 50 years old, married, and has 10 children. In addition to her 10 children, she cares for 7 dependents. Saada will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza and Violeth.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loan.name: Mkasi

texts.en: Mkasi is a mother of two children, ages six months and six years old. She started her laundry business this year and is open from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. and is currently making $50 per month. She is requesting this loan, her first, in order to improve and expand the business.

loan.use: To expand and improve her business

loan.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed, 28, owns a small garage for car washing and oil changes near Tripoli in the north of Lebanon. He lives with his wife and together they have three children. Mohammed is a very ambitious young man who works hard to achieve the best for his family. Mohammed has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to diversify the type of car oils that he carries in order to serve all of his customers' needs. Mohammed thanks the Kiva lenders for their help and consideration.

loan.use: To purchase several kinds of motor oil to use in his auto repair shop.

loan.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen has been cooking and selling food in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 2 years. She is now seeking a loan so that she may purchase more cooking ingredients, particularly sugar and oil, so that she may produce more food to sell. She works for 11 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. With the increased profit from her greater sales following this loan, Helen hopes to reinvest in her business so it continues to grow.

Helen is 50 years old, married and has 7 children, ages 12, 17, 18, 21, 25, 28, and 32. In addition to her 7 children, she also cares for 5 dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Vumilia, Hadija, Vaileth and Pili.

loan.use: To buy a basket of sugar and a bucket of oil

loan.name: efika

texts.en: Efika was born in 1952 and lives in Doboj, a small city in Bosnia. She is married and works with her husband to run a store that sells tools to farmers and mechanics. She requests a 1,500KM loan through Women for Women International in order to import new and second-hand tools, which they will re-sell at a profit. The store provides their only source of income.

loan.use: To purchase new and second-hand tools to resell to mechanics and farmers.

loan.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda lives in Istaravshan and she has 3 children. She sells mens national shirts at the market. She has been in this business for 20 years. Her daughter helps her selling the shirts.

Mavluda is requesting a loan for the first time. She plans to purchase more shirts to sell. With the profit from her business, she wants to expand her business and provide her children with a good education.

loan.use: Purchase more shirts to sell

loan.name: Shafika

texts.en: Shafika is a very ambitious woman of 39 years who owns a small shop selling candies and other treats in the Southern Lebanese city of Saida. Shafika has requested a $1000 loan to help her pay for an urgent surgicA. procedure. If there is money left over from the loan, she plans to use it to purchase new inventory for her shop. This will be the third loan Shafika has taken from A. Majmoua. Shafika is very grateful for Kiva and all who give her the chance to have this surgery and improve her business.

loan.use: to pay for an urgent surgical procedure

loan.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome sells charcoal in Dodoma, Tanzania. She does so by purchasing large bags of charcoal at wholesale prices and then breaking them down into smaller quantities to be sold at higher prices. She has been earning approximately $5 each month but by taking out this loan she hopes to increase her profit so that she can pay her children's school fees and get more food for her family.

Salome is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Santina, Dolisia, and Somoe.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loan.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en: Fat-Hiya is a 23 year old mother of three. Her children are 1, 3 and 5 years old. She started selling charcoal this year from 6:30 am to 6 pm. She earns $140 per month. This will be her first loan from BRAC Tanzania.

loan.use: To expand her business into other products

loan.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 33 years old, single, and lives in Saida, a port-city in the South of Lebanon. Khaled has taken two previous loans from Al Majmoua which he paid back on time. He has requested a new loan of 1000 US Dollars in order to purchase more materials for his house-painting business. The greater supply of paints and tools will allow Khaled to paint two houses at once, increasing his profit margin substantially. Khaled is extremely energetic, and is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Al Majmoua and Kiva lenders.

loan.use: Khaled will use the loan to buy more paints and tools for his house-painting business

loan.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat has been in an agro-business for many years. She grows potatoes and breeds cattle. All of her family members help her in this. They only receive income from this business.
Sadokat wants to borrow money to buy bags to fill with potatoes to sell, and also to pay for the labour she uses to gather potatoes from the field. She wants to make a better living with the profit.

loan.use: To purchase bags for potatoes and to pay for labour

loan.name: Husniddin

texts.en: Husniddin works as a driver but the salary he gets isnt enough to feed the family. So he has also rented a land for growing onions, melons, and wheat. He also has a dream to buy a car with the money from his yield. With the money he wants to borrow, he plans to buy fertilizers and so have a nice crop.

loan.use: Purchasing chemical fertilizers

loan.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling "vitenge" in Dodoma, Tanzania for five years. Vitenge is a local fabric that is brightly colored and decorated with robust patterns. People in Tanzania use vitenge for everything from clothing to head wraps to tablecloths to baby slings. Mariam is taking out her first loan so that she may expand her inventory of the material in her shop.

Mariam is 42 years old, married, and has 7 children. In addition, she helps to care for 8 other dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jeska, Diana, Kilstina, and Masa.

loan.use: To buy more "vitenge" for her business

loan.name: Bahridin

texts.en: Bahriddin has had a taxi service for almost 10 years. He used to work at the factory, but because of cut-backs he was left without a job. So he bought himself a car and started his taxi service. Later he sold his car and bought a used minibus. Bahriddin is requesting a loan so he can repair his minibus and offer better taxi services. This will allow him to to earn more and improve his quality of life.

loan.use: Repair the minibus taxi

loan.name: Khaitkul

texts.en: Khaitkul, who has been working in agriculture for the past four years growing apples and potatoes on his land, has a big family and ailing parents. He is working hard in the field with his brother so that he can make enough profit to afford proper medical treatment for his parents. Khaitkul is requesting a loan to buy potato bags and pay for farm labour.

loan.use: To purchase potato bags and pay for farm labour

loan.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace has a shop where she sells clothing in Dodoma, Tanzania. She is taking out her first loan, which she will use to increase her inventory. She will use her increased profits to pay her children's school fees and to reinvest in her business. Grace is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She also cares for two additional dependents.

Grace will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Rose, Happy, and Hadija.

loan.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loan.name: Jurakul

texts.en: Jurakul grows onions, tomatoes and other gourds. With his borrowed money, he wants to pay for labour and to buy bags for keeping onions. This way, he can sell them later for a higher price and make good money to live on, as well as to help his son to marry.

loan.use: To purchase bags for onions and to pay for transportation and labour

loan.name: Jabborkul

texts.en: Jabborkul has a big family but his house is small. He works at a field growing potatoes. He wants to buy bags for storing potatoes, to sell them later for a higher price. With the money earned, he wants to build a house for his son.

loan.use: To purchase potato bags and pay for labour

loan.name: Maksut

texts.en:
Mahsud works primarily as a minibus cab driver, but because of his low salary, he also rents land upon which he grows onions, melons and wheat. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase his yield.

Mahsud hopes to one day buy a car for his cab driving and earn more so he can give his children a better education.

loan.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers.

loan.name: Hadija's Group

texts.en:
Hadija has had a "genge" in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 13 years. A genge is a fruit and vegetable stand that can be a tiny plank of wood on a side street or as big as a fully-fledged shop selling a variety of food in a crowded city market. Hadija hopes that her first loan helps her to increase her inventory and sales. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $120 per month as a result of her 12-hour work days, but she hopes that her profits increase after taking the loan, so that she can pay for her children's school fees, get more food for her family, and pay hospital bills.

Hadija is 40 years old, widowed, and has six children. She also cares for three additional dependants. Hadija will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jamila and Suzy.

loan.use: To buy more tomatoes, fish, coconuts and bananas to sell.

loan.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N., 68 ans, marie avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, des arachides, de lhuile de palme et des olagineux pour renforcer son petit commerce. Elle veut diversifier ses activits avec les bnfices du commerce et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance. <b/>
texts.en:
Anta N., 68, is married with 10 children for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Ndoucoura for three and a half years. She wants to buy rice, peanuts, palm oil and other oils to bolster her little business. She wants to diversify her business using the profit from it and improve living conditions for her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of vegetables and various foodstuffs

loan.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling charcoal and oil in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years. She is now seeking her first loan so that she may increase her inventory and purchase the materials in bulk to sell at retail prices in her shop. She currently works 11 hours every day and earns approximately US$ 25 each month. She is hoping to reinvest any increase in profits back into her business so that it can continue to grow.

Mariam is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. In addition, she cares for four dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Neema, Sabrina, and Mgeni.

loan.use: To purchase more charcoal and oil to sell

loan.name: Anna's Group

texts.en:
Anna has had a shop selling clothing in Dodoma, Tanzania for 4 years. She is now seeking her first loan so that she may buy a greater quantity of clothing in bulk to resell at her shop. She works for 7 hours daily and earns a profit of approximately US$ 70 each month. If her increased inventory results in greater profit, she intends to use the money to pay her child's school fees, get more food for her family, and improve her home.

Anna is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Halima and Shakila.

loan.use: To buy more clothes in bulk to sell in her shop.

loan.name: Hernando Siles Group

texts.es: LOS SOCIOS DEL GRUPO HERNANDO SILES SE ENCUENTRAN REPRESENTADOS POR EL SEOR JOSE, EL ES PADRE D. FAMILIA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS MENORES D. DIEZ AOS AL IGAL QUE LOS DIFERENTES MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO. EL SEOR JOSE SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PBLICO Y LAS DEMAS SOCIAS VENDEN COMIDA EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL.SON SOCIAS QUE TIENEN MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN SUS NEGOCIOS Y ADEMAS SON ENPRENDEDORAS Y MUY TRABAJADORAS. LA MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS SON COMERCIANTES D. COMIDA DESD. HACE CINCO AOS. LAS SOCIAS NO CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA CON CREDITOS GRUPALES YA QUE ES SU PRIMER CREDITO CON LA FUNDACION PERO SON GENTE BASTANTE PUJANTE Y CON MUCHOS DESEOS D. CRECER EN SUS NEGOCIOS PRIOPIOS POR LO QUE CUENTAN CON LA CONFIANZA D. LA FUNDACION.

loan.use: Capital de Operaciones

loan.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en: Sophia has been selling snacks in Dodoma, Tanzania for 20 years. She is now taking out her first loan in order to expand from a snack stand on the street into a small restaurant. She hopes that this restaurant will allow her to increase her profit. If she is successful, she will put this profit towards paying her children's school fees, getting more food for her family, and repairing her roof. Sophia is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Her children are 1.5, 9, 12, and 16 years old. Sophia will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Tatu, Zawadi, and Tatu.

loan.use: To open a small restaurant

loan.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr: Ndiaya F., 26 ans, clibataire sans enfant avec 02 personnes sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activit de restauration (vente de plats de poulet, de soupe, sandwich, caf et autres). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dpenses quotidiennes de sa famille.<b> Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndiaya F., age 26, is unmarried and has no children, though she has two people in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Ndoucoura for six years. She wants to bolster her catering business (selling chicken dishes, soup, sandwiches, coffee, and so on). Her income enables her to help cover the day-to-day expenses of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Food service

loan.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa D., 62 ans, veuve, 05 enfants et 04 autres sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activit de vente de panier artisanal, de caf, de glace et de crme. Ses revenus lui permettent dassurer la prise en charge de sa famille.<b> Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance. <b/>
texts.en:
Issa D., age 62, is a widow and has five children plus four others in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Ndoucoura for six years. She wants to boost her business selling hand-made baskets, coffee, ice, and cream. Her income allows her to ensure she meets her family's needs. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell hand-made baskets, coffee, ice, and cream

loan.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady F., 48 ans, marie avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus et du fil pour confectionner et vendre des robes et des draps de lit et renforcer aussi son activit dlevage. Son souhait est daccrotre ses revenus pour financer une boutique cralire. <b> Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance. <b/>
texts.en:
Khady F., age 48, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Pout Diack for six years. She wants to buy fabrics and thread to make and sell dresses and bedsheets and also to boost her livestock-raising business. Her wish is to increase her income to finance a shop for selling grain. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cloth, thread, steers, and cattle feed

loan.name: Banco Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Banco Esperanza" is a group of 10 women looking to receive a small loan. Each of them has taken out a very small loan already, so this would be their second. With this loan the group is going to try and expand their small businesses and start generating more income.

Eduviges is the group representative and leader of the group. Eduviges has a lot on the line because she has 6 children that she has to take care of. She told me that those children are the reason she wants to be successful. She wants to be able to provide a different life for them and show them that they can be successful as well.

Eduviges has a very small business selling shoes and Avon products. She plans to expand using this loan and dreams of success. The whole group is ready for this new challenge and are on the road to bettering their lives. On behalf of Eduviges, the group, and Esperanza International--------- Thank you for your support!!!!

loan.use: buying more shoes to sell

loan.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S., 52 ans, marie avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus et du fil pour confectionner et vendre des robes, des complets (ensembles) et des nappes et poursuivre son activit secondaire de vente de pain. Elle veut renforcer ses activits pour augmenter ses revenus et supporter ses charges familiales. <b> Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance. <b/>
texts.en:
Amy S., 52, is married with 7 children and has been a member of the village bank of Pout Diack for 6 years. She wants to buy cloth and thread to make dresses, skirts with jackets, and tablecloths for sale and also continue her secondary activity of selling bread. She wants to bolster her businesses in order to increase her earnings to support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of cloth and thread to make garments and bread for re-sale

loan.name: Mujeres Decisivas Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Decisivas" is a group of 10 women trying to receive a loan. This is a new group to Esperanza International and they are hoping to receive their first loan. At this point in all the members' lives, they are all living in extreme poverty. None of the current members have a steady income, and are living day to day.

Tomasa is the chosen group representative and is very excited about the opportunity she is getting. She has one child and wants to better the life of her child more than anything else. She plans on starting a small business selling clothing in her area and hopes to have her own clothing store someday. She is really excited to have something she can call her own and believes this is the thing that will help her change her life and her future! On behalf of Tomasa, the group, and Esperanza International - thank you for your support!!!!

loan.use: To become a clothing vendor

loan.name: Las Rosas Y Las Guindas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Las Rosas y Guindas pertenece al distrito D. Lircay, provincia D. Angaraes en el departamento D. Huancavelica, esta comunidad ubicada al Sur Este del departamento en L. Regin Central Andina del Per. Su altitud esta entre los 2571 y 4550 msnm, su cL. es templado D. 10 a 15 C. Es una D. las provincias potencialmente productivas en el aspecto agrcoL., ganadera y minera, con una variedad D. pisos ecolgicos que le otorgan alta capacidad productiva competitiva, del mismo modo con una riqueza arqueolgica y ecolgica.

Rosana H., es casada tiene 4 hijos, antes lavaba ropa para mantener a su familia, tuvo problemas con su esposo porque tomaba mucho bebidas alcohlicas y era celoso. Poco a poco Rosana junto un pequeo capital que le sirvi para vender comida. Con los prestamos que recibe los invierte en su negocio, ahora no solo venD. comida, sino que tambin tiene una pequea tiendecita D. abarrotes que le genera mas ingresos. El prstamo que a solicitado le servir para comprar gaseosas al por mayor para su negocio y as seguir creciendo. Su sueo es tener una distribuidora D. abarrotes y un restaurant.

Genoveva P., es casada y tiene 2 hijos, antes no tenia negocio, solo se dedicaba a L. casa y a atender a sus hijos, solo su esposo aportaba, l trabaja en L. mina y viene 1 semana al mes a visitarles, elL. con lo que le daba su esposo ahorro un pequeo capital y compr productos D. limpieza para vender, ahora con los prestamos que recibe a podido alquilar un puesto en el mercado y su negocio a crecido, cuando viene su esposo, elL. cierra su negocio y cuando l se va lo vuelve a abrir para continuar vendiendo. Su sueo es ahorrar para comprarse un terreno y tener donD. vivir, actualmente vive en casa alquilada D. un familiar.

Sonia A., es casada y tiene 4 hijos, cuando su esposo se retiro D. su trabajo anterior (minero) recibi un dinero que lo invirtieron en el negocio D. venta D. pollos y verduras, L. venta L. realizaba D. forma ambulante en un triciclo. El problema que Sonia afront es que su esposo L. dejo para irse con otro compromiso, despus D. tiempo quiso regresar a L. casa. Sonia sali adelante, elL. trabaja por sus hijos y genera sus propios ingresos, ahora elL. ya tiene un puesto en el mercado, ya no es ambulante, ahora venD. tambin abarrotes. Su sueo es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Rosas y Guindas belongs to the district of Lircay, in the province of Angaraes, in the Department of Huancavelica. This community is located in the southeast of the Department, in the central Andes region of Peru. Its altituD. is between 2571 and 4550 meters above sea level. The climate has a temperature of about 10 to 15 degrees C (50 - 60 degrees F). It is one of the provinces that are potentially productive in agriculture, livestock, and mining, with a variety of ecological levels that result in a high capacity for competitive production. At the same time it has archeological and ecological riches. Rosana H. is married with 4 children. She used to wash clothing in order to maintain her family. She had problems with her husband because he drank too many alcoholic drinks and he was jealous. Bit by bit Rosana built a small capital that was enough to begin selling food. With the loans that she gets, she invests in her business, and now she doesnt only sell food, but rather she also has a small snack store that generates a better income. The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy soda pop and to improve her business and continue growing it. Her dream is to distribute snacks and to have a restaurant. Genovena P. is married and has 2 children. She didnt use to have a business; she was solely dedicated to the home and her children. Only her husband had an income. He works in a mine and has one week per month to visit them. With what he gives her, she saved capital and bought merchandise. Now with the loans that she has gotten she rents a stall in the market and her business is growing. When her husband comes, she closes the business and when he leaves she opens it again in order to continue selling. Her dream is to save to buy land and to have somewhere to live, as at the moment she lives in a rented house belonging to her family. Sonia A. is married and has 4 children. When he husband retired from his previous job (mining) he got some money that they invested in a business selling chicken and vegetables, sales that they do by walking around with goods on a cart. The problem that Sonia has is that her husband left her to go with another person, and after this he stopped coming back to the house. Sonia moved on, working for her children and getting her own income. Now she has a stall in a market rather than a cart, and now she also sells groceries. Her dream is that her children could become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The members of the Community Bank Las Rosas and Guindas need different amounts of loans to a total of 8800 soles.

loan.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: Doa Zoila tiene 45 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 aos de edad, es madre soltera y tiene que luchar diariamente para poder salir adelante con su familia. Ella tiene un kiosco que est ubicado en un colegio, en donde vende golosinas, comida, refrescos, gaseosas y otros productos. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de productos como gaseosas y materia prima para elaborar sus comidas ya que por la ubicacin del kiosco tiene que estarlo abasteciendo con bastante frecuencia. Los planes futuros para su negocio es poder extender su atencin a otros colegios cercanos a su vecindario. Pero la meta primordial de Ziola es poder contar con buena salud para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo darles una buena educacin.
texts.en:
Zoila is 45 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Anexo Villa in Venezuela. She has 2 kids who are 15 and 18 years old, she is a single mother and has to fight each day to be able to move forward with her family. She has a kiosk in a high school where she sells sweets, food, soft drinks and fizzy drinks and other products. The loan she's asked for is to buy fizzy drinks and ingredients to make food as she has to stock the kiosk often because of its position. Her future plans for her business are to be able to extend her business to other high schools in the neighborhood. However Zoila's main aim is to count on good health so that she can help her kids to move on and most of all give them a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fizzy drinks and meat/Compra de gasesoas y carnes

loan.name: Nio Jesus Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Nio Jess, esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Casa Blanca en el distrito D. Acoria en el departamento D. Huancavelica, esta comunidad es una zona ganadera (ganado ovino, vacuno, chivo, cabra y burros) y agricultura (papas olluco, cebada, trigo), las seoras se visten multicolores, tiene hermosos paisajes, hace mucho fro.

Nica P., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, su negocio es la venta D. animales en las ferias, Nica necesita capital para incrementar su negocio, desea comprar ovejas merinos que son una buena raza para venderlas. Desea ahorrar para terminar con los arreglos D. su casa.

Rosario Huamn, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos mayores, su negocio es una tienda D. venta D. Tullpa (cocinas D. barro) tambin venD. cucharas D. palo, cuando hay ferias venD. golosinas y comidas, antes solo se dedicaba a la venda D. queso y huevo, ahora a incrementado su negocio, con sus ahorros se compra ropa y apoya a sus hijas que son madres solteras.

Vicenta R., es casada tiene 2 hijos, aprendi a vender chupetes, ahora tiene una tiendecita, la que va surtiendo con mayor mercadera gracias a los prestamos que recibe, su sueo es ver a sus hijos profesionales,
texts.en:
The community bank Nio Jess is located in the community of Casa Blanca in the district of Acoria in the Department of Huancavelica. This community is in a livestock region (herds of sheep, cows, goats, mountain goats, and donkeys) and agriculture (potatoes, barley, and wheat). The women dress in bright colors, they have a beautiful landscape, and it is very cold. Nica P. is married with 4 children. Her business is selling animals in the markets. Nica needs capital in order to grow her business. She wants to buy merino sheep that bring a good rate when sold. She wants to save in order to finish the repairs on her home. Rosario Huamn is a widow and has 2 grown up children. Her business is a store that sells Tullpa (bar food), and also she sells wooden spoons, and when there are markets she sells sweets and meals. Previously, she only sold cheese and eggs; now she has grown her business. With her savings she buys clothing and helps her daughters who are single mothers. Vicenta R. is married with 2 children. She learned to sell lollipops, and now she has a small store, that she is stocking with better merchandise thanks to the loans that she has gotten. Her dream is to see her children be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The members need different amounts of loans for a total of 3800 soles.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
La seora Maria, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen del Rosario, vive en la Regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista y casero de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y comida y su negocio est ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Porvenir Mz. C Lt. 7. Se inicia en el negocio porque tena la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobre todo los gastos escolares.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,100., el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y de tamao personal, mediano y familiar, as como los productos para la preparacin de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes.
Maria tiene 41 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus 02 hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante a su negocio y a sus hijos. Ms adelante desea arreglar e implementar su local para darle una buena imagen y prestigio en la localidad.
texts.en:
Mara, a member of the Virgen del Rosario community bank, lives in the village of La Libertad, in the province and district of Bellavista, in San Martn region. She deals in soft drinks and food, and her business is located in her home in Porvenir, on lot 7, block C. Mara began her business because she needed to generate income in order to cover her childrens expenses, especially all the school expenses. With this six-month $375 loan (1,100 nuevos soles), she will buy bottled water, various brands of soft drinks in individual, medium and family sizes, as well as ingredients for preparing the dishes she serves to her customers. Mara is 41 years old, and lives with her husband and one of their two children. She is a very diligent and responsible woman, who wants both her children and her business to prosper. In the future, she would like to refurbish her eatery to make a good impression and raise its prestige in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of bottled water and soft drinks, as well as other products

loan.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La seora Marivel, socia del Banco Comunal Las Victorias, vive en el departamento de San Martn, provincia de Mariscal Cceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la reparacin y venta repuestos para artefactos, sobre todo brinda mantenimiento de computadoras. El negocio est ubicado en el Jr. La Merced N 931, lugar donde a diario acuden sus clientes que cada da aumentan por la calidad de su trabajo y los repuestos que oferta.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500, el cual ser cancelado en en 6 meses, comprar repuestos y accesorios diversos, los cuales necesita en la realizacin de sus trabajos, eso da confianza y seguridad a sus servicio y sobre todo la satisfaccin de sus clientes, que es lo ms importante para ella.
La seora Marivel tiene 35 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 hijos, quienes son su motor para seguir trabajando y para darles un futuro mejor. Es una mujer muy optimista que anhela ms adelante ampliar y arreglar su local.
texts.en:
Marivel, a member of the Las Victorias community bank, lives in Juanju, in the Mariscal Cceres province of San Martn region. She devotes her time to the repair and sale of appliance spare parts, especially for computer maintenance. Her shop is located at number 931 in the neighborhood of La Merced, a place to which an ever-increasing number of customers turn each day due to the quality of the workmanship and the parts available. With this six-month loan of $500 (1500 nuevos soles), she will purchase parts and various accessories needed for completing the jobs. It will inspire confidence in the service they provide and most importantly customer satisfaction, which is of paramount importance to her. Marivel is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and two children, who are the impetus that drives her to continue working to give them a better tomorrow. She is a very optimistic woman who in the future longs to expand and refurbish her business premises.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of parts and a variety of accessories

loan.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doa Josefa tiene 54 aos de edad, y habita en un barrio que se llama Villa Reconciliacin, es soltera y con cinco hijos, que ya son independientes y que le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Doa Josefa vende comida, refrescos, helados y hielo desde hace cinco aos, inici con dinero propio y con la ayuda que sus hijos, quienes aportaron un poco para que Doa Josefa puedera empezar el negocio. Con la solicitud del prstamos es para comprar granos bsicos para seguir elaborando sus comidas y as fortalecer su negocio y no desmejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes. Sus planes son mejorar la infraestructura del negocio para poder ofrecer una mejor atencin a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josefa is 54 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She is single and has 5 kids who are all independent of her and help her with the household costs. Josefa has been selling food, soft drinks, ice cream and ice for 5 years. She started with her own money and with the help of her kids who supported her a bit so that she could start the business. The loan she has asked for is to buy basic grains to keep making food and thereby strengthen her business and not worsen the service she offers her clients. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her business and thereby offer her clients a better service.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy basic grains/Compra de granos bsicos

loan.name: Merita

texts.es:
La seora Merita pertenece al Banco Comunal La Libertad y vive en la regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de carnes, sobre todo de res, pollo y cerdo y su negocio est ubicado en su propia casa, lugar donde espera a sus clientes para atenderles con mucha amabilidad. Decidi emprender este negocio porque en su localidad no hay un mercado y un lugar especifico donde encontrar carnes.
Con este crdito de S/. 1,000, el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar cerdos, ganados y pollos vivos para luego sacrificarlos y venderlos por kilos a sus clientes que son muy exigentes.
La seora Merita tiene 31 aos, vive con su esposo y con su hijo. Ella y su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante y en un futuro quiere arreglar su local para dar prestigio a su negocio, para que resalte y que sea muy concurrido en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Merita belongs to the La Libertad community bank and lives in the small town of La Libertad, in the Bellavista district of San Martn. She specializes in the sale of all sorts of meat, especially beef, chicken and pork. Her shop is located in her home, where she hopes her customers are met with a cordial atmosphere. Merita decided to start this business because there was no market or place where meat was sold in her area. With this six-month loan of $350 (1,000 nuevos soles), she will buy live pigs, steers and chicken to later butcher and sell by the kilo to her many customers. Merita is 31 years old, and lives with her husband and child. She and her husband are working hard to get ahead, and in the future she wants to refurbish her business premises to give her shop a good reputation, so it is competitive and stands out in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of pigs, steers and chickens

loan.name: Nelvith

texts.es:
La seora Nelvith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas y vive en la Regin San Martn, Provincia El Dorado, distrito D. Agua Blanca. Se dedica a la venta D. comida tipo men y su negocio est ubicado en su casa, Jr. Oscar R. Benavides S/N, lugar donD. acuden diariamente sus comensales, que son moradores D. su localidad y visitantes D. otros lugares.
Con este crdito D. S/.2,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar arroz, azcar en saco, aceite en galn, y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparacin diaria D. los platos que oferta a sus clientes como verduras, carnes (D. res, cerdo, pollo y pescado), adems quiere comprar animales para criar en su huerta tales como cerdos, gallinas, pollos, los cuales son animales que utiliza en la preparacin D. sus platos. En vista que no hay un mercado en donD. encuentran D. todo tiene que salir a comprar a la ciudad mas cercana.
La seora Nelvith tiene 45 aos D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos que an depenD. D. ella y cuenta con su familia quienes la apoyan en las actividades D. su negocio. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta comprar una refrigeradora para implementar su negocio con al venta D. bebidas heladas, as como tambin mejorar su local y brindar una buena atencin a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelvith belongs to the Las Margaritas community bank and lives in the Agua Blanca district of El Dorado province in San Martn. She has a restaurant business where she specializes in serving a set meal each day, and her establishment is located in her home in the Benavides neighborhood. Her dinerslocal residents and visitors from elsewheregather there each day. With this six-month loan of $675 (2,000 nuevos soles), Nelvith will buy rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, and other ingredients needed for preparing the dishes she serves her customers on a daily basis, ingredients like vegetables and meat (beef, pork, chicken and fish). In addition, she wants to purchase animals to raise in her fieldlike pigs, hens, and chickensthose that she uses in the preparation of her meals. Since there is no (local) marketplace in which all this can be found, she has to go to the nearest town to shop. Nelvith is 45 years old, and resides with her husband and three children, who still live at home. She counts on her family to help with the operation of the restaurant. Nelvith is a resolute woman, cheerful and a good manager. Her goal is to purchase a refrigerator so she can branch out into the sale of chilled beverages, improve her establishment and better attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil and other ingredients

location.town: Agua Blanca - El Dorado - San Martn

loan.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is single and lives in Mukachevo, Western Ukraine, where she sells clothing items in the local market at the bus station. Veronika is a young and prospective entrepreneur and has been in this sphere of trade for only a year. She decided to start her own business to be able to provide for her needs and help her elderly Granny, who lives with her.
One of the most outstanding characteristics of this entrepreneur is her willingness to persevere in her endeavors and succeed no matter the cost. She is seeking ways to improve her practical skills and master new marketing techniques. Persistence and a focused approach are two other strong points of this client. Veronika is hoping to generate enough income to be able to spend a portion of her profit on some improvements to her private apartment to make it a more comfortable place to live for her Granny and herself.

loan.use: increase inventory

loan.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La Seora Noem, socia del Grupo de Crdito Mientras tanto Las Zamaritanas, vive en la Regin y Provincia de San Martn, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confeccin de lencera y todo tipo de prendas para damas, caballeros y nios en su pequeo taller ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Jos Olaya N 940. Trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son amigos, familiares y personas que llegan gracias a la recomendacin de sus clientes ya existentes a quienes ella trata de la mejor manera para poder mantenerlos y asegurar sus ventas.
Con este prstamo de S/. 800, el cual ser cancelado en 06 meses, comprar hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversos colores y variedades para la confeccin de todo tipo de prendas, elsticos, blondas, cierres y todo lo que se requiere en la realizacin de sus trabajos. Desea contar con un buen stock porque sabe que ya llegan las fiestas de fin de ao y ah es cuando le llegan muchos pedidos.
Noem tiene 42 aos de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus metas. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora y su meta es seguir creciendo en su taller de costura para lo cual piensa comprar mquinas industriales modernas.
texts.en:
Noem, a member of the Las Zamaritanas interim credit group, lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martn province and region. She specializes in making lingerie and all kinds of garments for ladies, gentlemen and children. Her small atelier is located in her own home at number 940 in the Jos Olaya neighborhood. She does custom work for her clients, who are friends, family, and people that come thanks to the recommendations of current clients, whom she treats in the best manner possible to retain their custom and ensure sales. With this six-month loan of $275 (800 nuevos soles), Noem will purchase various colors of thread, various types and colors of fabric for making all kinds of garments, elastic, lace, fasteners and all that is needed to carry out her tasks. She wants to have a variety of stock on hand because she knows that the holiday season is approaching and that is when she receives many orders. Noem is 42 years old, and lives with her husband who supports her goals. She is an optimistic and enterprising woman and her aim is to continue expanding her sewing workshop and she intends to purchase modern industrial sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, elastic, lace, zippers, et cetera

loan.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is single and she lives and runs her business in Mukachevo where she sells food items in the local training school for teachers. She stays busy and almost never has a free minute at her workplace as the demand is really high. Yana has been in this business for one year and currently has about $2400 in merchandise. Her gross income is about $1200.
Yana is a quick learner. She likes aquiring new skills and applying them in her work. These characteristics make her a bright example of an aspiring entrepreneur with great potential for development. This time Yana is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan, $975, to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale at her stand and give her customers a nice selection of snacks to choose from. Yana is hoping to use a portion of the profits generated to help her parents financially.

loan.use: increase assorted inventory

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Seora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Las Cucardas II y vive en la regin y provincia de San Martn, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiles escolares, pasamanera y artculos de regalos. A pesar del poco tiempo en su negocio, este ha crecido, el cual est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. San Miguel N 373, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, que son mayormente los vecinos de su barrio.
Con este prstamo de S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaos, juguetes, papel higinico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaos, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan.
Norma tiene 36 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con su hija quienes la apoyan en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer trabajadora, carismtica y con muchas ganas de sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. Su meta es la de implementar su negocio con la venta de ropa, as como mantenerlo bien surtido para la satisfaccin tanto de ella como la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Las Cucardas II community bank and lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district of San Martn province and region. She sells groceries, school supplies, passementerie (decorative textile trim), and gift items. Despite the short time her shop has been in business, it has grown. It is located in her home at number 373 in the neighborhood of San Miguel. Her customers, primarily local residents of her neighborhood, come on a daily basis to make their purchases. To stock her shop so her customers can find what they are seeking, with this six-month loan of $275 (800 nuevos soles), Norma will buy staples such as rice, sack of sugar, milk, oil, various sized cases of canned goods, toys, packages of toilet paper, detergent, and various brands and sizes of soap, amongst others. Norma is 36 years old, and lives with her husband and their daughter, both of whom help her when they have spare time. She is a hard-working woman, charismatic and very keen that her family and business prosper. Her goal is to branch out into the sale of clothing, as well as keeping the shop well-stocked both for her own satisfaction and to meet the customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of staples (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.) and other products

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martn

loan.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She sells women's clothing and footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending facility is located in a favorable place that is always busy with customers. Irina launched this venture 10 years ago. Presently, she has about $3000 in turnover capital and her monthly net profit is about $600.
Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has added a lot to the success of this small enterprise. However, Irina doesn't want to stop where she is at right now. She wants to keep on working hard and stay focused on further sustainable development of her trade. Irina believes this smaller loan will help her meet current business needs and satisfy customers' demand this season.
Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 4 weeks.

loan.use: To purchase assorted merchandise

loan.name: Palmira

texts.es:
La seora Palmira pertenece al Grupo de Crdito Mientras Tanto Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria y vive en la Regin y Provincia San Martn, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de comida tipo men y su negocio est ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Elas Aguirre N 203, lugar donde espera a sus clientes para atenderlos con la amabilidad que la caracteriza.
Con este crdito de S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar arroz, azcar en saco, aceite en galn, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaos y sabores, y otros ingredientes que necesita para la preparacin diaria de los platos que oferta a sus clientes como verduras, carnes (de res, cerdo, pollo y pescado). Desea tener todo listo para esperar las fiestas patronales de su distrito donde est asegurada sus ventas.
La seora Palmira tiene 41 aos de edad, vive con hijo quien an est estudiando. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y muy perseverante y tiene como meta implementar su negocio con la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Palmira belongs to the Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria interim credit group, and lives in the Tarapota district of San Martn province and region. She has a small restaurant located in her home at 203 Elas Aguirre Jirn, a place where she serves her customers with characteristic kindness. With this six-month loan of $275 (800 nuevos soles), Palmira will purchase rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, soft drinks in various sizes and flavors, and other ingredients needed for the daily preparation of the meals that she offers to her customersvegetables and meat (beef, pork, chicken and fish). Palmira wishes to have everything ready for her districts festivals in honor of patron saints, when she will be assured of having sales. Palmira is 41 years old, and lives with her son who is still in school. She is a determined woman, cheerful and very persevering. Her goal for her shop is to branch out into the sale of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, et cetera

loan.name: Paraska

texts.en:
Paraska sells clothing and footwear in a trade complex called "Image". She launched her small business in her home town of Beregovo over 4 years ago. Ever since, it has been the only source of income for the family. Paraska likes to be adventurous and always tries to add innovative techniques to her developing business. She also tries to keep her merchandise assorted to meet different clients' demands. Currently, she is making about $250-300 a month in net profit.

Paraska is seeking a loan of 4000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise for the colder fall/winter season. Inventory turnover and the purchase of a new vending location has added a lot to the stable and consistent growth of her enterprise. One of Paraska's further goals is to save enough funds for next spring/summer season and to purchase sports clothing items and footwear, which always sell better in the warmer season. We believe Paraska's ability to manage her finances and make right investments will assist her in her current loan repayments.

loan.use: To purchase additional merchandise for the fall/winter season

loan.name: Paula

texts.es:
La seora Paula, socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas de la Molina II, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a travs de pedidos por catlogos y tiene stock en su casa. El negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Miguel Grau Mz. E Lt. 14 del A.A. H.H. Las Brisas de la Molina y sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y nios, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc., adems quiere surtir con ropa porque muchos de sus clientes le solicitan y quiere tener de todo para vender con facilidades de pago para poder mantener a su clientela.
Paula tiene 43 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 hijos quienes son estudiantes y todava dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Su meta es la de ampliar su negocio con la venta de abarrotes y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paula is a member of the finacial group "Las Brisas de la Molina II," (Winds of Mill II) and she lives in the department of province of San Martin in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells beauty products from catalog orders that she keeps in stock in her home. Her business is run from her own home and her customers are her friends, family and neighbors. This loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, deodorants, jewelry, nail polishes, lotions etc. She would also like to stock her clothing products because many of her customers have requested these items and she would like to be able to meet their requests so that she can keep loyal customers coming back to her. Paula is 43 years old and she lives with her husband and her two children who are both students and still dependent on her. She has always been known as a dedicated woman and above all, a hard worker. Her goal is to expand her business to sell groceries as well and from there, continue to expand.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase beauty products such as perfume, nail polish and lotions.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martn

loan.name: Piedad

texts.es:
La seora Piedad, socia del BC LAS BRISAS DE LA MOLINA II, vive en la Regin y provincia de San Martn, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y frutas que estn en temporada como aguajes, pltanos, etc., de manera ambulatoria en los lugares donde se realizan eventos y hay mayor concentracin de personas como en las afueras de los colegios y recreos tursticos.
Con este prstamo de S/. 800, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprar galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chupetines y chicles en bolsas de diferentes marcas y tamaos, caramelos de diferentes marcas y sabores, para poder tener en stock y luego sacarlos a vender.
Piedad tiene 40 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con 04 de sus hijos quienes an son pequeos y dependen de ella, su esposo tambin se dedica al negocio. Es una mujer que le gusta el negocio, desde pequea se dedica a esta actividad y quiere ms adelante poner un negocio de venta de frutas, pltanos y verduras en su casa porque ahora no puede salir dado a que tiene su beb y es muy difcil para ella estar fuera de casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Piedad, member of the las Brisas de la Molina II (Breezes of the Mill) village bank, lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district of the province of San Martin in Peru. She sells snacks and seasonal fruit like aguaje, plantains, etc. while walking around in different events and festivities where this is generally a large group of people like outside schools and in touristic places. With this $275 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase different varieties of cookies in boxes, chocolates in boxes, and different brands and sizes of lollipops and gum in bags, and different flavors and brands of caramels so she will have a larger stock to sell from. Piedad is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four of her children who are small and dependent on her. Her husband also works in the same business. She loves to work hard and has worked in this type of sales she was little. In the future, she would like to put up a fruit and vegetable stand in her home since it is more difficult for her to leave the house due to the need to care for her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of cookies, chocolates, lollipops, etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martn

loan.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Doa Amapro tiene 58 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Venezuela, tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad y que le ayudan a su mam en la manutencin del hogar ya que ella es viuda. Doa Amparo es costurera desde hace 15 aos, negocio que empez con recursos propios y que a lo largo de estos aos ha luchado mucho para salir adelante.
