Doa Amparo desea invertir ahora en la produccin de trajes para nios, es por eso que el prstamo solicitado ser para la compra de telas para la elaboracin de estos trajes. Ella desea hacer su negocio ms grande, poder contratar ms gente para as elaborar ms piezas de ropa
texts.en:
Amparo is 58 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Anexo Villa Venezuela. She has four children, all of whom are grown and who help support their mother, as she is a widow. Amparo has been a seamstress for 15 years, a business that she started with her own funds, and which has struggled over the years to prosper. Amparo now wishes to invest in making childrens outfits, and the loan that she is requesting would be put towards purchasing fabric to make into those outfits. Amparo wants to expand her business, hiring more people to construct more items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fabric to make children's clothing

loan.name: Rocio Mariela

texts.es:
La seora Rosa Imelda, socia del Grupo de Crdito Mientras Tanto Las Zamaritanas, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica ya desde 02 aos a la venta de productos de belleza de la lnea Esita y Avon, as como tambin a la venta de ropas sobre todo pedidos, ella vende de manera ambulatoria, visitando amigos, familiares, vecinos y personas que le recomiendan sus clientes que ya tiene, asegura sus clientes vendiendo con facilidades de pago de manera diaria, semanal, quincenal y mensual.
Con el crdito recibido de S/. 800.00 que ser pagado en 4 meses, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas caballeros y nios, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc. para surtir su stock de productos que luego ellas los vende a precio de catalogo generndole una mayor ganancia, tambin comprar ropas sobre todo lo que tiene pedidos.
La seora Roci Mariela tiene 34 aos, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas que estn estudiando y aun dependen de ella, siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo decidida, quiere crecer en el negocio y contar con un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Imelda, member of the Samaritans credit group, lives in Tarapoto in the province of San Martin, Peru. For the past two years, she has worked in traveling sales offering beauty products from Esita and Avon; she's also sold clothing as requested by her clients. She visits friends, relatives, neighbors and referrals from her current customers. She offers her customers the option of paying daily, weekly, every two weeks, or monthly. With this $275 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase bargain beauty products like perfumes for men, women and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotions, etc. to resupply her stock of products. She will then sell them at the catalogue price which will help her to earn a better income; she will also use the loan to purchase clothing. Mrs. Rocio Mariela is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters who are students and still dependent on her. She has always stood out for being a hard-working, determined woman; she wants to grow her business to where she can put up a shop where she can showcase her products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of beauty products (perfume, nail polish, lotions, etc)

loan.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a representative of the Tatar ethnic minority, who lives in Simferopol, Crimea. She has a family of four, raising two children who are 19 and 20 years old. Gulnara sells denim clothing in the central city market. She has three vending locations at the marketplace and one more little store in a different part of town. Gulnara likes this business and runs it very successfully due to significant help from her family members. She has been in the trade for four years already. Currently, she has about $10,000 invested in the business.
Gulnara's enterprise has benefited a lot from the partnership with Nadiya Ukraine. She has been able to purchase and stock two vending kiosks and expand her business as a result. On a personal level, Gulnara will be able to use a portion of her profits as an investment in the remodeling of her house. One of her biggest dreams as a mom is to buy separate housing for her children. This client has had 8 loans (total $4,400) and has repaid them without any delinquencies.
Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loan.use: To increase return

loan.name: Roidith

texts.es:
La Seora Roydith, socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, vive en la regin San Martn, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de Agua Blanca. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comida tipo men. Su negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Miguel Grau N 214, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, que son mayormente los moradores de su comunidad.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaos, papel higinico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaos, entre otros, adems va a implementar su venta de comida y comprar vajilla de vidrios como jarras, vasos, cucharas y platos para surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan, as como tambin brindarles una buena atencin, y darle una mejor presentacin de su negocio.
Roydith tiene 44 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes son la razn de su lucha constante. Es una mujer trabajadora y su meta es la de contar con un restaurante bien implementado de comida criolla.
texts.en:
Roydith is a member of the "Las Margaritas" [Daisies] Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, El Dorado province, in the Agua Blanca district. She owns a neighborhood convenience store and sells prepared foods. Her business is located in her home at Jirn MIguel Grau, no. 214, where her clients -- many of whom live in the neighborhood -- come to make their daily purchases. With this loan of 1,500 soles [approximately US $ 500] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Roydith plans to purchase basic cooking supplies and other items, such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, canned foods in different sizes, toilet paper, cleaning detergents, and various brands and sizes of soap, among others. In addition, she plans to establish her food sales business. To do this, she will purchase dishware such as pitchers, glasses, spoons and plates to sufficiently stock her business. These purchases also will help ensure her customers can find everything they're looking for and receive good service, as well as improve the look of her business. Roydith is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children, who motivate her to keep working hard. Roydith is a hard-working woman. Her goal is to own a successful Criolla restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of basic goods (rice, sugar, milk, canned foods, etc.)

location.town: Agua Blanca - El Dorado - San Martn

loan.name: 4 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo 4 de septiembre representados por la seora Dina Victoria se dedican a la venta y comercializacion de diferentes productos en el mercado denominado la Loma, el destino del financiamiento es para el incremento de capital y de esa manera poder ampliar su venta de productos comestibles, en general las socias son gente joven y emprendedora con experiencia y ganas de trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia. los socios no tiene experiencia con otras instituciones financieras por lo que la Fundacion es la primera que le abrio las posibilidades de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The members of the group "4 de septiembre" are represented by Seora Dina Victoria and dedicated to the sales of different products at the market named La Loma. Their financial goal is to increase capital and in this manner be able to increase their sales of edible goods. In general, the members are young and enterprising people with experience and desire to work to improve the lives of their families. The members don't have experience with other financial institutions, and la Fundacion is the first one that has given them the possibility to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: operations capital

loan.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
La seora Rosa Imelda, socia del Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto. Es profesora y complementa su trabajo con la venta de productos de belleza, trabaja con pedidos. Su negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en FONAVI Mz. H Lt 19 y sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000, el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y nios, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc. para poder surtir su vitrina y tener en stock sus productos que luego ellas los vender a precio de catalogo, generndole una mayor ganancia.
Tiene 48 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos que cursa estudios superiores. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es la de tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Imelda is a member of the "Manos Unidas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin state and province, in Tarapoto district. She is a teacher and complements her work by selling special-order beauty products. Her business is located in her home at Fonavi Manzana, Lot 19. Her clients include her friends, neighbors and relatives. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Rosa plans to purchase sale-priced beauty products such as women's, men's and children's perfume and cologne; deoderants; jewelry; nail polish; lotions, etc. These purchases will ensure her window is well-supplied and her business well-stocked with products that she will sell at catalogue prices, resulting in a greater profit. Rosa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and one of their children, who is currently in high school. Her goal is to have a place where she can display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of beauty products (perfume, nail polish, lotion, etc.)

loan.name: Rosalith

texts.es:
La seora Rosalith pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Rosario, vive en la regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de coco rallado, listo para la utilizacin en dulces y otros usos. Abastece a Lima y otras regiones, lugares de donde le solicitan su producto por la calidad de ellos, adems complementa su negocio con la venta de bebidas gasificadas en su casa.
Con este crdito de S/.2,500, el cual ser pagado en 6 meses, comprar cocos en grandes cantidades para luego pelar y rallar para poder atender los pedidos que le hacen, tambin comprar agua mineral y gaseosas de diversas marcas, tamaos y sabores para atender las exigencias de sus clientes.
La seora Rosalith tiene 48 aos de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en esta actividad, ambos trabajan duro para salir adelante. Es una mujer emprendedora que desea ms adelante implementar su venta de gaseosas con abarrotes, quiere contar con una bodega en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosalith is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" [Virgin of the Rosary] Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, Bellavista province and district. She sells grated coconut, which can be used for making sweets and other uses. She sells coconut in Lima and other areas from which she receives orders for her products, which are known for their quality. In addition, she complements her coconut business by selling soft drinks out of her home. With this loan of 2,500 soles [about US $ 825] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Rosalith plans to purchase large quantities of coconuts, which will then be peeled and grated to fill the orders she receives from her clients. She also will buy mineral water and soft drinks (various brands, sizes and flavors) to meet the demands of her customers. Rosalith is 48 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her in her business activity. They both work hard to get ahead. Rosalith is an enterprising woman who, in the future, would like to establish a convenience store where she sells not only soft drinks but also other products. She would like to own and operate a small grocery store out of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of large quantities of coconuts, as well as mineral water and soft drinks

loan.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Doa Sandra tiene 35 aos de edad, es casada, con dos hermosos hijos de 13 y 16 aos de edad, que estudian, su esposo es enfermero y habita en el barrio Carlos Fonseca. Doa Sandra es costurera desde hace seis aos, inici el negocio en busca de mejores ingresos que pudieran ayudar a la manutencin de su familia, su esposo le apoy econmicamente para empezar el negocio. Desea poder solventar toda la solicitud de sus clientes es por eso que desea invertir en la compra de telas para hacer sus costuras. Su mayor anhelo nos dice es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales y que tengan todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old, she is married and has 2 lovely kids who are 13 and 16 years old. They both study, her husband is a nurse and she lives in the neighborhood of Carlos Fonseca. Sandra has been a seamstress for 6 years, and she started this business looking for better income to help to maintain her family, and her husband helped her economically to start the business. She wishes to be able to settle her clients demands and therefore needs to invest in materials to do her sewing. She tells us that her greatest desire is to see her kids become professionals and for them to have everything that she could not have.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy materials/Compra de telas

loan.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Seora Silvia, socia del Banco Comunal Maria de Jess II, vive en la Regin y Provincia de San Martn, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confeccin de lencera y todo tipo de prendas para damas, caballeros y nios. Vive en la casa de su mam en el Jr. Tarapoto N 120, lugar donde realiza sus trabajos de lencera para luego venderlas. Las prendas de vestir las trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son amigos, familiares y personas que llegan gracias a la recomendacin de sus clientes ya existentes a quienes ella los trata muy bien para mantenerlos y asegurar sus ventas.
Con este prstamo de S/. 800, el cual ser cancelado en 06 meses, comprar hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversos colores y variedades para la confeccin de todo tipo de prendas, elsticos, blondas, cierres y todo lo que se requiere en la realizacin de sus trabajos. Desea contar con un buen stock porque sabe que ya llegan las fiestas de fin de ao y ah es cuando le llegan muchos pedidos.
Silvia tiene 23 aos de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus metas y con su pequea hija. Es una mujer entusiasta y emprendedora y su meta es la de superarse en la costura y contar con su taller implementado con mquinas industriales modernas.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the "Maria de Jesus II" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region and province, Tarapoto district. She makes lingerie and clothing for women, men and children. She lives in her mother's house at Jiron Tarapoto, no. 120, where she makes and then sells lingerie. Silvia makes made-to-order clothing. Her clients are her friends, relatives and others who have heard about her business from existing clients. She treats all of her clients well to keep them satisfied and ensure her sales. With this loan of 800 soles [about US $275] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Silvia plans to purchase threads of various colors and fabrics of various colors and varieties to make all kinds of clothing. She also will buy elastic bands, lace, zippers and other items needed for making clothing. She would like to have an ample stock of these items because she expects to receive a lot of orders, as the end-of-year holidays will arrive soon. Silvia is 23 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her in her goals and with their young daughter. She is an enthusiastic and enterprising woman whose goals are to get better at sewing clothing and to equip her workshop with modern industrial sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, elastic bands, zippers, etc.

loan.name: Clavelitos De Padcaya Group

texts.es: LOS SOCIOS DEL GRUPO CLAVELITOS D. PADCAYA REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEORA MARIA ESTELA SE DEDICAN A SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS PEQUEOS COMO PENSION D. COMIDA, TIENDAS D. BARRIO, LIBRERIA, PANADERIAS, VENTA D. COSMENTICOS POR CATALOGOS Y AL TRASPORTE PUBLICO, EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DIRIGIDO AL INGREMENTO D. CAPITAL PARA AMPLIAR SUS NEGOCIOS. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO DENTTRO D. GRUPO QUE SON LA SEORA TERESA Y SU HIJA RAQUEL AMBAS TIENEN INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES POR LO NO EXSTEN PROBLEMAS DENTRO DEL GRUPO. D. LAS 12 PERSONAS QUE CONFORMAN EL GRUPO 9 CUENTAN CON ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS IMPECABLES EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINACIERAS POR LO QUE ESTAN AVITUADAS A LOS PAGOS EN GRUPO.
texts.en:
The members of the "Clavelitos D. Padcaya" group, represented by Mara Estela, each have their own small businesses such as food sales, neighborhood stores, bookstores, bakeries, catalog sales of cosmetics and public transportation. The loan will be used for increasing working capital in order to expand their businesses. Within the group are members who are related, like Teresa and her daughter Raquel, who both have independent incomes. Of the 12 people who make up the group, 9 have impeccable prior credit records with other financial institutions. For this reason, they qualify for this loan as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Seora Sonia, socia del Banco Comunal La Libertad, vive en la regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y gaseosas. Est en esta actividad desde hace poco y le esta yendo muy bien. El negocio est ubicado en la casa de sus padres en el Jr. Agricultura S/N, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su barrio.
Con este prstamo recibido de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaos, papel higinico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaos, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan.
Sonia tiene 27 aos, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Es una mujer trabajadora que quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y su meta es la de surtir ms su negocio y el poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "La Libertad" [Freedom] Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, Bellavista province and district, town of La Libertad. She sells groceries and soft drinks. She started this business a short while ago and it is going very well. The business is located in her parents' house at Jiron Agricultura S/N, where her clients -- many of whom are her neighbors -- go every day. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Sonia plans to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, canned goods of various sizes, toilet paper, detergents, soaps of various brands and sizes, among others. These purchases will provide an ample stock for her business and help make sure her customers can find what they need. Sonia is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a hard-working woman who would like to continue growing her business. Her goals are to increase her business's stock and to be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of basic goods (rice, sugar, milk, oil)

loan.name: Melania

texts.es: Doa Melania tiene 41 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliacin, su esposo trabaja de albail y tiene un hijo de 12 aos de edad que esta cursando la primaria. El negocio de la Sra. Melania es la venta de ropa, con seis aos de experiencia, e inici con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo Con el prstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la reparacin del techo para lo cual va a comprar lminas de zinc, y materiales de construccin. A largo plazo es incrementar su inventario, captar ms clientes y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa, y apoyar a su hijo con los estudios
texts.en:
Melania is 41 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacin neighborhood. Her husband is a bricklayer and she has a 12-year-old son in elementary school. Melania has had a business selling clothing for the past six years. She started her business with her own money and with help from her husband. Melania plans to use the requested loan to make improvements to her house, including roof repair. To do this, she will purchase zinc sheeting and construction materials. Over the long term the loan will be used to increase her inventory, attract more clients, be able to offer a variety of products to her clients, continue making improvements to her house, and support her son's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Replace roof of her house

loan.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es:
La seora Susana Patricia, socia del Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martn, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a los estampados en banderolas, estandartes, bandas, etc. El negocio est ubicado en una de las calles cntricas de la ciudad frente a la Municipalidad y sus clientes son entidades publicas y privadas y personas que requieran de sus trabajos.
Con este crdito de S/. 1 000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar productos para la elaboracin de sus trabajos como blondas crecas, telas, pinturas, guantes, cordones, coronas, entre otros. Tiene que tener todo listo para cuando le soliciten sus trabajos, porque muchas veces le improvisan con cantidad de pedidos.
Tiene 31 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 03 hijos quienes todava dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es implementar su negocio con pasamanera y seguir estampando.
texts.en:
Susana Patricia is a member of the "Manos Unidas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin state and province, Tarapoto district. She makes printed streamers, flags and sashes. Her business is located on a centrally located city street near city offices and her clients are public and private organizations and other others who need her products. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Susana plans to purchase materials for making her products such as: lace, fabric, paint, gloves, cords, and crowns, among others. She must have everything in stock for when she receives orders because she often receives multiple last-minute orders. Susana is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their three children, whom she she still supports. She always has stood out as a dedicated and hard-working woman. Her goals are to include braided goods in her business and to continue making her prints.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of lace, fabric, paint, gloves, cords, crowns, etc.

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La seora Teresa, socia del Banco Comunal Las Cucardas II, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martn, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y nios y lo desarrolla saliendo a vender a sus vecinos y en los pueblos cercanos. Sus clientes son las personas de los caseros y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.
Con este prstamo de S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar ropa usada para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para nios y nias y de esa manera poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razn de su negocio.
Teresa tiene 30 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 hijos quienes son la razn para seguir trabajando. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y atenta con sus clientes, es una forma de atraer mas clientes. Ms adelante quiere arreglar su casa para cambiar de negocio y vender comida.
texts.en:
Teresa, a member of the Communal Bank "Las Cucardas II," lives in the Department and province of San Martn, district of La Banda Shilcayo. She sells used clothing for women, men and children, she accomplishes this task by going out and selling to her neighbors and in nearby towns. Her clients are people from nearby villages and people living in the same city. With the loan of S/.800, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will purchase used clothing for women such as polo shirts, blouses, pants, clothing for children; and thus able to meet her customers orders since they are the reason for her business. Teresa is 30 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 children who are the reason to keep working. She sees herself as being kind and attentive with her clients, and is one way of attracting more customers. In the future, she wants to fix her house and change her current business to food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase used clothing for women.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martn

loan.name: Mamadou Bamba

texts.fr: Monsieur L. est un jeune ag d'une trentaine d 'annes ,il est mari et pre de famille. Son activite principale est la production de poulets de chaire .Le pret solliciter permettra de renforcer ses activits de production de poulets destines ravitailler les restaurants de la ville en viande de poulets.
texts.en:
Mr. L. is approximately 30 years old, he is married and the father of a family. His business consists in raising chickens. The loan he is seeking will enable him to bolster his business of raising chicken destined for the restaurants of the city.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Poultry farming

loan.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa R. tiene la edad de 47 aos habita en el reparto Juan Ramn Padilla de municipio de Ticuantepe, es madre soltera, tiene una hija quien le ayuda a atender la pulpera que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerla y con la ayuda de AFODENIC que siempre la ha apoyado. Ella solicita nuevamente un crdito para comprar granos bsicos y surtir la pulpera. Espera algn da llegar a crecer mucho ms y convertir la pulpera en una Miscelanea.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa R. is 47 years old, lives in the town of Juan Ramon Padilla town, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother, and has a daughter who helps her with the shop that she has maintained with great effort and with the help of AFODENIC who has always supported her. She asks again for a loan to buy basic grains and to increase the inventory of the shop. She hopes that someday her business will grow and she will be able to convert it into a corner store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase inventory for her shop.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La seora Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Cucardas II y vive en la regin y provincia de San Martn, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la cra y venta de gallinas y sbila tanto en su casa como en el mercado, pero de manera ambulatoria, no tiene un puesto fijo, sobre todo a las persona que venden comida.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar gallinas, patos, huevos, alimentos para poder criarlos como maz, vacunas que son insumos que necesita de manera diaria para mantener a sus animales en buen estado para tener buena salida y sus clientes queden satisfechos.
La seora Vilma tiene 38 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 hijos. Ella y su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante, sobre todo para la educacin de sus hijos. Ms adelante quiere adquirir un puesto en el mercado para poner otro tipo de negocio, porque en su casa no es posible, sobre todo por su ubicacin en un lugar muy lejano a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Cucardas II" and lives in the region and province of San Martn, district of La Banda Shilcayo. She raises and sells chickens and aloe both at home and in the market but as a moving sales person that does not have a permanent stall. With the S/.1500 loan, that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy hens, ducks, and eggs; to raise the animals she will need items such as corn and vaccines that are needed on a daily basis to keep her animals in good health and to ensure that her customers are satisfied with her products. Vilma is 38 years of age, lives with her husband and their 2 children. She and her husband work hard to succeed, especially for their children's education. In the future, she would like to acquire a stall at the market for another type of business because it is not possible to have a business in her home due to the distant location outside the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase hens, ducks, eggs and nourishment.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martn

loan.name: Rolando Jos

texts.es: El seor Rolando Jos Velsquez tiene la edad de 39 aos habita en el sector de la borgoa con su esposa, ella trabaja en el sector de estadstica en el hospital Mxico de Ticuantepe, esta seora apoya a su marido con los gastos de la casa; tienen a su cargo dos hijos que estudian actualmente en secundaria; el sueo de don Rolando es mejorar su vivienda para darle a sus hijos un techo digno, el trabaja como docente en la escuela publica de ticuantepe. El solicito a nuestra institucin la cantidad de C$ 10,000.00 crdobas para comprar materiales de construccin y mejorar la infraestrucutura de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando Jose V. is 39 years old, he resides in the Borgoa sector with his wife; she works in the field of statistics in the hospital of Mexico de Ticuantepe. His wife contributes to all household expenses; they are responsible for two children who are currently attending high school. Rolandos dream is to improve his home so that he can give his children a decent roof to live under. He works as a teacher in the public school of Ticuantepe. He requests from our institution the amount of C $ 10000.00 cordobas to buy construction materials and improve the infrastructure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Improve the infrastructure of his home.

loan.name: Yboni

texts.es:
La seora Yboni, socia del BC Virgen del Rosario, vive en la Regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de lea y por las noches vende anticuchos. El negocio est ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Lamas N 1428, lugar donde acuden sus clientes que en su mayora son sus vecinos y transentes que visitan su barrio.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar lea en grandes cantidades para luego venderlos al menudeo y los insumos que necesita para la venta de anticuchos como arroz, carnes, carbn entre otros y contar con lo necesario para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes y asegurar sus ventas.
Yboni tiene 38 aos de edad, es viuda y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante. Ms adelante desea arreglar su casa para poner un negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yboni is a member of the Communal Bank "Our Lady of the Rosary," and resides in the region of San Martn, province and district of Bellavista. She sells firewood and kebabs at night. The business is located in her home where most of her customers are neighbors and passersby who visit her neighborhood. With the loan of S/.1500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood in bulk and then sell at retail prices. She will also purchase the supplies needed to sell kebabs such as rice, meat, charcoal among other things necessary to supply her business and meet the demands of her customers and ensure sales. Yboni is 38 years of age, is widowed and counts and the support of her children. She is very persistent and responsible, always wanting to get ahead. In the future, she wants to repair her house and establish a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase firewood in large quantities, as well as rice, meat, charcoal, etc.

loan.name: Ylsa Maria

texts.es:
La seora Ylsa Mara, socia del Banco Comunal La Libertad, vive en la Regin San Martn, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor de La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y frutas como aguajes y pias. El negocio est ubicado en su casa en la Carretera Marginal, facilitndole las ventas la construccin de la carretera por la cantidad de trabajadores que hay en la zona, los cuales son sus clientes y tambin ayuda el clima caluroso de la zona. Se inicia en el negocio porque tena la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobre todo los gastos escolares.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, comprar agua mineral, gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes marcas y tamao personal, mediano y familiar, as como aguajes en sacos y pia, para poder vender al menudeo. Estos son productos muy requeridos por sus clientes.
Ylsa Mara tiene 36 aos de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 04 hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante su negocio y a sus hijos. Ms adelante desea implementar su negocio con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ylsa Mara, a member of the Communal Bank "La Libertad," lives in the region of San Martn, province and district of Bellavista, the less inhabited town in La Libertad. She sells soft drinks and fruits like pineapples and palm. The business is located in her home along the highway, due to road construction the number of workers in the area facilitate sales because they have become customers. She helps these customers during times of warm weather in the area. She began the business because she needed to generate income to cover the costs of raising children, especially the cost of school fees. With the loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy mineral water, different brands and sizes of soft drinks, as well as bagged palms and pineapples, in order to sell at retail. These are products that are highly requested by her customers. Ylsa Mary is 36 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 children. She is a very persistent and responsible woman, pushing the success of her business and children. In the future, she would like to establish a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase mineral water, soft drinks, and fruit.

loan.name: Las Legendarias Group

texts.en:
Nelida B. A. is a member of the community bank, Legendarias D. Chanquil. Chanquil is an area with extreme poverty, about 3300 meters above sea level, which can be found off the main road from the province of Cangallo. The area is dedicated to agriculture and commercial stores. Nelida is not married and has a one year old son. When Nelida was sixteen years old, both her parents died, leaving her and her siblings as orphans. Since then, she has been working to maintain her parents' cattle farm. She will invest her loan of 500 soles into purchasing young cows and bulls that she will eventually be able to sell. Unfortunately, Chanquil is in the rainy season which makes it difficult for Nelida to go to the local fairs and sell her stock. In the future, she hopes that she can save enough money so that her siblings and her son will not have to suffer like she did and instead, attend the University to become professionals.

Edith C. V. is also a member of the Legendarias D. Chanquil community bank. Edith's husband left her a year ago and she has been supporting herself and her two children, aged 12 and 10 years. For the past three years, she has been selling cachipas (a type of cheese commonly sold in the area) at the local fairs; with this income, she is able to pay for her home. In addition, Edith also has a small stand in the local elementary school where she sells sodas, sweets and crackers to the students. She will invest her loan of 500 soles into purchasing materials to make cachipas, and for her stand, she will purchase sodas, cookies, candies and gum. Opening a small store in the area is a goal of Edith's. Additionally, she'd like to see her children attend University to become professionals. She is saving her earnings to educate her children.

Vilma A. C. is married with 5 children; the eldest is 20 and the youngest is 10, and they are all in school. Vilma and her family also live in the small community of Chanquil in the region of Ayacucho, Peru. As a member of the community bank, Legendarias D. Chanquil, Vilma dedicates her time to the purchasing and selling of animals. Since she was a little girl, her mom had been teaching her to work and she has continued to do so. The loan of 500 soles will be invested into purchasing better animals to sell at a better price. She dreams of having a roof over her head for her and her family and is currently saving to ensure her children receive an education.

loan.use: The community bank, Las Legendarias, needs a loan for 5600 nuevos soles in order for 15 of its members to improve their businesses.

loan.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El Sr. Henry habita en un barrio que se llama Hialeah II etapa, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene dos hermosos hijos de 1 ao y de 3 aos de edad. Don Henry trabaja en una empresa privada desempendose como electricista industrial desde hace un ao. Anteriormente el trabajaba como chofer de la empresa, y luego lo promovieron a electricista ya que el estudi esa carrera, pero al no hallar plaza en su profesin le toco aceptar de chofer ya que tenia que mantener una familia. Con el prstamo que est solicitando es para comprar materiales de construccin como: zinc, perlines y clavos para cambiar el techo que est en mal estado, y quiere que su familia goce de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Henry lives in a neighborhood called Hialeah II, his wife is a stay at home mother, they have two beautiful children 1 and 3 years old. For the last year Henry has worked for a private company serving as an industrial electrician. He previously worked as a driver for the company, and then was promoted to electrician because he studied that field. However, he first accepted the driver position because he could not find a position in his field and needed to support his family. With the loan request he plans to buy construction materials such as zinc, rods and nails to change the roof in his home which is in poor condition, since he would like his family to enjoy a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Change the roof of his home.

loan.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.en:
Victoria D. L. C., Benigna DomitiL. C. C., and Felicitas L. D. L. C. are members of the community bank San Antonio D. Padua, in a small town called Mauallasacc in Ayacucho. The residents of the area are dedicated to agriculture, cheese production, and raising cattle.

Victoria is a single mother with a 20-year-old son who is currently studying at the University of Alas Peruanos. She helps run a restaurant that offers all types of Peruvian dishes. Her dream is to have her own restaurant and open a small store in the area. She is saving because the interest she earns continues to grow, and she plans to use the money to open her own store in the future.

Benigna lives with her partner and their 4 children, who are all in school. She has a small snack bar in the area. She hopes to open her own small restaurant in December 2008. She is currently saving to purchase more materials to stock her future restaurant and for her knitting business.

Felicitas is married with four children, aged 26, 22, 16, and 12. Felicitas has been selling candies since she was young, and she has now begun selling children's clothing. Her dream is to have her children become professionals. She is very proud that her two eldest are studying at the university in Ayacucho--they are on their way. She is currently saving to ensure they remain in school and to supply her future needs.

Felicitas will invest this loan by purchasing more clothing to sell. Benigna plans to purchase groceries to stock her snack bar, along with yarn because she also spends time knitting. Victoria will invest in her business by purchasing drinks and groceries to keep her restaurant stocked with food.

loan.use: The community bank, San Antonio de Padua, needs a loan of 4700 nuevos soles in order for 10 of its members to improve their businesses.

loan.name: Francisco

texts.es: A la casa de la familia C. le est haciendo falta el vitropiso ya que el que tiene es piso vinlico y est en malas condiciones. El Sr. Francisco y su esposa Mara de Lourdes quieren un hogar mejor para sus hijos. El Sr. Francisco trabaja en una compaa en el rea de auxiliar de plomera ste es el ingreso de su familia ya que sus esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos. Francisco est solicitando un prstamo para poner el vitropiso en su casa y mejorar el lugar donde vive su familia. Cuando se realiz la visita a la casa del Sr. Francisco no se encontraba es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
The C. familys home needs a vitropiso (tiled floor) since that the one it has is in bad condition. Seor Francisco and his wife Mara De Lourdes want a better home for their children and to have a better place to live in.

Seor Francisco works for a company as a plumbers assistant which is his family's only income now that his wife Mara De Lourdes cares for their children.

Francisco is asking for a loan to be able to put a vitropiso (tiled floor) in his home and to improve the place where his family lives.

When we visited the C. home only his wife, Seora Maria De Lourdes, and his son were home and Seor Francisco was at work which is why only his wife and son are in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Placing of a "vitropiso" (tiled floor) in the house

loan.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Doa Luisa tiene 52 aos de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, soltera y con dos hijos mayores de edad, que la ayudan. Ella trabaja de responsable de un comedor infantil, lleva nueve aos de estar laborando y ha sido una experiencia buena por que ha podido superarse como mujer. Pues cuando empez entr como ayudante del comedor. Con el prstamo que est solicitando es para ampliar un cuarto ya que es muy pequeo e incmodo para eso necesita comprar piedra arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su hogar, y poder contribuir en la dieta balanceada de los nios del comedor para que sean sanos y fuerte.
texts.en:
Doa Luisa is 52 years of age and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua named Memorial Sandino. She is single with two adult children who help her. She is in charge of a childrens dining-room. She has worked for 9 years and it has been a good experience because she has been able to excel as a woman. When she started working, she started as a dining-room assistant. The loan that she is requesting is to expand a room that is very small and uncomfortable. For this she needs sand, cement, and iron. In the long term, she wants to be able to finish making improvements to her home and to be able to contribute to the balanced diet of the children at the dining-room so that they are healthy and strong.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expansion of a room

loan.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Sr. Francisco est construyendo su casa, la etapa en la que se encuentra son los acabados exteriores e interiores. El Sr. francisco quiere terminar su casa, actualemte vive en casa prestada y le estn solicitando que desocupe esa vivienda. Don Francisco tiene una pequea tienda de abarrotes que la trabajan l y su esposa; ste es el ingreso de su familia. l est solicitando un prstamo para terminar con parte del exterior de la casa (ventanas y puertas), y as poder habitarla junto con su familia; tener un lugar seguro para ellos es el objetivo.
texts.en:
Francisco is building his house, currently adding the finishing touches to the interior and exterior. Francisco wishes to have his house finished already because they are living in a borrowed room and they have been asked to vacate.

Francisco owns small convenience stores that are managed by himself and his wife, providing them with their family income.

Francisco is requesting a loan to complete the exterior of their house, such as the windows and doors, so that they can move in and be in a place of their own.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To complete the exterior of the house.

loan.name: Kausachun Colca Group

texts.en:
In the small town of Colca, the community bank "Kausachun Colca" can be found with members, Magna A. A., Reyna Placida H. Q. and Gloria P. V.. The area is known for agriculture and a majority of the businesses incluD. groceries.

Magna dedicates her time to selling candies at the door of a local school and in front of a nearby church. Magna, a widow, has six children that are married. She is currently saving so she can have savings when she is older and is unable to work.

Reyna Placida runs a small snack bar which she is very happy to have as her own business. She is currently living with her husband and their 3 children. A dream of hers is to move from her small town to the city, which will proviD. better opportunities for her children in the future. She dreams that in the future, her children will continue their education, attend the university and become professionals.

Gloria is an unwed mother of 2 children, aged 19 and 10. She works selling small animals and small house ware appliances at the local fairs; she has a lot of hope and is learning to run her own business. She dreams of owning her own small snack store and that her children continue their education to become professionals.

With their loan of 1300 soles, Gloria will invest her part of the loan into small appliances and small animals. Magna plans to invest her loan to purchase more candies and food to prepare for the teachers at the school where she sells candies. Reyna Placida plans to invest her part of the loan into increasing the variety of options her customers have at the snack shop.

loan.use: The community bank, Kausachun Colca, needs a loan for 5,100 nuevos soles in order for 12 of its members to improve their businesses.

loan.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 28 aos, soltero, es propietario de un motocarro, l mismo lo conduce y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde tiempos atrs. Vive independientemente, se siente feliz porque gracias a su herramienta de trabajo est logrando poco a poco lo que desea. Su objetivo es tener un taller mecnico de motos y motocarros, para dedicarse a fondo a este negocio, ya que estudio para eso. Para ello, necesita seguir trabajando, pero su motocarro no est en buenas condiciones, necesita comprar repuestos para repararlo, por lo que necesariamente estima del prstamo que solicita para lograr su propsito. Apoyemos a este joven, ejemplo para muchos que quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28, single and owns a motorized cart; he drives it himself and has worked transporting passengers for a while. He lives independently and feels happy because thanks to his working tool he is achieving his small wishes. His goal is to have a mechanic shop for motorcycles and motorized carts and do this full time, because he went to school for it. To do this, he needs to keep working, however, his cart is not in good condition, he needs to buy repairs to fix it and appreciates getting the loan he requests. Lets support this young man, an example for many who wish to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy repairs to fix motorized cart

loan.name: Rolando

texts.es: El Seor Rolando Hernndez Ixchajchal de 40 aos dicha persona es originario del departamento de Totonicapn, Guatemala, se dedica en la artesana (elaboracin de pantalones de lona, grandes y pequeos) y en la comercializacin de ropa. Con el crdito que solicita en ASDIR, pretende aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus ingresos, lo cual viene a beneficiar a la familia y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia don Rolando viene ejerciendo dicha profecion como sastre hace mas de ocho aos lo aprendio a confeccionar en una maquila en el municipio de San Lucas Guatemala, con el credito solicitado necesita aumentar o variar sus productos para las fiesta de finde ao y dia de reyes.
texts.en:
Seor Rolando Hernndez Ixchajchal is 40 years of age. This person is originally from the department of Totonicapn, Guatemala. He works in handicrafts (the making of long and short canvas pants) and in the selling of clothing. With the loan he is requesting from ASDIR, he is attempting to increase his work capital and his income which will come to benefit his family and improve his familys quality of life. Don Rolando has worked as a tailor for more than 8 years. He learned to make clothing on a machine in the municipality of San Lucas Guatemala. With the requested loan, he needs to increase or vary his products for the end of the year holiday and the Kings Day.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase of Capital

loan.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noem tiene 39 aos, es madre de 3 hijos que estn estudiando y necesitan mucho apoyo de ella y de su esposo Jos, quien trabaja lejos de casa, solo regresa cada 6 meses, pero siempre est pendiente de Noem y sus hijos, y cuando puede, la apoya en su negocio. Noem se dedica a brindar servicios de corte de cabello, peinados, entre otros, ya que para ello estudio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues cuando puede vende ropa por los caseros del ro Ucayali, los deja al contado o cambio de algo (gallinas, pltanos, etc.) Noem quiere implementar ms su negocio, as como tambin quiere mejorar las estructuras de su vivienda, pero para esto, estima de un capital, monto que solicita, para lograr lo que quiere.
texts.en:
Noem is 39 years old and is the mother of 3 children, who are studying and need a lot of support from her and her husband Jos. Jos works far from their home. He only returns every 6 months, but is always dependent on Noem and their children. When he can, he helps her in her business. Noem offers hair-cutting and hair-dressing services, among otherthings, because this is what she knows how to do. She is a very hard-working woman. When she can sell clothes in the towns of the Ucayali River; she sells them for cash or trades for something (hens, bananas, etc.). Noem wants to improve her business more, and she also wants to improve the structure of her home, but for this, she needs capital, of the amount that she is requesting, in order to achieve all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To improve her hairdressing business and to repair some structures of her house

loan.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace mucho tiempo, junto a su esposo Walter, trabajan arduamente en este negocio para solventar los gastos familiares. Uno de los deseos de Kelly es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, para ello est comprando poco a poco los materiales (madera, calamina, entre otros). Por lo que solicita este prstamo para la compra de ms materiales para el arreglo de su vivienda. Ayudemos a esta familia a vivir en un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Kelly and her husband Walter have sold fish for a long time. They work hard in this business to settle their family expenses. One of Kellys desires is to improve the infrastructure of her home. For this, she is, little by little, buying the materials (wood and zinc ore, among others). She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more materials for her house repairs. Lets help this family live in a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy materials for house repairs

loan.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 44 aos, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razn de seguir adelante, ya que las aspiraciones que tiene para sus hijos es brindarles lo necesario para sus estudios. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona. Adems, es propietaria de un motocarro, que es manejado por su esposo Dacio, quien siempre la apoya en todo. Para tener en perfectas condiciones a su motocarro necesita comprar repuestos para mandar a repararlo, desde luego quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio de la venta de ropa, ella necesita de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo. Ayudemos a esta madre, que con esfuerzo y dedicacin hace todo lo posible por seguir progresando.
texts.en:
enedina is 44 years old. She is the mother of 3 children who are attending school and they are her reason to keep going, wanting to provide her children with what they need for them to keep going to school. She sells clothing, taking it to different locales in her region. She also owns a motorcycle and it is chauffured by her husband Dacio. He supports her in everything she does. To get their motorcycle in perfect condition she needs to purchase spare parts. She also wishes to keep her clothing sales business growing, and she needs working capital to meet her objectives. Let us all help out this working mother, that with her great efforts and dedication she does everything she can to keep up her progress.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase spare parts to fix their motorcycle.

loan.name: Maura Raquel

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 5 aos. Maura tiene su negocio de venta de frutas de manera ambulatoria, empez hace 6 aos, tambin vende leche asada por docena, todo lo que es dulces (pie, mousse, tortas) todo lo que es chocolotara hace 2 aos.

Maura desde que recibe los prstamos de FINCA Per ha formado un capital para poner un negocio de frutas. Maura necesita un prstamo de 1,400 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de una mototaxi para incrementar sus ingresos. Suea con tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of El Roble Communal Bank. She is single and has a five-year-old son. Maura has a business where she sells fruit in the streets. She started six years ago. She has also sold custards by the dozen, anything sweet (pie, mousse, cakes) and chocolates for the past two years.

Since Maura received the loans from FINCA Per she has had business capital to open the fruit business. She needs a loan now for 1,400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of a motor taxi to increase her income. She dreams of owning her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a motor taxi for a fruit business

loan.name: Eliseo Ramn

texts.es: Don Eliseo tiene 40 aos de edad, habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, es transportista, tiene una camioneta de acarreo, y tambin es mecnico, su esposa es ama de casa, cuida a sus tres hijos de 14,16 y 17 aos de edad estn estudiando la secundaria. El Sr. Eliseo comenz trabajando con la mecnica pero ahorr y logr comprar su propia camioneta y as trabaja por su propia cuenta. Con la solicitud que est haciendo es para infraestructura en la construccin de un muro de su casa para dar mejor seguridad a su familia, para esto se necesita comprar, piedra, arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es comprar otro vehiculo, para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 40 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino area, works in transportation and is a mechanic. He has a truck. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of their 3 children. They're 14,16 and 17 years old and are high school students. Eliseo started out as a mechanic and saved enough money to buy his own truck and now works for himself. The loan he is soliciting is to build a wall around his house to provide a safer dwelling for his family. To accomplish this, he will need to buy stones, sand, cement and iron. In the future, he'd like to buy another vehicle to better serve his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a wall.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es madre soltera, tiene 36 aos, sus padres son de la tercera edad, con quienes vive, y trabaja para ellos. Se dedica al cultivo de sus tierras, casi toda su vida ha tenido que laborar la tierra, es la nica forma de trabajo que conoce, las chacras que posen son en zonas muy altas, donde tiene que esperar la temporada de lluvia, pero ahora piensa alquilar chacras que puedan acceder al regado. Lo que mas le agrada del trabajo que realiza es tener muy cultivado sus chacras y no permitir nada de hierbas, para que de ese modo produzca bien. En esta oportunidad ella ha sembrado de 2 arrobas de habas y 20 sacos de semilla de papa. La dificultad que tiene es que a veces que no se abastece en cultivar sus tierras, por lo que tambin tiene que ir a pastar ovejas. Los precios de los abonos que han subido demasiado y cuando no le alcanza para comprar, tiene que vender sus carneros. Maria trabaja tambin para poder educar a sus menores hijos que estn estudiando. El dinero que ella est solicitando es para fumigar sus campos, de ese modo poder cosechar bien y llevarlos sus productos al mercado, tiene la esperanza que el precio de mercado se mantenga igual hasta el da que le toque cosechar. Y as poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, aunque tenga que alquilar tierras.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother and is 36 years old. She lives with and works for her parents, who are of a mature age. She cultivates their land. Almost all of her life, she has had to work on the land. It is the only form of work that she knows. The farms are in areas that are at a very high altitude, where she has to wait for the rainy season, but now she plans to rent farms that are irrigated. What she like most about this work is to have very cultivated farms, without any weeds, so that she will have good yields. She has sown 2 sacks of beans and 20 sacks of potato seeds. Sometimes, cultivating her land does not supply her with enough. As a result, she also has to graze sheep. The prices of fertilizer have increased a lot, and when she cant buy it, she has to sell the mutton. Maria also works so that she can educate her young children, who are studying. The money that she is requesting is to spray her fields, so that she can harvest her crops and bring them to the market. She hopes the prices in the market will stay the same until the day that she harvests, so that can sow more, even though she has to rent land.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To spray her fields for cultivation

loan.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Jorge es socio del Banco Comunal El Roble, es soltero, tiene su negocio de mototaxi, empez hace 1 ao y medio trabajando en compra y venta de autoradios, parlantes.

Jorge desde que recibe los prstamos ha formado un capital. Jorge necesita un prstamo de 1.000 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de una mototaxi, con un dinero que tiene ahorrado tambin va a comprar autoradios, parlantes. Jorge suea con sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of El Roble Communal Bank. He has a motor-taxi business. He stared a year and a half ago buying and selling car radios and speakers.

Since Jorge has received the loans he has built business capital. He needs a loan for 1,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of a motor-taxi. With the money he has saved he will also buy car radios and speakers.

Jorge dreams of his family getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a motor-taxi

loan.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, mujer muy activa, tiene 22 aos de edad, convive con su pareja y padre de su hijo de 3 aos, que es la razn de su esfuerzo. Se dedica a su casa en horas de la maana, pero a eso de las 10 tiene que ir a pastar sus toros, que le sirven para el arado, o de lo contrario apoya en la chacra a su esposo; ella proviene de una familia campesina, es por ello que siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Lo que ms le agrada es de criar sus animales como vacas y toros, porque le son de gran utilidad para la siembra y as mismo, cuando los vende cuestas una suma considerable. Lo que le dificulta es que el abono se ha disparado en los precios, aos atrs no costaba mucho y poda sembrar sin dificultad. Ahora cuesta 215 soles el saco y antes 85, la diferencia es grande. Por ello que a veces ya no quiere sembrar, pero si no siembra, no tiene de qu vivir. El motivo de su esfuerzo es para ir adquiriendo implementos para su hogar y posteriormente adquieran su casa propia. El dinero que ha solicitado lo invertir en la siembra de papa y arvejas, y si le alcanza, tambin cebada en la chacra de sus padres. Si cosecha para enero y febrero el precio estar muy bien, es por ello que quiere invertir en la comprar de semillas y para el fumigado contra los insectos.
texts.en:
Rosmery, a very active woman, is 22 years old, lives with her partner and the father of her three-year-old son, who is reason for her effort. In the morning, she is at home, but at 10:00 she has to graze her bulls, which serve to plow the land, or to help her husband on the farm. She comes from a farming family. Because of this, she has always worked on agriculture. What she likes most is to raise animals, like cows and bulls, because they are very useful for sowing and when she sells her products, they carry a considerable amount of weight. It is difficult that the price of fertilizer has increased. In earlier years, it didnt cost very much and she could sow without difficulty. Now, it costs 215 soles per sack, while it was 85 soles before; it is large difference. Because of this, sometimes she doesnt want to sow, but if she doesnt sow, she wont have the means to live. The goal of her effort is to continue acquiring tools for her home and later, to have her own house. The money that she is requesting will be invested in sowing of potatoes and peas, and if she is able to, she will also sow barley on her parents farm. If she harvests from January and February, the price will be very good. Because of this, she wants to invest in the purchase of seeds and to spray against the insects.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in sowing her land, spraying, and buying more seeds

loan.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 39 aos, y una esposa muy colaboradora, que lo apoya en los trabajos del campo. Esta pareja ha tenido 5 hijos que en este momento estn en la etapa de colegio. Se dedica con su esposa. a la agricultura desde muchos aos atrs, para ellos es su fuente de ingreso, le gusta que su tierra est bien trabajada, siembra 50 sacos de semilla de papa y no descuida ninguna de sus chacras sembradas, asimismo sembr arvejas, y habas. Su esposa y sus 5 hijos trabajan para sus ingresos diarios; de los cuales el mayor tiene 20 aos, quien le ayuda fielmente al cuidado de los cultivos, y despus tiene que ir a estudiar. Como tiene ya sembradas sus tierras, necesita de un capital para que abone sus cultivos y as cosechar y cotizar un buen precio en el mercado. Lo que ms le incomoda es el precio muy elevado del abono, que lo que tiene no le alcanza. Emilio trabaja para solventar los estudios de sus 3 menores hijos, de los 5 que tuvo. Con el prstamo, invertir en la compra de abono para su chacra de papas. Su anhelo, con el tiempo, es de sembrar en mayores cantidades, y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilio is 39 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops. This couple has 5 children who are all in school. He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years, it's their livelihood. Emilio likes the earth to be well worked; he plants 50 bags of potato seeds and takes care of all of his cultivated crops, like the arvejas and habas. His wife and 5 children work for the family's daily income; the eldest is 20 years old and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. As Emilio has already planted his land, he needs a loan to fertilize his crops in order to fetch a good price at the market. Unfortunately, fertilizer is expensive and Emilio just can't afford it. Emilio works to pay for the educations of the 3 youngest of his 5 sons. With this loan, he'll buy fertilizer for his potato crop. His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fertilizer for his potato crop.

loan.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es: La seora Rosa Candelaria T. C. de Treinta y Cinco aos de edad, Casada, actualmente reside en Paraje Xoljuj, de la Final de la Zona 3, Totonicapn. Quien por varios aos viene trabajando en la artesana en la elaboracin de blusas con bordado a mano, dicha actividad a sido xito por medio de ella a tratado de ayudar a su esposa en los ingresos de la familia ya que en nuestro departamento la mayora de personas son indgenas y la prenda mas utilizada por las mujeres son las blusas por el cual ella se hacer a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar su crdito para aprovechar la poca de la Navidad para poder fabricar mas productos y tener mejor ganancias ya que en esas fechas la demanda de dicha actividad aumenta y que le permita crecer y desarrollar su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Seora Rosa Candelaria T. C. is thirty-five years of age, married, and currently lives in Paraje Xoljuj at the end of Zone 3, Totonicapn. For years she has worked in handiworks, making blouses embroidered by hand. This work was a result of her trying to help her husband to bring in income for the family since most of the people in our department are indigenous and the most useful clothing for women are blouses which is why she makes them. This is why she came to the Asdir offices to ask for a loan to take advantage of the Christmas season to be able to make more products and to have better earnings since in those days the demand for this work increases, allowing her to grow and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Purchase of Materials

loan.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad es casada, tiene 32 aos y tres hijos, junto a su esposo trabajan en la chacra. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y no depender de su esposo, por ello que adems de trabajar en la chacra, ha decidido a comprar rboles y trozarlos y venderlos como lea, de ese modo generar otra fuente de ingreso en su economa. Tiene en mente abrir un negocio de venta de abarrotes, ya que ahora tiene su propia casa, porque a ella le agrada estar en contacto con la gente y de paso ir generndose un ingreso extra. Lo difcil es que en la agricultura, se invierte mucho, pero cuesta muy poco su producto, por eso es que quiere generar un ingreso adicional. Soledad trabaja en la chacra ayudando a su esposo, porque a sus 3 menores hijos desea educarlos en la ciudad y sean unos buenos profesionales. Con el prstamo podr una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, y de paso incrementar la cantidad de rajados de madera.
texts.en:
Soledad is married, is 32 years old, and has three children. She and her husband work on the farm. She has always liked working, and she is not dependent on her husband. Because of this, in addition to working on the farm, she has decided to buy trees, chop them, and sell them as firewood. In this way, she will have another source of income. She is thinking about opening a grocery store, since she now has her own house, because she likes to be around people and, at the same time, will earn more money. It is difficult that in agriculture, a lot is invested, but the products cost very little. This is the reason that she wants to earn more income. Soledad works on the farm helping her husband, because she wants to educate her three young children and wants them to be professionals. With the loan, she will be able to have a grocery store in her house and, at the same time, increase the quantity of chopped wood she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To start a grocery store in her house

loan.name: Malvina

texts.es: Malvina cuenta con 56 aos, se ha quedado viuda hace 5 aos, tiene 9 hijos y 5 estn viviendo en la ciudad de Lima, y el resto viven en otra zona mas cercana, actualmente est viviendo con sus nietos que le acompaan. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, tenia sus chacras de pltano, pero el precio que le pagan en el mercado es muy bajo y no le conviene, por ello que ha decido abrir un restaurante hace 5 meses, donde ahora tiene ya su casa propia. Ahora todo el da se dedica a preparar los alimentos para sus comensales, lo que mas le agrada de su negocio es tener contacto con la gente y de ese modo no sentirse sola. Y lo mas difcil, es tener que levantarse muy temprano para empezar sus actividades del preparado de la comida. Y lo que le incomoda, a veces, es que le sobra comida, entonces tiene que rematarla aun menor precio para los cerdos. En su afn de sobre vivencia ha puesto este restaurante ante el fracaso en la chacra. Malvina es una experta en la gastronoma, sus comensales fijos son los profesores, enfermeras y algunos turistas. Con el prstamo invertir en mercaderas de primera necesidad para su restaurante; como es el arroz, azcar, fideos y aceite, que son primordiales para que pueda preparar el men del da y atender a sus comensales. Dice que para empezar le esta yendo muy bien, y con el tiempo quiere hacer un restaurante campestre, decorarlo a base de hojas, algo diferente que les atraiga a los turistas y sobre todo preparar comidas tpicas en fechas festivas.
texts.en:
Malvina is 56 years old, has been a widow for 5 years, and has 9 children, of whom 5 live in the city of Lima and the rest live in a neighboring area. At present, she is living with her grandchildren, who accompany her. Earlier, she worked in agriculture. She had banana farms, but their price in the market is very low and is not suitable for her. Because of this, 5 months ago she decided to open a restaurant, where she now has her own house. Every day she prepares food for her guests. What she likes about this business is that she is around people and, in this way, she doesnt feel alone. The most difficult thing has been waking up very early to begin preparing the food. The most inconvenient thing, sometimes, is having leftover food, which she then has to sell at an even lower price for the pigs. In her eagerness, she has put this restaurant before the failure of the farm. Malvina is an expert is gastronomy. Her regular customers include teachers, nurses, and some tourists. With this loan, she will invest in necessary merchandise for her restaurant, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil, which are fundamental so that she can prepare the days menu and take care of her clients. She says that the business is going well for her. With time, she wants to have a country restaurant, to decorate it with leaves, which she hopes will attract tourists, and above all to prepare traditional food on holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients and supplies food the preparation of her food

loan.name: Maria Jamileth

texts.es: Doa Maria tiene 46 aos de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua en los Laureles Norte, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 20 aos de edad, que esta casada. El negocio de la Sra. Maria es la venta de comida ambulante, ya son seis aos trabajando de esta manera, e inici con fondos propios pues su venta es ambulante, ya que no ha tenido el capital suficiente para alquilar o comprar un tramo, lo cual seria una inversin muy sastifactoria para ella. Con la solicitud de prstamo quiere comprar materia prima para elaboracin y venta de comida y as ofertar ms a sus clientes y obtener ms beneficios para crecer en inventario. A largo plazo es lograr estabilizarse y tener su propio local, y ver realizar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Doa Maria is 46 years of age, lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua. She is a single mother and has a 20 year-old daughter who is married. Doa Maria works in the traveling sale of food. She has already been working for 6 years in this way and she started with her own funds. She is in traveling sales because she did not have enough capital to rent or buy a space. It has been a very satisfactory investment for her. With the request of this loan, she wants to buy raw material for the making and sale of food and this way offer more to her clients and have more profits to be able to increase her inventory. In the longer term, she wants to be able to stabilize and have her own place and to see her goals realized.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase raw material for the making of food

loan.name: Julio Justo

texts.es: El seor Julio Justo Ordez Garca de 40 aos de edad, Casado, actualmente reside en Paraje Tzan Sajoc, Cantn Pasajoc, a 4.5 Km. de la ciudad de Totonicapn. En donde por varios aos el seor Julio Justo fue operario de una pequea fabrica en donde se dedicaban en la elaboracin de pantalones de lona, en donde se le surge la idea de formar su pequea fabrica con su familia para poder generar ganancias y mejorar sus situacin familiar ya que ahora cuenta con tres operarios en donde se tiene un porcentaje de 300 pantalones de lona en confeccin en una semana y de esa forma pretende incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder aprovechar la poca que se aproxima la cual es la navidad donde se aumenta la demanda de dicha actividad y as mismo se hacer a Asdir para solicitar su crdito que le permita sustir su mercaderia en el mercado local y con el credito tiene la idea de vender su producto en otro municipio de l departamento de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Seor Julio Justo Ordez Garca is 40 years of age, married and currently resides in Paraje Tzan Sajoc, Cantn Pasajoc, 4.5 kilometers from the city of Totonicapn. This is where, for many years, seor Julio has been an operator in a small factory where they make canvas pants. This is where he was presented with the idea of creating a small factory with his family to be able to generate income and to better his familys situation. Now, he has three laborers working at the rate of 300 pairs of canvas pants per week and, in this way, he aspires to increase his work capital to be able to take advantage of the Christmas season which is now approaching when demand increases. He has asked Asdir for a loan to be able to stock his merchandise in the local market and, with the loan, he has the idea of selling his product in another municipality in the department of Totonicapn.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw material and accessories

loan.name: Jos Ramn

texts.es: Don Jos tiene 44 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Canad, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 8 y 15 aos de edad, los cuales estudian la primaria, su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. Jos trabaja en una institucin privada prestando sus servicios como servicio de seguridad, en donde trabaja las 24 horas de da y noche y luego descansa un da, le ha tocado hacer la lucha ya que los trabajos estn escasos en el pas y tiene que subsistir con su familia, tiene una experiencia laboral de diez aos. El prstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construccin de un muro en frente de la casa para tener un poco de seguridad con su familia. A futuro es mejorar en la economa, brindar a sus hijos estudios.
texts.en:
Don Jos is 44 years of age, lives in the neighborhood of Villa Canad, is married, and they have two children, an 8 year-old and a 15 year-old who are in primary school. His wife is a housewife. Seor Jos works in a private institution working in security where he works for 24 hours and then has a day off. He has struggled since jobs are scarce in the country and he has to support his family. He has 10 years of work experience. The loan that he is asking for is for the foundation for the construction of a wall in front of his home to have a little bit of security for his family. In the future, his goals are to improve in savings to provide his children with schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of a wall

loan.name: Ofilio

texts.es: El Sr. Ofilio tiene 38 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y le tienen tres hijos de 10,13 y 15 aos de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Ofilio trabaja de albail, es contratado y otras veces trabaja por cuenta propia, tiene quince aos experiencia. Con el prstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construccin de pared de su vivienda. A futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa, a si como tambin brindar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ofilio is 38, lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood, he is married and has three children ages 10, 13 and 15, and his wife stays at home. Ofilio works in construction, sometimes as a contractor and some on his own. He has 15 years of experience. He will use the loan for infrastructure to build a wall in his house. In the future he would like to make renovations to his home and take care of the education expenses of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a wall in his house

loan.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 57 aos D. edad, estudi segundo ao D. primaria, es casada, madre D. 08 hijos mayores D. edad y vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo, Puno.
DesD. el ao 2004 es socia del Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras en Acari. Con su crdito inicial D. S/. 300 compr 02 bolsas D. azcar, 02 sacos D. arroz, 01 bolsa D. fideos, ya que en esas fechas se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (abarrotes), negocio al que se dedic por pocos aos. A los 17 aos D. edad convivi con su esposo y desD. entonces se dedican a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino a la fecha. A los 30 aos D. edad empez a comercializar ropa (pantalones, llicllas, chompas), compraba al por mayor en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y venda en la ciudad D. Juliaca al por menor, este negocio lo dej por cuidar a sus hijos porque eran menores D. edad.
Con este crdito D. S/. 1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, aumentar el capital y comprar 01 vacuno mejorado con S/. 3,000 para su engorD. y posterior venta.
Su sueo es volver a vender productos D. primera necesidad (abarrotes) en la ciudad D. Yunguyo al por mayor y menor y apoyar a sus hijos en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Angela is 57 years old. She finished second graD., is married and the mother of eight grown children. She lives in the town of Centro Poblado D. Acari, in Yunguyo, Peru.
