Since 2004, she has been a member of Las Triunfadoras community bank in Acari. With her first loan of approximately $100 (300 nuevos soles), she purchased two sacks of sugar, two sacks of rice and a bag of noodles, because at that time she dealt in grocery staples, an endeavor to which she dedicated her time for a few years. Angela has lived with her husband since she was 17, and from that time to the present has engaged in the rearing of cattle and sheep. When she was 30, she began to sell clothingpants, llicllas (hand-woven Peruvian ponchos), and sweaterspurchased wholesale in the city of Desaguadero and sold retail in the city of Juliaca. She quit that business to care for her children while they were young. With this $350 (1000 nuevos soles) loan to be repaid in three installments, Angela will have the increased working capital to put towards the $1050 purchase (3000 nuevos soles) of one head of improved cattle for fattening and subsequent sale. In order to help her children with their businesses, Angelas dream is to return to selling grocery staples, both wholesale and retail, in Yunguyo.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of one head of improved cattle

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen cumpli 36 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es casada y progenitora de tres hijos varones menores de 10, 09 y 02 aos de edad. Vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde el ao 2007 integra el Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. Con su primer crdito de S/.300, compr gallinas y cuyes para ser comercializados los domingos en Ilave y los das mircoles en Juli. Desde los 20 aos de edad se dedic al negocio de compra y venta de ovinos, compraba de la feria de Huapaca y venda en Ilave. A los 24 aos de edad form su hogar y sigui con su negocio. Desde los 08 aos de edad se dedica a la artesana, teje chalinas, boinas, chullos y a su vez se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, ovinos y porcinos.
Con este crdito de S/.1,200, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 02 ovinos a S/.120 y S/.150, 02 porcinos a S/.100 cada uno, 10 gallinas a S/.15 cada uno, y con el resto comprar cuyes y alimentos para engorde.
Su sueo es criar vacas lecheras y comercializar leche, instalar una pequea granja de cuyes y que sus hijos sean tcnicos en mecnica y construccin civil.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old, completed primary school studies, is married and the mother of three sons who are 10, 9 and 2 years old. She lives in the village of Alintuyo, district of Ilave in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo since 2007. With her first loan for S/.300 she bought chickens and guinea pigs which she sold on Sundays in Ilave and on Wednesdays in Juli. She has been in the business of buying and selling sheep since she was 20 years old, buying in the market in Huapaca and selling in Ilave. When she was 24 she started her family but continued in this business. Since she was 8 she has worked as an artisan weaving shawls, berets, chullos (Peruvian-style wool hat with ear flaps) and at the same time buying and selling small livestock such as chickens, guinea pigs, sheep and pigs. With this loan for S/.1200, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 2 sheep at S/.120 and S/.150, 2 pigs at S/.100 each, 10 chickens at S/.15 each and with the rest will buy guinea pigs and animal feed. Her dream is to raise dairy cattle and sell the milk, to set up a small guinea pig farm and that her sons become mechanical or civil construction technicians.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sheep, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loan.name: Flora

texts.es:
Doa Flora tiene 65 aos de edad, estudio primer ao de primaria, es viuda, madre de 02 hijas y vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo En un inicio con S/. 300 compr 02 porcinos c/u a S/. 150. Creci al lado de sus abuelos porque su padre se dedicaba a beber licor y su madre sufra de la cabeza, eran muy pobres y por eso su abuela la entreg a un seor con quien convivi desde que tenia los 14 aos de edad. Ya con familia empez a vender frutas en la ciudad de Ilave durante 05 aos, ganaba muy poco, entonces cambi de negocio y se dedic al engorde de ganado vacuno, ovino por varios aos, ahora slo se dedica al engorde de ovinos.
Con este crdito de S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 05 ovinos c/u a S/.100 y 01 ovino mejorado con S/. 250 para su engorde y su posterior venta.
Su meta es seguir con su negocio de engorde de ovinos mejorados porque tienen buen precio.
El prstamo que nos da el Banco Comunal para nosotras es de mucho apoyo porque no nos pide muchos papeles, yo seguir integrando el Banco Comunal hasta donde pueda, manifest doa Flora.
texts.en:
Flora is 65, went to school up to first grade of elementary, she is a widow, mother of two daughters and lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. She is one of the founding partners of the June 24th community bank in Alintuyo. At the beginning with $100 she bought two pigs, each at $50. She grew up with her grandparents because her father drank alcohol and her mother had bad headaches, they were very poor so her grandmother decided to give her to a man with whom she lived since she was 14 years old. Once with a family she sold fruit in the city of Ilave during five years, she made very little money, changed the type of business and decided to raise livestock, she raised cattle and sheep, now she only raises sheep. With the loan of $275 to be repaid in 3 months, she will buy five sheep at $35 each and a higher quality sheep for $85, she will raise and sell them. Her goal is to continue with the business of raising great quality sheep because of the good prices. The loan that we get from the community bank is a great help for us because there is not a lot of paperwork to do, I will be part of the community bank as much as I can, Flora said.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase sheep

loan.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 35 aos de edad, estudi primer ao de secundaria, es casada, madre de un hijo varn que tiene 11 aos de edad y vive en la Parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es integrante del Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo desde hace ms de un ao. Gracias al Banco Comunal empec un negocio con el primer prstamo de S/. 300, compre 05 ovinos, me dedicaba a la compra y venta de ovinos, manifest doa Hilda muy contenta. Ella no pudo terminar sus estudios de la secundaria porque sus padres no queran que estudie, slo se dedicaba al pastoreo de ganado de sus padres y a los 23 aos de edad convivi con su esposo.
Con este crdito de S/. 1,500, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 vacuno para engorde.
Su sueo es tener un establo y criar ms ganado vacuno, ovino y que su hijo estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Hilda is 35, went to school up to grade 7, is married, has an 11 year old son and lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the community bank June 24th in Alintuyo, for more than a year. Thanks to the community bank I started a business, with the first loan of $100 I bought five sheep, working buying and selling sheep, said Hilda very happy. She couldnt finish her studies because her parents didnt want her to go to school, she only worked taking care of her familys cattle and at 23 she married her husband. With this loan of $500, to be repaid in three months, she will purchase 1 cow to raise. Her dream is to have a barn and raise more cattle and sheep, and that her son gets an education and becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Irma Felipa

texts.es:
Irma tiene 23 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es casada, madre de tres hijos menores de edad, (dos varones de 06 aos y 09 meses y una mujer de 05 aos de edad) y vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia el Collao, Puno.
Desde hace dos aos integra el Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. Con su crdito inicial de S/. 300 compr 01 oveja con S/. 150 y 02 porcinos con S/. 150. A los 15 aos de edad empez a elaborar trencillas y los venda en la ciudad de Ilave los das domingo, generalmente venda en paquetes a S/.17.00 (en esa fecha). Actualmente se dedica al engorde de porcinos y ovinos, negocio que empez con los crditos del Banco Comunal.
Con este crdito de S/. 800, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 02 ovinos con S/.300 y 02 porcinos con S/.300 para engorde y su posterior venta.
Su sueo es comprar ms terrenos en el campo para sembrar avena y alfalfa para engorde de vacunos, ovinos, porcinos y tambin que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Irma is 23, finished elementary school, she is married, has three young children (two six year and nine month old boys and a five year old girl), she lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, Collao, Puno. Two years ago she joined the community bank June 24th in Alintuyo. Her initial loan of $100 was used to buy 1 sheep with $50 and two pigs with the other $50. At age 15 she started making braid beads and sold them in Ilave on Sundays, generally at $6 per package (back then). Currently, she raises pork and sheep, business that she started with loans from the community bank. With this $275 loan, to be repaid in three months, she has planned to purchase two sheep and two pigs to raise and sell. Her dream is to purchase land to grow oats and alfalfa to feed the cattle, sheep and pork, and also to see her children get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loan.name: Flix Obando

texts.es: El Sr. Flix tiene 41 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y le tienen tres hijos de 2,4 y 6 aos de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Flix trabaja como maestro de obra en una construccin, con el prstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura para comprar materiales para hacer un muro en la parte de enfrente y as poder darle mayor seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio s est volviendo peligroso y su familia queda sola hasta que l vuelve por las noches.
texts.en:
Felix is 41 years old. He lives in the region of Laureles Sur. He is married and he has three children aged 2, 4, and 6 years. His wife stays home with the kids. Felix works as a construction worker. With the loan he is requesting he will purchase building materials to build a wall for the front of their house, to provide safety and security to his family. The area has become quite dangerous and his family stays at home alone until he returns from work late at night.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a wall.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 53 aos D. edad, slo asisti al Programa D. Alfabetizacin, es casada, madre D. cinco hijos, tres D. sus hijos mayores ya tienen familia y dos hijos son solteros. Vive en la parcialidad D. Alintuyo, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal 24 D. Junio en Alintuyo. Con su crdito inicial D. S/.500 compr 01 porcino con S/.100 y 02 ovinos con S/.300. DesD. los 07 aos D. edad empez a tejer ayudando a su mam que era artesana. Aprendi a tejer animalitos, chompas, chalinas, guantes, gorras. Durante 15 aos trabaj en Puno como artesana. En la actualidad slo teje animalitos y venD. en Ilave a los mayoristas. A los 17 aos D. edad form su hogar, su esposo actualmente trabaja en el camal D. Ilave. Doa Isabel ahora se dedica al engorD. D. ovinos, porcinos y a su vez teje animalitos.
Con este crdito D. S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 04 porcinos, cada uno a S/.100 y 04 ovinos D. diferentes precios D. S/.100 a S/.150 cada uno.
Su sueo es instalar una pequea granja D. porcinos para obtener ms ganancias y que sus dos hijos solteros, una mujer D. 20 aos y 01 varn D. 15 aos D. edad estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Isabel is 53, her education only includes a reading and writing program, she is married, has five children, three of them are adults and have a family and two are single. She lives in Alintuyo, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the June 24th community bank in Alintuyo. With the first loan of $170 she bought a pig with $35 and 2 sheep with $100. At age 7 she started knitting to help her mom who maD. crafts. She learned to knit small animals, sweaters, shalls, gloves and hats. For 15 years she worked in Puno making crafts. Currently, she only knits small animals and sells in Ilave to wholesalers. At 17 she started a family, her husband currently works in Ilave. Isabel now raises sheep, pork and knits small animals. With the loan of $350, to be repaid in three months, she has planned to buy four pigs, each at $35 and four sheep at different prices of $35 and $50 each. Her dream is to build a small pig farm to make more money and help her two children, her 20 year old girl and her 15 year old son to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy pork and sheep.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 33 aos de edad, estudi quinto grado de primaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (03 varones de 14, 07, 02 aos y una nia de 05 aos de edad). Vive en la avenida Pacfico S/N, salida a Mazocruz, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde hace tres ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. En un inicio con S/.300 compr 02 ovinos mejorados c/u a S/.150. Qued hurfana de madre a los 06 aos de edad, slo su padre la apoy. A los 17 aos tuvo su pareja y a los 20 aos empez a elaborar trencillas de lana de alpaca, los cuales vendi los das domingos en Ilave a un promedio de 05, 06 trencillas c/u a S/.5 y a S/.10 de acuerdo al tamao y calidad. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de ovinos.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 05 ovinos cada uno a S/.180 y S/. 200, dependiendo del tamao.
Su mayor sueo es tener un pequeo establo de ovinos mejorados en el campo (Parcialidad de Alintuyo) y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is 33, went to school up to grade five, she is married and has four children (three sons ages 14, 7 and 2, and one 5 year old girl). She lives on Pacific Avenue, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. Three years ago she became a member of the June 24th community bank, in Alintuyo. At the beginning with $100 she bought 2 high quality sheep, each at $50. Her mother died when Julia was six, only her father was there for her. At 17, she met her partner and at 20 she started making braid beads made of Alpaca wool, which she sold on Sundays in Ilave at an average of 5 or 6 trencillas at $1.50 or $3 each, depending on their size and quality. Currently she buys and sells sheep. With this loan of $350, to be repaid in three months, she will buy five sheep at $60 or $70 each depending on their size. Her biggest dream is to have her own barn in the country (in Alintuyo) to raise good quality sheep and to see her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sheep.

loan.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel cumpli 28 aos de edad, estudi superior pedaggico, es casada y tiene 02 hijos (01 mujer de 04 aos y 01 varn de 01 ao de edad). Vive en el Jirn Bolognesi N 408 en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Desde el ao 2006 integra el Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras en Acari. En un inicio, con el crdito de S/.300 compr abarrotes (azcar, arroz, fideos, etc.). A los 24 aos de edad form su hogar y empez a vender abarrotes, compraba los productos en la ciudad de Desaguadero y los venda en la ciudad de Tacna. Actualmente se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de aj y organo, los cuales trae de la ciudad de Tacna (Ite, Sama) y los vende en la ciudad de Desaguadero los das viernes y los das domingos en Yunguyo.
Con este crdito de S/,3,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 04 quintales de aj de primera calidad a S/. 360 cada quintal y 04 quintales de aj de segunda calidad a S/. 280 cada quintal y con el resto comprar organo, para venderlos al por mayor y menor en la ciudad de Desaguadero.
Su visin es construir su casa en la ciudad de Yunguyo, instalar una tienda de regalos (matrimonios) y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old, studied pedagogy, is married and has two children (1 girl who is 4 years old and a son who is 1 year of age). She lives in at Jirn Bolognesi N 408 in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Since of the year 2006 she has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" in Acari. In the beginning, with the loan of S/.300 she bought groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.). At 24 years old she formed her home and started to sell groceries. She bought the products in the city of Desaguadero and sold them in the city of Tacna. She currently works in the business of the of purchase and sale of hot peppers and oregano, which she brings from the city of Tacna (Ite, Sama) and sells in the city of Desaguadero on Fridays and on Sundays in Yunguyo. With this loan of S/3,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 400 pounds of first quality hot peppers at S/. 360 for the first 100 pounds and 400 lbs of hot peppers of second quality at S/. 280 for each one hundred lbs. With the remainder she will buy oregano to sell them wholesale and retail in the city of Desaguadero. Her vision is to build her house in the city of Yunguyo, open a wedding gift store and support her children so that they can go to study.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She wil buy large quantities of hot peppers and oregano.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, tiene 29 aos de edad, estudi secundaria completa y vive en la parcialidad de Alintuyo, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde hace un ao es socia del Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. Con el crdito inicial de S/.300, monto con el que aument su capital y compr 01 televisor a colores a S/.500.00. Desde los 20 aos de edad empez a trabajar con el negocio de artefactos domsticos, negocio que aprendi de su madre. Vende todos los domingos en la feria de Ilave.
Con este crdito de S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 equipo de sonido valorizado en S/.800, para su posterior venta en la feria de Ilave.
Su sueo es instalar una tienda de artefactos en la ciudad de Ilave, y tambin piensa vender artefactos en las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco.
texts.en:
Nancy is single, 29 years old, finished secondary school and lives in the Alintuyo neighborhood in the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the 24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo for the past year. With the initial loan of S/.300, an amount with which she increased her capital and purchased a color television for S/.500.00. Since she was 20 years old she has worked in a housewares store, a business which she learned from her mother. She sells every Sunday in the Ilave market. With this loan of S/.800, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy one sound system valued at S/.800 to later sell it in the Ilave market. Her dream is to open a housewares store in the city of Ilave and she also plans to sell wares in the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy a sound system.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doa Rosa cumpli 58 aos D. edad, estudi primer ao D. primaria, es casada, madre D. siete hijos, todos mayores D. edad y vive en la parcialidad D. Alintuyo. distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es integrante del Banco Comunal 24 D. Junio en Alintuyo. Con su crdito inicial aument su capital y compr 01 un equipo D. sonido con S/.500. A los 16 aos D. edad tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces empez el negocio D. compra y venta D. papa, chuo, camote, los cuales los venda en las ferias D. Mazocruz los das sbados y los domingos en Ilave, tambin compraba maz en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y venda en la feria D. Ilave, Por poco tiempo, tambin se dedica a confeccionar soguillas, la cuales venda en la feria D. Ayaviri. En estos momentos se dedica al negocio D. artefactos domsticos, negocio que lo tiene desD. que cumpli los 20 aos D. edad.
Con este crdito D. S/.800, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, aumentar su capital y comprar 02 televisores a colores cada uno a S/.500.
Su sueo es que sus dos hijos mayores obtengan sus Ttulos, ya que est estudiando en, la ciudad D. Arequipa y en cuanto al negocio seguir incrementando ms el capital.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old, studied up to the first year of primary school, is married, is the mother of seven adult children, and lives in the Alintuyo neighborhood of the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the "24 D. Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. With her first loan she increased her working capital and bought a sound system with S/.500. When she was 16 years old she started her own household and since then she started her business buying and selling potatoes, chuo, and sweet potato, which she sold in the Mazocruz on Saturdays and Sundays in Ilave. She also bought corn I the city of Desaguadero and sold it in the Ilave market. For a short time she also worked making soguillas, which she sold in the Ayaviri market. At this time she works selling housewares, a business she has had since she was 20 years old. With this loan of S/.800, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will increase her working capital and will buy two color televisions, each one for S/.500. Her dream is for her two oldest children to obtain their university degrees as they are already studying in the city of Arequipa and in terms of the business she wants to continue increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy two televisions.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 30 aos de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos de 1,5 y 8 aos de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doa Maria tiene una pulpera, con cuatro aos de experiencia, comenz con fondos propios. Con el prstamo que estn solicitando es para invertir en la pulpera, comprar productos percederos ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario de esos productos y desea surtir de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y la misma vez poder captar ms clientela
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She has three children of 1, 5 and 8 years of age, and her husband works in security services, and contributes to household expenses. Maria has a small grocery store with four years of experience, which she started with her own funds. The loan that she is requesting is to invest in a small grocery store. She will buy perishable products as she currently has little inventory of these products and she wishes to diversify the products to satisfy the necessities of her clients and at the same time capture more clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy perishable products.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa naci en la Parcialidad de Alintuyo, tiene 37 aos de edad, estudi sexto grado de primaria, es casada y progenitora de 04 hijos (02 varones de 07 aos y 06 meses y 02 mujeres de 17 y 04 aos de edad). Vive en la Parcialidad de Tojocachi, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde hace un ao integra el Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. Con su crdito inicial de S/. 300 compr lana de alpaca a un valor de S/. 30, 02 bolsitas de perlitas a S/.18 para hacer trencillas, 01 ovino con S/.180 para engorde. Doa Rosa qued hurfana de madre a los 14 aos de edad, ella asumi la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus hermanos menores porque su padre se dedic a beber licor y ahora su padre se encuentra enfermo (invlido). Desde los 12 aos de edad empez a elaborar trencillas de lana de alpaca, a los 18 aos form su hogar y en la actualidad se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino y a su vez sigue con el negocio de trencillas que vende semanalmente el la ciudad de Ilave de 06 y 10 trencillas, tambin vende pan desde el ao pasado.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 01 vacuno para su engorde y posterior venta.
Su sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien en esa ciudad y no estn en el campo.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the Alintuyo neighborhood, is 37 years old, studied up to 6th grade, is married and is the mother of 4 children (2 boys who are 7 years and 6 months and 2 girls who are 17 and 4 years of age). She lives in the Tojocachi neighborhood of the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. With her first loan of S/. 300 years she purchased alpaca wool at a cost of S/. 30, 2 little bags of pearl beads at S/.18 to make little braids, and one sheep for S/.180 to be fattened. Rosa lost her mother when she was 14 years old and she assumed the responsibility of caring for her younger siblings because her father drank liquor and now her father is sick (disabled). From the age of 12 she started to make little braids from alpaca wool, at 18 years old she formed her own household and at the present time she works fattening cattle and sheep and at the same time continues with the braid business for which she sells 6 to 10 weekly in the city of Ilave. She has also sold bread since last year. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be paid off in 3 installments, she plans to buy one cows to fatten and later sell. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave so that her children study in the city and are not in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a cow.

loan.name: Silvia Rosario

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Medalla Milagrosa. Silvia es conviviente, tiene 24 aos y 1 hijo de casi 3 aos est en el nido. Silvia vende limones en el mercado de la Ciudad, reparte por bolsas, tambin vende mans y habitas desde hace 4 aos Silvia trabaja con su esposo ,ellos compran en Piura su mercadera y la venden en Lima en la Av. San Juan por Pista Nueva.

Silvia necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de ms mercadera . Silvia recibe prstamos desde hace 2 aos , ahora tiene un capital para invertir y la vez tambin ahorra. Silvia suea con tener su casa propia y tambin su propio local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa Communal Bank. She is a common law wife and is 24 years old with one child who's almost three and is still in the "nest."

Silvia sells bags of limes in the city's market; she also sells peanuts and lima beans. For the past four years Silvia has worked with her husband. They buy their merchandise in Piura and sell it in Lima on San Juan Avenue near Pista Nueva.

Silvia needs a loan for 2,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. She has received loans for the past two years and now has capital to invest and she also saves.

Silvia dreams of owning her own home and also her own locale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Sandra Marizol

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 30 aos de edad, estudi quinto de secundaria, es casada, y progenitora de 02 hijos (01 varn de 11 aos y 01 mujer de 08 aos de edad). Vive en Jirn Desaguadero S/N. en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde hace un ao integra el Banco Comunal 24 de Junio en Alintuyo. En un inicio obtuvo el crdito de S/. 300, con el cual aument su capital y compr 01 cilindro de combustible (petrleo). A los 19 aos de edad form su hogar, gracias a la enseanza de parte de su cuada aprendi a preparar jugo de quinua y caihua que desde hace 02 aos prepara y vende en la ciudad de Ilave, paralelo a ste negocio, desde el ao pasado, se dedica a la venta de combustible conjuntamente con su esposo.
Con este crdito de S/. 1,200, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 02 cilindros de petrleo para comercializar en forma diaria en la ciudad de Ilave.
Su mayor sueo es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Ilave y apoyar a sus hijos a que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old, studied through the fifth year of secondary school, is married and is the mother of two children (1 son who is 11 years old and one daughter who is 8 years old). She lies on Jirn Desaguadero in the Llave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. In the beginning she obtained a credit of S/. 300, with which she increased her working capital and bought one cylinder of fuel (petroleum). At 19 years of age she formed her household and thanks to instruction from her sister-in-law she learned to prepare quinua and caihua juices which for the past 2 years she has prepared and sold in the city of Llave. Parallel to this business, since last year she has worked selling fuel together with her husband. With this loan of S/. 1,200, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will purchase 2 cylinders of petroleum to sell them daily in the city of Llave. Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Llave and to support her children so that they study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy two cylinders of petroleum.

loan.name: Cristbal Rommel

texts.es: El Sr. Cristbal tiene 29 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Milagro de Dios, es casado y le tienen cuatro hijos de 3, 5,7 y 12 aos de edad, su esposa es ama de casa.Don Cristbal trabaja como tcnico en sistema y grabacin, tiene ocho aos de experiencia, el taller lo tiene en su casa de habitacin pero espera poder muy pronto tener un local dedicado exclusivamente a su trabajo en donde pueda dar mejor servicio. Pero ahora est interesado en construir un pequeo cuarto en su vivienda para poner todos lo utensilios utilizados para su trabajo, ya que en su casa no cuenta con espacio suficiente para hacerlo, adems desea darle ms comodidad a su familia, y no estar utilizando su vivienda para trabajos.
texts.en:
Cristbal is 29 years old. He lives in the Milagro de Dios neighborhood, is married and has four children who are 3, 5, 7, and 12 years old. His spouse is a housewife. Cristbal works as a systems and recording technician and has eight years of experience. He has his workshop at home but hopes to soon have a location exclusively for his work so he can provide better service. For now, he is interested in building a small room onto his home where he can put all his working tools as he does not currently have enough space for this. He would also like to make things more comfortable for his family and not use his residence for work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build a room

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doa Yolanda tiene 48 aos D. edad, estudi primaria completa, es casada, madre D. siete hijos (02 hijos con familia y 03 hijos an son menores D. edad) y vive en la parcialidad D. Alintuyo, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal 24 D. Junio en Alintuyo. En un inicio obtuvo un crdito D. S/.300, el cual aument su capital y compr una vaca con S/.500. Yolanda qued hurfana D. padre a los 08 aos D. edad, ellos eran 05 hermanos, 03 fallecieron y su madre apenas consegua dinero para comer, no les alcanzaba el dinero y no pudieron estudiar. A los 19 aos D. edad tuvo su pareja. Durante 4 aos empez a vender fruta y hace 10 aos se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo, compran en Acora y venden en Ilave.
Con este crdito D. S/.3,000, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 02 toros los cuales sern comercializados en Ilave.
Su sueo es traer ganado vacuno directo D. Ayaviri y as podr obtener mayores ganancias, tambin apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old, completed primary school, is married, is the mother of 7 children (2 children with their own families and three who are still children) and she lives in the Alintuyo neighborhood, Llave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She is one of the founding members of the "24 D. Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. In the beginning she obtained a credit of S/.300, which increased her working capital and she bought a cow for S/.500. Yolanda lost her father at age 8 and they were 5 siblings, 3 of whom have passed away. Their mother just got enough money to feed them and she did not have enough for them to study. At 19 years old she already lived with her spouse. For 4 years sold fruit and for the past 10 years she has worked in the purchase and sale of cattle together with her husband, which they buy in Acora and sell in Llave. With this loan of S/.3,000, which will be repaid in three installments, she will buy 2 bulls which will be sold in Llave. Her dream is to bring cattle directly to Ayaviri through which she will be able to obtain higher earnings. She will also support her children in their studies until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase two bulls.

loan.name: Together Forever Group

texts.es: El grupo Juntos Por Siempre esta conformado por 14 personas las cuales estn representadas por la seora Ximena, las reuniones del grupo se realizan en su domicilio particular los das viernes por la tarde, la mayora de las socias se dedican a la entrega de productos al crdito en los centros mineros de la ciudad de Oruro, como el mercado y la competencia han ido incrementando se necesita mas capital de trabajo por lo cual decidieron optar por un financiamiento de la Fundacin, ellas cuentan con experiencia en el trabajo de mas de cinco aos y es la forma en la que mantienen a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Together Forever is made up of 14 people, who are represented by Mrs. Ximena. The group meets in a particular home every Friday afternoon. Most of the members deliver products on credit to the mining centers of the city of Oruro. As the market and the competition have increased, more capital has become necessary. As a result, they decided to get a loan from the Foundation. They have over five years of experience in their work, and it is the way in which they provide for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital for their operations

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase underwear and slippers for her small business.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase beans and other materials to produce food and popsicles for her clientele.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of equipment to start a beauty salon

loan.name: Angela

texts.es: Doa Angela L., tiene 53 aos de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es a quien ella ayuda en sus estudios actualemnte ya que los otros dos se mantienen por su propia cuenta. La actividad economica de ella es la venta de ropa nueva actividad que desarrolla por encargo, teniendo mas de 15 aos de dedicarse, cabe sealar que este seria su segundo credito con el programa KIVA,. Doa Angela da inico en los creditos como toda perosna con deseos de superacion y la ncesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos incrementadno su capital de trabajo inicial, ella continua con su sueo de poder incrementar su negocio y darle un giro mas adelante de instalsr una pequea tienda. Por lo que desea contar contar siempre con el apoyo de nuestra institucion que lepermita ir desarrollandose economivamente e ir logrando sus metas propuestas, solicitando nuevamente para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Angela L., 53, is married and has three children, one of whom she still helps with schooling. The other two children are self-supporting. Angela makes a living selling new clothes, work that she learned by doing, having more than 15 years experience now. It should be noted that this loan would be Angela's second with KIVA. She started like everyone with the hope of getting ahead and a need for a little more income. By increasing her working capital, she's continued toward her dream of growing her business and moving a step closer to setting up a small shop. She's counted on our institution's support for what she's needed to develop her business and fulfill her goals which is why she's again asking for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es: La seora Bertha M. es viuda, por lo tanto es la unica que cubre con los gastos familiares, tiene a su cargo a tres hijos, el mayor se enuentra en la universisdad lo cual es un orgullo para ella, mientras que los dos ms pequeosan asisten a la escuela, vive en la ciudad de El Alto a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, en una vivienda muy humilde, de alquiler, es muy responsable con su rol de madre y se esfuerza por cubrir con las necesidades de sus hijos, El negocio que tiene es el de expendio de comida en un mercado de comidas, para lo cual trabaja desde muy temprano en la maana, este crdito lo emplear en la compra de vveres para reabastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha M. is a widow. As such, she is the only one covering household expenses. She has three children under her care. The oldest is enrolled at the university, which is a source of pride for Bertha. Meanwhile, the other two younger children also still attend school. She lives in the city of El Alto, approximately 30 minutes outside of La Paz, Bolivia, in a modest rental home. She is very responsible in her role as a mother and finds strength in meeting her children's needs. Her business is dispensing meals in the food market, for which she begins working very early in the morning. Bertha will use this loan to purchase food to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of food items

loan.name: Indiana Mercedes

texts.es: Doa indiana B., es un joven emprendedora, que tiene 29 aos de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, esta joven empredora seria su segundo tramite con el programa Kiva, con el cual ha sido beneficiada, como valorarn doa indiana es propietaria de un negocio donde se oferta ropa, cosmeticos por encargo, teniendo cinco aoas de tener dicho negocio, en esta oportunidad doa indiana tuvo una pequea mejoria en cuanto a incremento de su inventario inicial, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresoso fijo y con la cual pretende ir mjorando poco a poco su condiciones de vida al lado de su familia, ya que tambien ha hido fortaleciendo su pequeo negocio como es una pulperia, como podran valorar es una joven emprededora viendo y tomando cada uno de los retos de la vida, a fin de poder brindar un futuro digno a su familia. Esperando contar con el apoyo de todas aquellas personas que al igual que ella toman retos en la vida y cada uno de esos retos los traduce en negocios.
texts.en:
Indiana B. is an enterprising young woman of 29 years old. She is married with one son. This will be her second application through Kiva, with which she has benefited in the past. Indiana is the owner of a business where she offers clothes, and cosmetics to order. She has had this business for five years. With this opportunity Indiana will make a small improvement to her business by increasing her stock. Her business is the only fixed source of income for her family, and with it she hopes to continue improving her family's quality of life, little by little. She has been strengthening her small business, and it is obvious that she is hardworking person, overcoming the challenges of her life in order to provide a decent future for her family. We hope we can count on the support of those people who, like her, take on challenges in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Capital for increasing stock

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: La seora Juana C., trabaja en la venta ambulante de golosinas desde hace ms de 10 aos, su esposo es portero de una institucin educativa, y ambos aportan econmicamente para cubrir los gastos del hogar, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, formando una felz familia. Laboralmente la seora Juana se dedica a vender golosinas en la puerta de la institucin educativa en la que trabaja su esposo, especialmente en pocas de clases, ya que en perodos de vacaciones y al no haber venta, ella, deja de sacar crditos, para no fallar en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana C. has worked in traveling sales of snacks and treats for more than 10 years, and her husband is a doorman in an educational institution. Both contribute to covering household expenses. They have 3 school-age children, together comprising a happy family. Juana sells treats at the door of the educational institution in which her husband works, especially during the times when classes are held. During vacation periods when there are no sales, she does not request loans that cannot be repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Modesta

texts.es: LA SEORA MODESTA NO TIENE CON CASA PROPIA, VIVE EN UNOS PEQUEOS CUARTOS EN LAS AFUERAS D. LA CIUDAD, CUMPLIENDO UNA LABOR D. CUIDADORES D. UNA PROPIEDAD, DOND. LE PERMITEN CRIAR UN PAR D. VACAS QUE REPRESENTAN SU UNICO SUSTENTO PARA LA MANUTENCION D. SU FAMILIA, ADMS CRIA A SU PEQUEO NIETO, YA QUE SU HIJA TUVO QUE IRSE DEL PAIS PARA BUSCAR MEJORES PERSPECTIVAS ECONOMICAS. HACE TODO LO POSIBLE PARA ENSEARLE A SU NIETO RESPONSABILIDAD Y DARLE UNA BUENA EDUCACION EN BASE A BUENOS VALORES.
texts.en:
Modesta does not have her own home. She lives in small quarters on the outskirts of the city of La Paz, Bolivia, working as caretaker of a property. There, she is allowed to care for a pair of cows that represent the only sustenance for the family. She also cares for her small grandson since her daughter left the country to seek better financial opportunities. She does everything possible to teach her grandson to be responsible and to give him a good education as a foundation for good values.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fodder for cows

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doa Ana Maria tiene 37 aos de edad, habita en el barrio San Caralampio la Concha, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de edad de 5 y 13 aos de edad. Doa Ana Maria trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca desempendose como operaria, lleva seis aos en este puesto. El prstamo que esta solicitando Doa Ana Maria es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, es para poner piso de cermica en su vviienda y as lograr que este sea el primer paso para que ella empieze el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 37, lives in the San Caralampio la Concha neighborhood. She's a single woman with two children, 5 and 13. She has been working as an operator [machine operator, perhaps?] in a free-trade zone for the last six years. The loan that Ana Maria is applying for will be used to make improvements to her house. It's for installing a tiled floor in the house, a first step she hopes toward making it a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Install tiled floor.

loan.name: Sonia

texts.es: La seora Sonia Teran, comenz a trabajar con Emprender, en un grupo solidario, el ao 2005, empez con un drdito de 150 dlares hasta la fecha en que lleg a la dcima secuencia haciendos acreedora de 1.200 dlares, y por su responsabilidad a lo largo del tiempo es favorecida por el financiamiento con Kiva. La seora Sonia qued viuda hace dos aos, y desde entonces es ella quien se responsabiliza de la mantencin y estudio de sus dos pequeos hijos, felizmente segun refiere, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia. Tiene una tienda de barrio que representa su modo de vida, atiende a sus clientes con mucho respeto y cario, por lo que es reconocida en su zona. Hasta la fecha ella a demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sonia T. began working with Emprender, a Kiva working partner group, in 2005. She began with a loan of $150, and since that date has advanced to being deserving of her tenth loan in the amount of $1,200. Through her demonstration of responsibility, she has been favored with receiving financing through Kiva. Sonia was widowed two years ago, and since that then it is she who has been responsible for the costs of upkeep and education for her two young children. Happily, she can count on support from her family. She has a neighborhood store that is her livelihood. She waits on customers with care and respect, for which she is known locally. To date, she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: Doa Maura tiene 58 aos de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es soltera y tiene un hijo mayor de edad, que le apoya para los gastos del hogar. El negocio de Doa Maura es la venta de ropa y cosmticos, tiene treinta aos de experiencias y comenz con esfuerzos propios. Con el prstamo que est solicitando es para invertir en el negocio de las venta de ropa para ofertar variedad y estilo a sus clientes. Sus planes futuros es poder terminar de construir un anexo en su vivienda, para luego alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura is 58 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Ticuantepe, is single, and has an adult son, who helps her with the household expenses. Mrs. Mauras business is selling clothes and cosmetics. She has 30 years of experience and began the business with her own efforts. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of clothing to offer variety and style to her clients. Her future plans are to be able to finish building an annex in her home, and then to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy clothes to invest in her business

loan.name: Ana Mara

texts.es: La seora Ana Mara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin, tiene 46 aos y vive en la calle Espelucn Manzana 2 Lote 4 del pueblo joven Aurora Daz, distrito Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Per. Curs hasta el tercer ao de secundaria y ya no sigui estudiando porque se comprometi y form una familia, tuvo 4 hijos y ahora tiene un segundo compromiso con el seor Luis Ramrez Lujn y tienen una hija que an es una nia. Ana Mara tuvo que trabajar mucho para mantener a sus hijos, gracias a su madre ella aprendi el negocio de la venta de comida y es as como se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo comida a seores que abastecen combustible. Incursion en la venta de combustible para las embarcaciones. Una parte de su negocio lo tiene en su casa y la otra en la Avenida Petroper. Su primer crdito fue de 300 soles que se devolvieron en 4 meses y pudo implementar su negocio. Con este crdito de 1700 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en combustible. Suea con poner un gran restaurant.
texts.en:
Ana Maria belongs to the Las Auroras en Accion community bank. She is 46 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished three years of high school but left to get married and start a family. She had 4 children and later married her second husband, Luis Ramirez Lujan, with whom she has a young daughter. Ana Maria had to work very hard to provide for her children. Thanks to her mother, she learned about food sales and that's how she started her small business selling food to women who supply fuel. She then charged into the sale of fuel for boats. One part of her business is located in her house and the other part on the Avenida Petroperu. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she repaid in 4 months and used to start her business. With this loan of 1700 soles, to be repaid in 6 installments, she plans to invest in fuel. She dreams of setting up a nice restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in fuel for resale.

loan.name: Benny Margarita

texts.es: La seora Benny Margarita tiene 27 aos de edad y vive en Manuel Cox 132 en el Pueblo Joven Aurora Daz del distrito de Salaverry, en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Per. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin y es la tesorera. Benny estudiaba Tcnica contable en el Instituto San Luis, pero ya no pudo continuar debido a que tuvo un embarazo de alto riesgo. Tiene un hijo que depende de ella. Empez su negocio vendiendo marcianos, luego increment con mazamorra, cachanga, etc. Gracias al prstamo de Manuela Ramos ha incrementado su negocio y compr una vitrina y de esa manera se super con la venta de abarrotes y golosinas. Su negocio funciona en su casa. Su primer prstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, con los que increment su negocio. Con este crdito de 1200 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertir en comprar abarrotes y golosinas, luego viajar a Lima para comprar ropa interior. Benny suea en ser profesional y tener un gran negocio, piensa que s lo lograr porque es una mujer emprendedora que logra lo que se propone.
texts.en:
Ms. Benny Margarita is 27 years old and lives at 132 Manuel Cox in Pueblo Joven Aurora Diaz in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the department of Libertad, Per. She is a member and treasurer of village bank "Las Auroras en Accion". Benny was studying a two year accounting course at the San Luis Institute, but could not continue because of a high risk pregnancy. Her son depends directly on Benny. She began her business selling flavored ice, later expanding to sell a purple corn dessert and other sweets. Thanks to her loan from Manuela Ramos, Benny has improved her business, purchased a new display case and in this manner increased her sales of groceries and sweets. Benny runs her business out of her home. Her first loan was for 300 soles returned over 4 months, which she used to grow her business. With this loan of 1200 soles, to be paid back in 6 months, Benny will invest in the purchase of groceries and candies. Later she will travel to Lima to purchase interior garments, also for resale. Benny dreams of obtaining a professional degree and having a big business. She thinks that someday she will reach her goals because she is entrepreneurial woman that achieves her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Grocery sales and assorted sweets

loan.name: Eva Emperatriz

texts.es: La seora Eva Emperatriz pertenece al banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin del Pueblo Joven Aurora Daz y tambin pertenece al Club D. Madres. Vive en la calle Antenor Orrego 197 del pueblo joven Aurora Daz, en el distrito D. Salaverry, en la provincia D. Trujillo, en el departamento D. La Libertad Per. Eva estudi secundaria completa, pero ya no continu estudiando porque se cas con Jos Valdivieso y tuvieron 6 hijos. Falleci una nia cuando era pequea y ahora son solo 5 hijos, pero ya ninguno depenD. D. ella. Inici y contina su negocio comprando y vendiendo ropa interior y tambin elabora artesana por pedido. Realiza el negocio en su propia casa. Su primer crdito fue D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, lo que fue invertido en mercadera. Con este crdito D. 300 soles, el cual ser cancelado en cuatro meses, desea invertir en mercaderas diversas. Su sueo es poner un negocio D. zapatos en Piura.
texts.en:
Eva Emperatriz is a member of the "Las Auroras en Accion del Pueblo Joven Aurora Diaz" community bank and she is also a member of the Mothers' Club. She lives in 197 Antenor Orrego in the city of Pueblo Joven Aurora Diaz, in the district of Slaverry, in the province of Trujillo within the region of La Libertad in Peru.

She completed high shcool, but she did not keep going because she became married. She and Jose Valdivieso had 6 children. One of her daughters passed away when she was little so now they only have 5 children, but none of them are dependent on her anymore.

She buys and sells clothing and crafts by taking orders.She manages her business from her own home. Her first loan, amounting to 300 soles, was repaid in 4 terms and she invested the funds in purchasing more merchandise.

With this loan amounting to 300 soles, which will also be repaid in 4 terms, she will invest the funds in purchasing various items.

Her dream is to set up a shoe store in Piura.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise.

loan.name: Ivn

texts.es: El Sr. Ivan tiene 36 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y le tienen dos hijos que son menores de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Ivan es taxista tiene diez aos de experiencia, y diariamente lucha por poder llevar el sustento a la familia ya que l es el nico proveedor de ingresos. Con el dinero que est solicitando es para mejoras de su vivienda para hacer reparaciones a su casa, ya que con este invierno el agua se le est filtrano por las paredes y techo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ivan is 36 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Medardo Andina in Ticuantepe, is married, and has two young children. His spouse is a housewife. Ivan is a taxi driver and has ten years of experience. Every day, he fights to be able to give sustenance to his family since he is the familys only source of income. With the money that he is requesting, he will improve and repair his home, because this winter the water is leaking through the walls and roof.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To repair his home

loan.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La seora Isabel Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras En Accin, tiene 35 aos de edad y vive en la manzana A lote 15D del sector Luis Alberto Snchez del Pueblo Joven Aurora Daz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Per. Curs hasta el tercer ao de secundaria y ya no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de medios econmicas. Despus de un tiempo se cas con Mauro Teque y tiene 3 hijos que an dependen de ella. Recuerda que empez vendiendo en un coche de bebe, donde colocaba su caja plstica para marcianos y venda por donde se poda ir, luego cambi el cochecito de beb por un triciclo y ella se trasladaba para poder realizar su negocio. Ahora tiene un puesto de madera rodante donde vende sus productos diversos. Con el primer prstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas, lo invirti en gaseosa y pasteles. Con este crdito de 400 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 4 cuotas, incrementar su negocio comprando gaseosa y golosinas. Cristina suea con crear una empresa muy grande para dar empleo a mucha gente que lo requiera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel Cristina belongs to the Las Auroras En Accin Community Bank. She is 35 years old and lives in the Block A, Lot 15D of the area of Luis Alberto Snchez, in the town of Joven Aurora Daz, Salaverry, Trujillo in La Libertad, Per. She studied until the third year of high school and could not continue her education because of a lack of financial means. After some time, she married Mauro Teque. She has 3 children that still depend on her. She remembers that she began selling in a baby carriage, where she put her plastic box for her products and sold them wherever she went. Later, she replaced the baby carriage for a tricycle, and she went forward in being able to carry out her business. Now she has a wooden, rolling stall where she sells her diverse products. She repaid her first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She invested it in soda and sweets. With this loan of 400 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will grow her business by buying soda and sweets. Cristina dreams of creating a very large enterprise that can employ many people who need jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy soda and sweets

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La seora Alejandra M. es cliente de Emprender desde el ao 2002, comenz con el grupo solidario "Eleccin" con quienes trabajo durante quince secuencias de crdito. Ella tiene tres hijos, los dos ltimos le ayudan en el negocio. La seora Alejandra, vive en una propiedad en calidad de cuidadora, sin embargo con lo que gan en el ltimo tiempo, pudo comprarse un terreno en el area rural, su esposo trabaja con una volqueta sacando arena del rio. Ahora se individualiza por el monto solicitado, para utilizar su crdito en refacciones para su terreno.
texts.en:
Alejandra M. has been an Emprender client since 2002. She began with the Eleccion ("Choice") group with whom she worked for fifteen credit cycles. She has three children, the two youngest of whom help her with her business. Alejandra lives in Calidad de Cuidadora but with money she earned recently she was able to buy a plot of land in a rural area. Her husband works extracting sand from the river. She's applying for a loan to make improvements to her land.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Improvements to land for growing crops.

loan.name: Jenina Lidia

texts.es: La seora Jenina Lidia A. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin, tiene 22 aos y vive en la Manzana A lote 15 del sector Luis Alberto Snchez del pueblo joven Aurora Daz , distrito Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Per. Jenina Lidia estudi educacin secundaria completa, pero ya no pudo seguir estudiando porque se caso con Andrs Rumiche Navarro, con quien tienen una hija de 5 aos de edad. Es una mujer emprendedora e incursiona en diversos negocios actualmente vende productos de belleza esika y de vez en cuando hace postres y queques. El primer prstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, recuerda que los invirti pagando sus deudas de los productos que haba pedido para tener stock. Con este crdito de 500 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 4 cuotas, piensa invertir en ofertas para tener stock. Jenina suea con ser Ingeniera de Sistemas y quiere llegar a ser profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenina Lidia A. I. belongs to the Las Auroras en Accin Community Bank. She is 22 years old and lives in Block A, Lot 15 in the area of Luis Alberto Snchez in the town of Joven Auroras Daz, Salaverry, Trujillo in La Libertad, Per. Jenina Lidia completed her high-school education, but did not continue with her education because she married Andrs Rumiche Navarro, with whom she has a five-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising, and she is going in to different businesses. At present, she sells Esika beauty products, and, from time to time, makes desserts and sponge cakes. She repaid her first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She invested the money by paying her debts from the products that she bought so that she would have a stock. With this loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she plans to invest in offers to have stock. Jenina dreams of being a Systems Engineer and wants to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in offers to have a stock of products

loan.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria de los Angeles R. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que tengo de realizar hace varios aos, soy muy responsable y tengo muchos deseos de superarme, de mi actividad dependen mis dos hijos uno de 12 y el otro de 7 aos de edad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para tener una mayor produccion y por lo tanto una mayor ganancia, mis clientes son muy biuenos ya que les gusta mucho mi producto y sobre todo que mis clientes ven mi producto muy higienico, es por eso que mis ventas son my buenas.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Angeles R.. I make and sell tortillas. I have been doing this for several years. I am very responsible and have many dreams of bettering myself. I have two children, a twelve-year-old and a seven-year-old, who are dependent on me. At this time, I need a loan to improve my production and earn more income. My clients are good since they like my product, and, above all, my clients think my product is very hygienic. As a result, my sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy limestone, salt, corn flour, firewood, and water

loan.name: Jessica Jackelin

texts.es: La seora Jessica Jackelin es la fiscal del Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin, tiene 31 aos de edad y vive en Aurora Daz manzana 2 lote 5 del pueblo joven Aurora Daz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Estudi hasta el cuarto ao de educacin secundaria, pero se embaraz de su pareja, el seor Ernesto Zelada Linares, con quien tienen 2 hijas de 14 y 7 aos. Jessica empez su negocio asocindose con su madre e incrementando el negocio que ya tenan, antes tenia la cuarta parte del negocio y actualmente tiene el 50% del mismo. Se encuentra ubicado en su casa. Recuerda que con el primer prstamo que fue de 300 soles el cual devolvi en 4 cuotas, compr tarjetas telefnicas y ropa interior. Con este crdito de 1,000 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, implementar su negocio con cerveza y otros artculos de primera necesidad. Jessica nos cuenta que suea con tener su propia movilidad para poder ir y venir de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jessica Jackelin is the public attorney of Las Auroras en Accin Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives in Aurora Daz, Block 2, Lot 5, of the town of Joven Aurora Daz, Salaverry, Trujillo, in La Libertad. She studied until the fourth year of secondary school. She and her husband, Mr. Ernesto Zelada Linares, were pregnant. They have two daughters, who are fourteen and seven years old. Jessica started her business with her mother and grew the business that they have. Earlier, she owned 25% of the business, and, at present she owns 50% of the business. It is located in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was repaid in 4 installments. With this, she bought calling cards and undergarments. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will supply her business with beer and other necessary goods. Jessica is counting on us to help her achieve her dream of having her own vehicle so that she can go to and come from Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy beer and other necessary goods

loan.name: Las Tiluchis Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO LAS TILUCHIS ESTA REPRESENTADA POR LA SEORA BEATRIZ, EN ESTE GRUPO NO EXISTEN FAMILIARES, PERO SI HAY UN PARENTESO D. AFINIDAD LA SRA. BEATRIZ Y LA SRA. MARIA TERESA SON COMADRES.LA GRAN MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO, D. PRODUCTOS PARA LA BELLEZA , VENTA D. COMIDA Y OTRAS A LA PELUQUERIA. ELLAS INDICAN QUE EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA PERO HACEN TODO LO POSIBLE PARA PODER VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS Y TRABAJAR HONRADAMENTE. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA HACER CRECER SU CAPITAL Y ASI PODER AUMENTAR SU UTILIDAD MENSUAL PARA EL SUSTENTO D. SU FAMILIA. LAS SOCIA YA TRABAJARON CON ANTERIORIDAD CON CREDITOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN LOS PAGOS Y EL TRABAJO EN GRUPO.
texts.en:
The "Las Tiluchis" group is represented by Mrs. Beatriz. In this group there are no family members, but there are friendships, as Mrs. Beatriz and Mrs. Maria Teresa are good friends. The great majority of the members are businesspeople, and sell beauty products, food or salon-services. The women indicate there there is significant competition, but that they do everything possible to sell their products and work hard. The loan is to increase the women's business capital so that they can increase their monthly incomes and thus support their families. The members have already received loans, and have experience in repaying them and working in groups.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Operations Capital

loan.name: Lucero

texts.es: La seora Lucero pertenece al Banco Comunal Auroras en Accin, tiene 38 aos de edad y vive en Manuel Cox Manzana 10 lote 7 del pueblo joven Aurora Daz, distrito Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Per. Curs hasta el quinto ao de secundaria y ya no continu estudiando porque se cas. Tiene una hija de 17 aos y un hijo de 14. Se inici vendiendo algunos artculos de primera necesidad, luego fue creciendo gracias a los prstamos que le hacia Manuela Ramos, que al principio los hizo sin que su esposo lo supiera, cuando l se dio cuenta ella haba tomado conciencia que como mujer puede ser autnoma y su esposo tambin lo entendi as. Ahora tiene un puesto en el Mercado Los Luchadores del puerto de Salaverry y es as como esta mujer valerosa surge da a da. Obtuvo un primer prstamo de 300 soles para devolverlo en 4 cuotas, con este prstamo es que ella hace crecer su negocio. Con este crdito de 1,200 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas invertir en el puesto del mercado Los luchadores. Su gran sueo es verlos profesionales y felices a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucero belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She is 38 years old and lives at 10 Cox Manzana, plot 7 in the village of Aurora Daz, in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertado, Per. She completed through the 5th year of secondary school, but stopped attending school when she got married. Lucero has a 17 year old daughter and a 14 year old son. She began her business by selling basic goods and later grew her business thanks to the loans she obtained through Manuela Ramos. At first, the organization gave her loans without her husband's knowledge, but when he realized Lucero had already proven herself as an autonomous woman, and her husband viewed it the same way. Now Lucero has a booth in the Port Fighters market in Salaverry, and like that this valiant woman works day after day. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles and returned it in 4 months, and with it was able to grow her business. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in her booth in the Fighters market. Her largest dream is to watch her children to grow up to be happy and professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her booth in the local market

loan.name: Mara Yolanda

texts.es: La seora Mara Yolanda tiene 40 aos de edad, vive en Manuel Cox 112, Pueblo Joven Aurora Daz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Per y pertenece al Banco Comunal Auroras en Accin. Estudi hasta segundo ao de educacin secundaria y no continuo debido a que sus padres no podan apoyarla porque eran muy pobres. Se cas con el seor Fernando Azabache y tienen 2 hijos, los dos dependen de sus padres. Empez su negocio vendiendo juguetes, luego empez a vender men y vea que renda ms, pero no tenia capital. Una amiga la invit a participar en los bancos comunales del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y desde ese da todo cambio tremendamente, la seora se capitaliz. El negocio lo realiza en su casa. El primer monto que recibi como crdito fue de 300 soles, el cual devolvi en 4 cuotas, y lo invirti en la compra de juguetes. Con este crdito de 300 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses, implementar su negocio con miras a mejorarlo. Su sueo es tener su propio negocio e implementarlo .
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Yolanda is 40 years old and lives at 112 Manuel Cox, in the village of Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertad, Per. She belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She studied through the second year of secondary school, but was forced to stop because her parents could no longer support her because they were very poor. Maria married Fernando Azabache and they have 2 children, who are their dependents. Maria began her business by selling toys, and later began to sell food as she saw that it was more profitable, but she did not have the capital. A friend invited Maria to participate in the Manuela Ramos Movement community bank and since that day everything completely changed, she capitalized. Maria operates her business out of her house. The first loan she received was 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, and used to purchase toys to sell. With this 300 soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in her business to improve it. Her dream is to run her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Improve her business

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es: La seora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin, tiene 40 aos de edad y vive en la calle Manuel Seoane manzana 8 lote 2 Aurora Daz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad, Per. Es presidenta del banco comunal y pertenece tambin al comedor popular de su sector. Nancy estudi hasta tercer ao de secundaria, sus padres la apoyaron hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Como toda mujer emprendedora continu estudiando y trabajando, pero le fue imposible continuar el cuarto y quinto de secundaria. Se cas con ngel Carranza con quien tiene un hijo y una hija, los cuales an estn estudiando. Empez su negocio vendiendo marcianos y alquilando su pequea piscina, luego empez a vender men y ahora est ampliando su negocio con miras de abrir uno en Vir. Actualmente su negocio se ubica en el local del comedor popular Pursima Concepcin donde es tesorera y se encuentra frente a su domicilio. Su primer prstamo fue de 300 soles, el cual devolvi en 4 cuotas y con el que ampli su negocio. Con este crdito de 1,500 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, arreglar su nevera y comprar una refrigeradora de segunda mano para ir implementando su negocio de Vir. Nancy suea con poner un gran restaurant turstico en Salaverry.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She is 40 years old and lives at 8 Manuel Seoane lot 2 Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Per. She is president of the community bank and also belongs to the popular cafeteria of her area. Nancy studied through the third year of secondary school and her parents supported her through the 6th grade. Like any enterprising woman, Nancy continued studying and working but it was impossible to finish the 4th and 5th year of secondary school. She married Angel Carranza, with whom she has one daughter and one son, who are still students. Nancy began her business by selling martians and renting her small pool. Later she began to sell food, and is currently expanding her business with aims of opening one in Vir. Currently her business is located in the building of the popular cafeteria Pursima Concepcon, where she is the treasurer, and is located across from her house. Her first loan of 300 soles, which she returned in 4 months, she used to expand her business. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will fix the freezer and purchase a second-hand refrigerator to use in her Vir location. Nancy dreams of opening a large tourist restaurant in Salaverry.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Fix freezer and purchase second-hand refrigerator

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es: L. seora Nancy es secretaria del Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin, tiene 43 aos y vive en L. Manzana 11 lote 3 Aurora Daz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Per. Estudi hasta el quinto ao D. educacin secundaria y ya no continu los estudios superiores porque se comprometi, ya con sus 4 hijos sigui estudiando cosmetologa. Dos D. sus hijos ya son independientes y 2 todava son estudiantes. Anteriormente trabajaba en cosmetologa pero se dio cuenta que alquilando redes D. pescar obtena mayores ganancias, as es que el capital que adquira lo inverta en comprar redes. Actualmente ese es su negocio, el cual lo realiza en su misma casa. Con el primer prstamo D. 300 soles, el cual devolvi en 4 meses, compr material para cosmetologa. Con este crdito D. 1700 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertir en redes y material para el mantenimiento D. chalanas. Nancy es una mujer que busca todo tipo D. negocios ahora suea con tener una buena mquina fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy is secretary of the Auroras in action community bank. She is 43 years old and lives at 11 L. Manzana, lot 3 Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of L. Libertad, Per. She studied until the 5th year of secondary school, but stopped when she got married. Although she has 4 children, she continues to study cosmetology. Two of her children are independents and two are still studying. Before, Nancy worked in cosemtology, put she realized that renting fishing nets afforded a higher income, so she used the capital she acquired to purchase nets. Currently this is her business, and she operates it from her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she returned in 4 months, she purchases cosmetology materials. With this 1700 soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase nets and material to maintain boats. Nancy is a women who searches for all types of work, and how dreams of having a good photocopy machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fishing nets and material to maintain boats.

loan.name: Nilda Elizabeth

texts.es: La seora Nilda Elisabeth tiene 59 aos de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin y vive en el jirn Gamarra 724 del puerto de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. La seora estudi secundaria completa pero no continu estudiando porque se cas con el seor Vctor Carrillo Fernndez y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella. Inici su negocio vendiendo comida al paso con una mesita en la calle. Con el tiempo progres y ahora tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende comida hasta los dos de la tarde. Su negocio se ubica en el Mercado Municipal de Salaverry en el puesto 4950. Su primer prstamo fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, los cuales invirti comprando servicio para su negocio. Con este crdito de 300 soles, el cual ser devuelto en 4 cuotas, piensa comprar material por docena. Suea con poner un gran restaurant en Salaverry y manifiesta que nada es imposible cuando uno se lo propone.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nilda Elisabeth is 59 years old and belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She lives at 724 Gamarra of Salaverry port, in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertad. Nilda studied through secondary school but did not continue studying because she married Victor Carrillo Fernandez. The couple has 3 children that are grown up. She began her business selling food in the street. With time she progressed, and now has a booth in the market where she sells food until 2 p.m. Her business is located in the Salaverry municipal market at booth 4950. Her first loan of 300 soles, which she returned in 4 months, she used to invest in her business. With this 300 soles loan, which will be returned in 4 months, she plans to purchase material by the dozen. She dreams of opening a large restaurant in Salaverry and believes that "nothing is impossible when one proposes it."

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Comprar material por docena.

loan.name: Santos

texts.es: La seora Santos tiene 57 aos de edad, vive en Manuel Cox 112 del Pueblo Joven Aurora Diaz del distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La libertad, Per y pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Accin. Santos estudi hasta el segundo ao de primaria lo que ahora equivale a tercer grado, porque su madre era de escasos recursos econmicos, no tenia pap y tuvo que trabajar desde muy nia. Se cas y hace 7 aos qued viuda, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 ya trabajan y solamente un hijo depende de ella, el cual es estudiante. Cuenta que empez su negocio vendiendo comida, luego vendi gas y ahora vende tambin cerveza. Agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos porque gracias a l se pudo capitalizar fcilmente. Su negocio tambin lo realiza en su casa, ahora cuenta con una socia. Su primer crdito fue de 300 soles, el cual devolvi en 4 cuotas, con el que increment su negocio y compr gas para volverlo a vender. Con este crdito de 1,000 soles, el cual ser cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en cerveza. Santos suea con ver profesional a su ltimo hijo, ya que a los otros no pudo darles profesin por razones econmicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is 57 years old and lives at 112 Manuel Cox in Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertad, Per. She belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. Santos studied until the second year of elementary school, which equates to third grade, because her mother was poor, she did not have a father and had to work since she was very young. She married, but 7 years ago was widowed. She has 5 children, 4 work and only 1 depends on her now because he is still a student. She began her business by selling food. She later sold gas and now also sells beer. She is thankful for the Manuel Ramos movement because thanks to it she could obtain loans easily. Santos operates her business out of her house, and now counts on a partner. Her first loan was 300 soles and she returned itin 4 months. With this loan she expanded her business and purchased gas which she later sold. With the current loan of 1,000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she plans on investing in beer. Santos dreams of watching her youngest son become a professional, as her other children could not become professionals for economic reasons.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase beer to sell

loan.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Seorita Silvia P. C., solicita este crdito para aumentar su capital de trabajo, ella es relativamente nueva en el negocio, ya que tiempo atrs ayudaba a su mam en otro negocio, actualmente ella se independiz y tiene su propio negocio de venta de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, por ser muy responsable, se acepta la solicitd de crdito al demostrar su aptitd emprendedora. Silvia Eugenia adems de ocuparse de la venta de fruta; estudia por las tardes en un Instituto de formacin profesional.
texts.en:
Silvia P. C. is seeking a loan to increase her working capital. Her business is relatively new since she used to help her mother operate another business. She is now independent and has her own fruit sales business in a market in La Paz, Bolivia. Her loan request has been accepted due to her demonstration of responsibility and an enterprising attitude. Silvia Eugenia, apart from her work in fruit sales, studies in the afternoons in a professional institute.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase working capital

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 41 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo de la ciudad de Managua, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 14 aos de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Maria Auxiliadora es docente de educacin secundaria, tambin vende cosmticos de manera ambulante y tiene una guardera en su vivienda.
