Tiene 15 aos de experiencia en la docencia y 4 aos de vender comsticos. El negocio lo inici con ahorros que tena ya que el salario como maestra era bajo. El destino del prstamo ser usado en la compra de ms cosmticos, porque desea incrementar el volumen de ventas. En un futuro desea poder ampliar el espacio de su casa en donde tiene la guardera
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 41 years old, lives in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has 3 children of 18, 15, and 14 years of age, who are currently in school. Maria is a teacher of secondary education and also sells cosmetics on foot and has a day-care in her home. She has been teaching for 15 years and selling cosmetics for 4 years. She started the business with savings she had, since her salary as a teacher was very low. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more cosmetics, because she would like to increase sales volume. In the future she hopes to be able to add on to her home where she has the day-care.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To Purchase cosmetics (to sell)

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 aos, ella y su esposo tuvieron 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora solo 2 estn con ellos y estudian en el colegio de su pueblo. Rosita es una madre muy activa, en horas de la maana prepara desayuno y a la vez cocina el almuerzo, despus tiene que salir a comprar pltano o sacarlo de su propio huerto, luego procede a colocarlos en sus cajones, para llevarlos a un mercado de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a sembrar caf, maz, yuca, frjoles y pltano. Cuando es temporada de siembra, apoya a su esposo. Lo que ms le gusta es ganar lo adecuado segn su trabajo, lo dificultoso es el precio del transporte de sus cajones de pltano, que es muy alto y tiene que recuperarlo en la venta de la fruta. Ella y su esposo tienen que trabajar en sus actividades porque sino no les alcanza para el men diario y para los gastos de sus hijos menores que aun les falta estudiar, y como padres quieren darles lo mejor. El prstamo que ha solicitado ser invertido en cajones y la otra parte en la compra de pltanos en mayor cantidad. Adems dedicarse a sembrar ella misma, para no tener que comprar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old. She and her husband have 9 children, of whom only 2 now live with them and study in the high school in their town. Rosita is a very active mother. In the morning, she makes breakfast and, at the same time, she cooks lunch. Later, she has to go to buy bananas or take them from her own garden. Then she puts them in boxes to take them to a market in the city. Her husband sows coffee, corn, yucca, beans, and bananas. When is the sowing season, she helps her husband. What she likes most is to earn a sufficient amount after her work. The difficult thing is the price of transportation for the boxes of bananas, which is very high. She has to recover that when she sells the fruit. She and her husband have to work because otherwise they wont have enough to pursue their daily activities and for the expenses for their young children, who are still studying. As their parents, they have to give them the best. This loan will be invested into boxes and the purchase of more bananas. In addition, she will sow herself, so that they dont have to hire other people.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more bananas to sell and boxes for transport

loan.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 52 aos, un padre muy responsable, mas an, cuando la madre de sus hijos los abandon, desde entonces su mayor anhelo es darles una buena educacin a ellos. En horas de la maana, todos das prepara los alimentos de sus hijos, y luego se va a trabajar a su chacra hasta horas de la noche. Desde muy nio se dedic al campo, le gusta la actividad que realiza, pero lo que le falta son herramientas adecuadas para sus cultivos, aun as ha sembrado maz con dificultades. Alfredo se desvela por la educacin de sus hijos desde hace tres aos, ellos son el motivo de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Desea adquirir herramientas de trabajo para la chacra, que le permitan limpiar de su chacra, de ese modo agrandar sus tierras para ser mejor aprovechadas.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is an exceptionally responsible father. When the mother of his children abandoned them, he decided that he would provide the children with the best possible education. In the early hours of each day, he fixes meals for the children and then sets out to work his land, working until nightfall. He's been farming since he was a small boy, work that he likes. He needs better tools to cultivate his land, though, because he can only plant maize now with difficulty. Alfredo worries day and night about his children's education; they're the reason for his sweat and toil. He wants to buy work tools for the farm so that he can clear it. By clearing it, he can expand his land and better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy tools for farming business.

loan.name: La Roca Group

texts.es: Hola nosotras somos el grupo LA ROCA, nos dedicamos al comercio, juntas hemos trabajado por varios aos como grupo, somos mujeres luchadoras y tambien somos vecinas de nuestra colonia, nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma: Nitida A.: me dedico a la fabricacion de Nacatamales de pollo y cerdo, tengo varios aos de vender este tipo de comida, que en nuestro pais la gente come mucho los nacatamales, Sara P.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la cual le va muy bien, pero necesita tener mas productos en su negocio porque las necesidades de sus clientes son enormes. Magda G.: ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos, este negocio es muy bueno porque en nuestro pais todas las amas de casa y la gente de produce comidas utilizan mucho los condimentos que es lo que le da el sabor a las comidas. en estos momentos todas nosotras necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios por tal razon estamos solicitando dicho credito.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group "The Rock", and we work in sales. As a group, we have worked together for many years. We are fighting women and neighbors in our village. Our group works like this: Nitida A., I make chicken and pork Nacatamales, and I have been selling this kind of food for many years. The people of our country eat Nacatamales all the time! Sara P., She sells popular consumption goods. She has a store in her home that is doing very well, but she needs more products in her business because the needs of her clients are enormous. Magda G.: she sells condiments. This is a ery good business because in our county all the women of the home and people that produce food to sell use a lot of condiments to give flavor to their food. At this time all of us need loans to be able to move ahead with our business, which is why we are requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of goods to supply a store, Purchase of supplies to make Nacatamales and condiments.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of cattle feed.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: La sra. Julia, ella se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la compra y venta de ropa y productos varios, los comercializa en las ferias de las ciudades de Uyuni y Oruro en el interior de la repblica de Bolivia, vive en la casa de su mam junto a su hermano, quien siempre la apoya, la sra. hace el papel de padre y madre para sus hijos quienes estn en edad escolar, ya que es madre soltera, quienes le ayudan en todo lo que pueden. Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. El crdito ser invertido en la compra de chompas ya que se inicia el periodo de lluvias.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia has been buying and selling clothing and various products for a long time. She sells her goods in the open market fairs in the cities of Uyuni and Oruro in the middle of the Bolivian Republic. She live in her mother's home with her brother, who is always supportive of her. Julia plays the role of mother and father for her children who are school-aged. She is a single mother who helps her children in every way she can. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raincoats since the rainy season has begun.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of jackets (raincoats)

loan.name: David Hernn

texts.es: David tiene 32 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casado tiene tres hijos. David tiene una pequea pulpera en su casa de habitacin y tambin un sala de video ubicada tambin en su vivienda. Tiene 2 aos de tener la pulpera y debido a la falta de financiamiento se le ha hecho difcil poder crecer. Inici solamente con la sala de video juegos, y gracias a unos ahorros puso la pulpera. El prstamo ser usado para comprar un play satation para la sala de video juegos y granos bsicos para la pulpera, y as de poquito a poquito invertir en ambos negocios. Sus planes son poder incrementar el inventario de su pulpera para as satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married and has three children. David has a small convenience store in his house as well as a video game store. He has had the convenience store for 2 years but for lack of financing it has difficult for him to grow. He started out with only the video game store and thanks to some savings, put in the convenience store. This loan will be used to buy a playstation for the video game store and some staple goods for the convenience store; in this way he will invest a little in both businesses. He plans are to be able to increase the convenience stores inventory so he can meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a playstation and staple goods

loan.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 38 aos, l y su esposa tienen tres hijos, todos ellos son oriundos de la zona llamada Nagazu. Durante toda su vida se dedic al cultivo de sus tierras, siembra caf, pltano y tambin en esta temporada ha sembrado caigua, l creci con las actividades de la chacra, porque su padre fue agricultor, conoce cmo y cundo tiene que ir cultivando a cada producto. Le agrada mucho el cuidado de cada planta, porque cada proceso es diferente, pero siente una gran incomodidad por los precios del guano de isla y dems fertilizantes por que invierte mucho y gana muy poco. Pero sus sueos estn en la agricultura, con el tiempo le gustara tener una casa de material noble y no de maderas, como ahora. El y su esposa se esfuerzan para adquirir su propia casa, y tener qu heredarles a sus hijos, asimismo darles una buena educacin, que ellos no pudieron tener. Con el dinero abonar su chacra de caigua para la floracin y de ese modo agarre fruto, tambin sembrar mas pacay en su huerto. Si cumple con todo el abonado y el fumigado de la caigua y se desarrolla bien y esto le permitir cosechar en gran cantidad para el verano y tener un buen precio.
texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old, he and his wife have three children, all of them born in the Nagazu area. His entire life has been devoted to cultivating his fields. He plants coffee, bananas and also during this season he plants caigua (a vine which grows a small gourd-shaped fruit, used as a vegetable). He grew up with farming activities because his father was a farmer, and he knows how and when to grow each product. He likes taking care of the plants because the process for each is different. He is concerned about the price of guano (manure from sea birds) and other fertilizers because he invests a lot and earns very little. But his dreams are based on farming. In time he would like to have a house made of solid material, not of wood as he now has. He and his wife are trying to buy their own house so they have something to leave as an inheritance to their children as well as giving them a good education, something which neither were able to have. With a loan he will fertilize his caigua fields so they blossom and bear fruit. He will also plant more pacay (a Peruvian leguminous tree, cultivated for its large white edible pods) in his orchard. If he is able to finish fertilizing and fumigating the caigua and everything goes well, he will be able to harvest a large amount this summer and get a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loan.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, a sus 22 aos, es un padre de una hermosa nia, el y su esposa se dedican a veces a la compra y venta de ropa y en otras veces a la agricultura. Realiza diversas actividades, para generarse ingresos econmicos adicionales a los de su chacra, en temporada de siembra cultiva caf, pltano, etc., esta vez ha sembrado caigua, con la finalidad de cosechar en temporada de verano, donde tendr buen precio. Y a veces aprovecha de llevar algunas prendas para vender a las personas cercanas a sus tierras. La dificultad ahora, son los precios de los abonos, pero a pesar de todo le gusta sembrar, cultivar todo tipo de productos, conoce en qu temporadas se debe sembrar para sacar provecho del precio en el mercado. Luis por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra, por ello es que trabaja con mucho esmero para adquirir su propio hogar, y ms adelante adquirir su propia movilidad para que lleve al mercado lo que produce. El invertir en siembra de caigua, despus de 5 meses recuperar su capital y pueda ganar el doble, en enero cosechar y vender hasta febrero, temporada de buen predio de este producto.
texts.en:
Luis, at 22 years old, is a father of a beautiful daughter. He and his wife make a living buying and selling clothes at times and by farming at other timers. They take part in various activities to generate extra income for their small household, and during the planting season they cultivate coffee, bananas and other products. Currently Luis has planted a regional vegetable called caigua with the goal of harvesting it when it can fetch a good price. Sometimes he takes some clothes to sell to the people in the areas surrounding his lands. The difficulty now, however, is that the price of fertilizer is high, but he still enjoys planting and harvesting all kinds of products, and he knows what season to plant which product to make the most of it in the market. At the moment Luis lives in the house of his mother-in-law, so he works arduously so he can acquire his own place and later his own vehicle so he can transport his products. With the loan, he will invest in cultivating caigua, and in five months he can double his return. He will harvest it in January and will sell it through February, the ideal time to sell this product.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in cultivating caigua, a regional plant that will fetch good prices at the market.

loan.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola (38 aos) tiene dificultades en su economa, ya que ha tenido 8 hijos, de los cuales 6 estudian, ella y su esposo tienen que trabajar donde se les presente la oportunidad de ganar algo de dinero. Madruga para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, asimismo tiene que cocinar el almuerzo temprano, para ir a la chacra con su esposo, no solo se dedican a su propia chacra; sino tambin, trabajan como jornales para los cultivos de otras personas. Siembran granadillas y caf, pero esta vez quieren incursionar en la siembra de caigua, por que demora solo 4 meses en producir, y les deja una buena ganancia, sobre todo en tiempo de verano, a ella le agrada mucho el negocio, cuando ya no est en la chacra, lleva sus productos a los mercados, mientras tanto, su esposo (en la foto nos muestra una caja de cerveza) se queda en casa vendiendo gaseosas, algunos bocaditos y cervezas, lo ms dificultoso para ellos es la falta de capital, pero igual no pierden las esperanzas de mejorar su casa y poder tener una bodega con el tiempo. Lola y su esposo trabajan tanto en la chacra o en otra actividad que se presente, con la finalidad de educarlos a sus 6 hijos en etapa escolar. Con el dinero del prstamo, invertirn en la siembra de caigua porque justamente saldra para la poca del verano, donde su precio es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Lola, who is 38 years old, is having difficult times economically. Six of her eight children are in school, and she and her husband have to work where there are opportunities to make some money. She gets up very early to make breakfast for her kids and also makes lunch before she heads off to her farmland with her husband. She doesn't work exclusively on her own land, but also also works as a day laborer on other people's crops. She cultivates passion fruit and coffee, but this time she also wants to include caigua, a regional plant that will take only four months to produce with high margins, especially in the summer. Lola is very pleased with her business. When she isn't in the fields, she takes her products to the local markets. Meanwhile her husband (holding the box of beer in the photo) stays at home selling soft drinks, sandwiches and beer. The most difficult thing for them is a lack of capital, but they have not lost hope of improving their home and, with time, opening up a bodega. Lola and her husband work so hard on their fields and their other activities with the goal of providing for their six children who are still in school. With the loan, they will invest in the cultivation of caigua because summertime will soon come when their prices will be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her land to cultivate caigua, a regional plant

loan.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, a sus 23 aos, vive con su abuela de 70 aos, siembra en las chacras de ella, para de este modo mantener a la mujer que ha sido como su madre, es soltero y muy trabajador. Tiene plantas de pltano, demora en crecer un aproximado de 9 meses, una vez que cosecha, cada 15 das, se vuelve a cosechar. Esta actividad le genera ganancias para poder mantener a su madre enferma, que no vive con l. Su trabajo cotidiano es la chacra, desde que amanece hasta que cae la noche. Como todo joven, tiene el anhelo de estudiar mecnica, pero el costo no le permite an poder hacerlo. Para Lorenzo es muy dura la vida, tiene que trabajar en el cultivo de sus tierras, para mantener a su abuela que ya est muy anciana, y lo ms complicado es que tiene a su madre enferma que no puede hablar, y como hijo siente la obligacin de apoyarla. El dinero lo invertir en la siembra de ms hectreas de pltano, ms adelante quiere incursionar en la siembra de caf, porque considera que cuantos ms productos siembre, tendr mayores ingresos econmicos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 23 years old and lives with his 70-year-old grandmother. He works on her fields and in this way can provide for the woman who has been like a mother to him. He's single and very hard-working. He has crops of bananas, which take about nine months to ripen, and he harvests them every 15 days after that. This activity also helps him make money to provide for his sick mother, who doesn't live with him. He works daily in the fields, from sunrise until evening. Like many young men, his goal is to study mechanics, but he can't afford the costs. Life is very hard for Lorenzo, who works hard to cultivate the land to provide for this grandmother, who is no quite old, and what makes things more complicated is that his sick mother cannot speak, and as her son he feels obligated to support her. With the loan, he will invest in planting more hectares of bananas and later expand to cultivating coffee as well, because he feels that the more products you plant, the more income you can make.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Plant more hectares of bananas so he can produce more fruit

loan.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, a sus 24 aos tiene un hogar muy constituido, ella y su esposo tratan de trabajar en cualquier actividad para que sus dos hijos no tengan que pasar necesidades. Desde que se cas trabaja en la chacra, despus del medio da, viendo a los operarios y de paso apoya a su esposo, tiene en sus chacras sembradas dos hectreas de pltanos, que estn cosechando, asimismo ahora piensa incursionar en la siembra del caf, aunque dice que el caf se cosecha una vez al ao. Lo que mas le agrada de su actividad como agricultora es el tiempo de la cosecha, porque llega la oportunidad de llevar al mercado y ganar dinero y es la oportunidad de comprar lo que falta es un hogar. Pero le disgusta que ha veces se queda con su carga en la chacra por falta de movilidad, y adems cobran muy caro el transporte, a veces esto lo desanima. El motivo de su esfuerzo es adquirir cosas de primera necesidad para su hogar, y para su casa de madera, le gustara renovarla, por una casa de material noble, es su mayor anhelo. Ella tiene en mente de sembrar el caf por primera vez, este prstamo para ella, dice que es una bendicin, de ese modo lograr su objetivo, de aqu a un ao, podr cosechar y negociar su caf, de ese modo pueda crecer como familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, runs a model home. She and her husband try working at whatever they can find to make sure that their two children don't have to go without the things they need. Since her marriage, Ana has worked on the farm in the afternoons, overseeing the workers and helping her husband. She has two hectares of plantains that are being harvested and she's now thinking of jumping in to coffee growing though she says that coffee can only be harvested once a year. The thing she most likes about being a farmer is the harvest because it's the time of year when she can go to market, sell her crop and buy the things she needs at home. She hasn't liked having to remain behind at times because of a lack of transport, something that's very expensive. The motive for her efforts is buying the basic goods that she needs at home. Her greatest goal is to rebuild her wooden house with a better material. Her idea is to plant coffee for the first time. She says that this loan is a blessing for her, a way to fulfill her goal of being able to harvest and sell her coffee and, ultimately, help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Plant a coffee crop for the first time.

loan.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Alyeris habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah III etapa, tiene 24 aos de edad, soltera, actualmente estudiante de la universidad, la carrera de Administracin de Empresa, lo cual son muchos gastos, pues sus padres le ayudaron para que tuviera un negocio propio donde pudiera ayudarse con sus gastos, pues comenz vendiendo cosmticos a sus compaeras de colegio y ha logrado tener muchos clientes, ahora tambin vende prendas de oro, zapatos, al contado y al crdito, pues ya tiene siete aos en las ventas. Con el crdito que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construccin para realizar divisiones de cuarto y sala para tener ms privacidad con su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener una tienda con productos variados y terminar su carrera universitaria para lograr un trabajo y tener un buen ingreso.
texts.en:
Alyeris lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is a single 24 year old student, studying business administration at the university. Her schooling is expensive so her parents helped her start her own business to help with the costs. She began by selling cosmetics to other students at the university and she now has lots of customers. She also sells gold jewelry and shoes, partly for cash and partly on credit, and now has seven years in sales. The loan that she's applying for will be used to buy construction materials for subdividing rooms in her house so that she can gain more privacy from her family. In the long term, she wants to have a shop with various products and to finish her university studies so that she can find work and have a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Subdivide rooms.

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El seor Juan habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 44 aos de edad, se encuentra casado con la Sra. Mabel Tinoco Montenegro de 38 aos, ella es amada de casa; ambos tienen dos hijos que estn estudiando. Actualmente el seor Juan se desempea como contador en la alcalda de Managua, tiene un ao de estar trabajando para esta institucin, el desea seguir trabajando con los crditos que otorga AFODENIC, para seguir mejorando las condiciones de la estructura de su casa, por tanto la nueva solicitud de crdito por un monto de C$ 5,000 a un plazo de 9 meses, para la construccin de un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa, tambin tiene aspiraciones de seguir trabajando con mucha dedicacin para poder optar aun mejor cargo y seguir apoyando a su de familia y mejorar las condiciones su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital of Managua. Juan is 44 years old and married to Mrs. Mabel Tinoco Montenegro who is 38 years old and takes care of their home. They have two children that are in school. Juan is employed as an accountant for the city of Managua, where he has been working for one year. He would like to continue working with the loans offered by AFODENIC in order to continue improving the structural condition of his home. As such, he is requesting a new loan for $275 for a period of 9 months to build a wall in the front part of his house. He also aspires to continue working hard in his current job so he can take on better positions and continue supporting his family and improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a wall for his house.

loan.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: El seor Jos habita en el barrio tres ochenta, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 29 aos de vivir en su casa propia, el seor Jos tiene 41 aos de edad, se encuentra casado con la seora Marlene Haydee Cruz, que es comerciante vende refresco y repostera, ella le ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ambos tienen tres hijos de diferentes edades de 20, 19 y 16 aos de edad. Actualmente el seor Jos se desempea como operario de limpieza en la Alcalda Municipal, teniendo 8 aos de laborar en la institucin, el aspira poder apoyar a su familia a travs de ir mejorando su casa y poder en un futuro establecer una pulpera para obtener mas ingresos para su hogar, el crdito que esta solicitando es para poner techo a su vivienda, por tanto el esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 5, 000 aun plazo de 9 meses que es lo que requiere para la compra de zinc, puertas tablero y hierro para verjas.
texts.en:
Jose live in the 380 neighborhood in the capitol city of Managua. He is 41 years old and has lived in his own home for 29 years. He is married to Mrs. Marlene Haydee Cruz who sells refreshments and pastries, helping her husband with the costs of the home. They have three children of 20, 19, and 16 years of age. Jose is employed by the municipality, where he has worked as a sanitation operator for 8 years. He aspires to be able to support his family through improving his home and in the future to be able to open a general store to obtain more household income. The loan he is requesting is to put a roof on his home. He needs a loan of $275 for a period of 9 months. He needs the loan to purchase zinc, plywood, and iron for framing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To put a roof on his house.

loan.name: Efrain

texts.es: El seor Efran habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 39 aos, se encuentra casado con la seora Ftima Dvila que tiene 30 aos y es secretaria, ambos viven en casa propia y tienen un hijo de 7 aos que esta estudiando. Actualmente el seor Efran se desempea como oficial de la Polica Nacional, tiene 20 aos dedicarse a esta profesin, el aspira seguir esforzndose para seguir contribuyendo a la seguridad del ciudadano y continuar sirviendo a su pas, as mismo seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, por tanto solicita un crdito de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses, para la compra de cermica y poder ponerle a su casa, ya que con los micro crditos que se le han otorgado, el ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Efran lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital of Managua. He is 39 years old and married to Ftima Dvila, who is 30 and is a secretary. They live in their own home and have a 7 year-old son who is a student. Efrin is currently an officer in the National Police, he has been in this profession for 20 years. He wants to keep working hard to make a contribution to the publics safety and continue serving his country. He also wants to keep improving his familys standard of living. For this, he is requesting a loan for C$6,000 over a period of 9 months, to buy tiles and install them in his house. With the microfinancing he has received he has been able to make improvements to his home bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Install a tile floor in his home.

loan.name: Flor De Valle Alto Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Villa Adela, a ste pertenece la asociacin Flor de Valle Alto .Un grupo muy simptico y particular ya que adems de trabajar juntas de manera muy responsable, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. La mayora de ellas son artesanas, por ejemplo Arminda realiza singulares muecos en aguayo ( Aguayo; Es un tejido rectangular de lana multicolor que sirve para cargar los nios u objetos a la espalda, entre otras cosas), que luego los vende el la calles tursticas de la ciudad de La Paz; Julia realiza bordados de disfraces tradicionales, que los vende a pedido solamente. La asociacin Flor de Valle Alto necesita comprar materia prima para ampliar sus ventas, as sus ingresos mejoraran para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
Villa Adela is located in the city of El Atlo, and it is a member of the "Flor de Valle Alto" association. They are a very happy group and they are unique because aside from working together, they have also formed a very beauty friendship among themselves. Most of them are artesans. Arminda, for example, makes unique dolls made from Aguayo - Aguayo is a knitted material made from wool dyed in various colours and it is a fabric usually used to carry babies or objects on the back, as a sling. She sells the dolls in the tourist areas in the city of La Pza. And Julia makes traditional needlepoint costumes and she takes orders for them.

The association "Flor de Valle Alto" requires to purchase supplies to increase their sales, and in turn, to increase their earnings, all for the good of their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase supplies.

loan.name: Anabelle

texts.es: La seora Anabelle habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 43 aos, se encuentra casada con el seor Roberto chavarria de 48 aos de edad, el es tcnico elctrico y sastre trabaja por su cuenta propia, donde tambin apoya a su esposa en los gastos de la casa; ambos tienen 3 hijos de 7, 6 y 2 aos de edad que estn estudiando. Actualmente doa Anabelle se desempea como costurera y trabaja en el negocio de costura de la seora Claudia Ordez hace 4 aos, as mismo la Sra. Anabelle desea establecer su propio taller y trabajarlo con su marido, por tanto solicita la cantidad de C$ 8, 000 a 9 meses, para la compra de materia prima y de maquinas de coser y de esta forma poder establecer su propio negocio y a la vez ayudar a la buena educacin de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anabelle lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 43 years old and married to Robert Chavarria who is 48 years old. Roberto is an electrical technician and a tailor. He shares the household expenses with his wife. They have 3 children, 7, 6 and 2 years old, who are in school. Anabelle now works as a seamstress in a shop owned by Claudia Ordonez, something she's been doing for 4 years. She would like to set up her own workshop and operate it with her husband. She's applying for a C$8,000 loan, for 9 months, to buy basic materials and sewing machines so that she can set up her own business and, at the same time, help her children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy basic materials and sewing machines for tailoring business.

loan.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Adela, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociacin Las conquistadoras Un grupo muy simptico y particular formado por diez mujeres, trabajan de manera organizada hace un ao. Las actividades que realiza la asociacin Las Conquistadoras, son de todo tipo, una de ellas tiene una farmacia, otras realizan tejidos de chompas, tambin se dedican a venta de accesorios para el cabello, venta de maletines, venta de mandiles , entre otros. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, para poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In the region of Villa Adela, in the area bearing the same name, there is an association named "Las Conquistadoras". They are a very happy group of ten women that hae been working together for the past year. The occupations held by "Las Conquistadoras" are of all sorts: one runs a pharmacy, others knit shawls, others sell hair styling products, bags, and aprons, among others.

They have stated that they require working capital to purchase their products and supplies in wholesale, so to expand their businesses and to improve their earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Require working capital to purchase products and supplies wholesale.

loan.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: La seora Mireya habita en el barrio habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 33 aos, se encuentra casada con el seor Sergio Rivera de 37 aos de edad el es electricistas y trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento, ambos tienen 4 hijos de 16, 11, 9 y 7 aos de edad, los cuales estn estudiando. Actualmente la seora Mireya se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmticos, donde esta actividad la inicio con capital propio y con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, hace 10 aos que se dedica a este actividad y tiene el propsito de seguir creciendo con su negocio, por tanto solicita el crdito de C$ 6,000 para la compra de mercadera y poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mireya lives in he Hialia phase III neighborhood located in the capitol city of Managua. She is 33 years old and married to Mr. Sergio Rivera, who is 37 years old and is an electrician and works in maintenance. They have 4 children, 16, 11, 9, and 7 years old, who are all in school. Mireya sells clothing and cosmetics, a business she started with her own capital and with the goal of helping her husband with the costs of the home. For ten years she has performed this activity and intends to continue growing her business. As such, she is requesting a loan of $325 in order to purchase merchandise and to be able to offer more products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purhcase cosmetics and clothing to sell in her store.

loan.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es: El seor Denis habita el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 65 aos de edad, se encuentra soltero y tiene a cargo a su nieta de 18 aos, donde tambin el seor Denis desea trabajar con mucho esfuerzo, para apoyar a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la comercializacin de ropa y zapato; tiene 12 aos de ejercer esta actividad, comenz esta actividad con sus ahorros para poderlos invertir en su negocio, as mismo con la ayuda de los crditos que AFODENIC le ha proporcionado el ha incrementado su inventario de su negocio y desea optar a un nuevo crdito de C$ 3,000 a 9 meses, para la compra de mas mercadera y ofertarlas a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos de ropa y zapato y a la vez aumentar el volumen de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Denis lives in the Hialia III Etapa neighborhood located in the capital of Managua. He is 65 years old and is alone. He has assumed responsibility for his 18-year-old granddaughter and would like to work hard to help out his children. He currently sells clothing and shoes and has been doing this for 12 years. He started the business by investing his savings. In addition, with the help of from loans from AFODENIC, he has increased his inventory. He would like another loan for C$3000 over 9 months so he can buy more merchandise and offer his customers a greater variety in clothing and shoes, and at the same time increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy clothing and shoes to resell.

loan.name: Espigas De Oro Group

texts.es: La asociacin denominada Espigas de Oro pertenece a la familia de pro-mujer hace ya varios aos cumpliendo su tercer ciclo de crdito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo cuenta con 18 socias, que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crdito. Dentro el grupo la mayora son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos lastimosamente sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar la escuela. Ya que estos deben ayudar a sus padres en sus pequeos negocios. Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociacin como ser; la venta de comida, la venta de lcteos, ropa ligera, pero la actividad principal es la venta de papa, Lucia por ejemplo al igual que sus compaeras, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, vende este producto junto a su padre en el mercado de la Ceja (zona central de la ciudad de el Alto). La asociacin Espigas de Oro necesita de capital para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad econmica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association "Espigas de Oro" belongs to the same business family of Pro-Mujer. Many years ago they completed their third loan cycle. The association is located in the region of Los Andes in the city of El Alto. To date, the group consists of 18 members and they have shown themselves to be a well-organized group especially when dealing with their loan.

The members of the group are mostly married women with children, most of whom are school-aged. There are a few children that were sadly forced to leave school because their family lacked financial resources, and they end up helping the parents run the small businesses.

Many types of businesses are being run by the members of the group, such as: food sales, dairy sales, and clothing sales. But the most common business is the sale of potatoes. Lucia, for example, much like her other colleagues, she has been selling for a great long while alongside her father in the markets of Ceja (the central region of the city of El Alto). The association "Espigas de Oro" requires working capital to purchase products in greater quantities, with the aim of increasing their earnings to establish a better financial situation for their homes.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital to purchase products in greater quantities.

loan.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana tiene 33 aos, es madre de dos hijos de 12 aos y 10 aos, el padre de ellos, lo abandon hace muchos aos atrs, ahora vive con su nueva pareja, Omar, con quien tuvo un hijo, pero que lamentablemente muri hace poco. Era un jueves por la maana como siempre sala a vender rodajas de pias y tamales en su canasta, no presagiaba que su hijo caera al ro, despus de muchos das de bsqueda hallaron el cuerpo, ella quiso morir y no trabajar ms; pero aun le quedaban dos hijos y por ellos, trata de reponerse en sus actividades, por la maana prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo para sus hijos, despus sale a vender tamales y las rodajas de pias a los pasajeros de los autos. Le gusta mucho esa actividad, aunque hay mucha competencia dice, a veces lo que le dificulta es que no termina de vender sus tamales, entonces los deja para consumo propio, y sus ganancias bajan. Tras la desgracia que le toc vivir, trata de sacar fuerzas y trabajar por sus dos menores hijos. El dinero que est solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de pias y otras frutas para abrir una juguera en un pequeo local alquilado.
texts.en:
Giovana is 33 years old and is a mother of two children, ages 12 and 10. The children's father abandoned the family many years ago, and now she lives with her new partner, Omar, with whom she also had a child, but sadly the baby died shortly after. It was a Thursday morning and like always she left to sell pineapple slices and tamales from her basket, not knowing that her son would fall into the river. After many days of looking, the body was found, and Giovana wanted to day and not work anymore. But she still had her other two children, and for them she tried to resume her activities. In the morning, she prepares their breakfast and lunch before leaving to sell her foods to drivers passing by. She really enjoys the activity, even though she says there's a lot of competition and sometimes she has trouble selling all of her tamales, which she then keeps for herself, and her earnings drop. After the hardship she endured, she tries to stay strong and work for her children. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of pineapples and other fruits to open a juice stand at a small rented storefront.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Start a juice stand business

loan.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro M., 51, is a farmer who lives in Chrey Krem Village, Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1979. Currently, he earns approximately US$1.50 per day. He is married to Mrs. Ty Nhep, 52, who is a housewife; in other words, Ty stays home to care for their children and to cook food for the family. Indeed, Ty has a difficult task because they have eight children, four of whom are married while the other children are young and attend school.

Unfortunately, Saro's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 700,000 Riel (US$175) to purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop. Ty hopes the loan will allow him to increase his rice yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop

loan.name: Huor's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are six members. Mr. Huor S. is one member of the group and has been selected to be leader. Huor is 23 years old and he breeds pig to sell. Normally, he purchases piglets from other breeders and he sells them for slaughter after four months. Huor has been breeding pigs since 2005 and currently can earn around US$2.33 per day. He is married to Mrs. Nhem Beak and has four children. His wife is a roasted chicken seller in her local market. With his family growing from day to day, and needing to increase income, Huor wants to expand his amount of pigs to breed. Hence, he needs a loan of US$300 to purchase 10 pigs to breed.

The other five group members are:

1) Mrs. Sinan S., a young woman who sells groceries. She requests a loan of US$300 to purchase grocery inventory to sell.

2) Mr. Ret L., who breeds pigs to sell and requests a loan of US$300 to purchase more pigs to breed.

3) Mr. Kan K., who is a farmer and requests a loan of US$300 to pay for plowing farmland to grow vegetables and fruit trees.

4) Mr. Tey T., who is a farmer and sells chopped wood as well. He requests a loan of US$300 to purchase a machine to chop wood to sell.

5) Mrs. Sophal P., who grows vegetables to sell and requests a loan of US$300 for a pump to use for her vegetable crop.

This group of people live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loan.use: To purchase 10 pigs to breed

loan.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $65. She is hoping that by taking out her first loan, she will be able to expand her business and increase her earnings.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Harifa, Mtumwa, Mtama and Habiba.

loan.use: To buy more food to sell in her business.

loan.name: Mwatum's Group

texts.en:
Mwatum has had a shop selling dresses and shoes in Zanzibar since 2006. She is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., which enables her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $125. She is requesting this loan in order buy more dresses and shoes at wholesale prices to resell in her shop.

Mwatum will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Asha, Najma, Saada and Somoe.

loan.use: To buy more dresses and shoes to sell in her shop.

loan.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Christina D. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children, between the ages of eleven and twenty-three. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died. Christina has been running a business since 1996, selling maize. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Christina currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more maize. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and stock of maize. Christina thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy more maize

loan.name: Sothavy's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan, and there are four group members. Mrs. Sothavy Thom is one member of the group, and she was selected to be the group leader. Sothavy is 24 years old, and she grows vegetables on her farmland (behind her house) and later sells the vegetables at the market. By doing so, she earns approximately US$4 per day. In addition, Sothavy is married to Mr. Mak Orn; they do not have any children. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops. The other three group members are as follows:

1 Mrs. Sokhem P. grows vegetables to sell, and she also requests a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable crops;

2 Mrs. Chantha T. grows vegetable crops, and she seeks a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase fertilizer; and

3 Mr. Noeum C. has a rice mill, and he requests a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase rice to then grind for sale.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops

loan.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Vicky B. from Mwanza, married with two children, both 18 years old. Vicky has been running a shop since 2006 selling rice, beans, maize flour, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. Working at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and assisted by her son, Vicky currently earns about $100 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy additional maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Vicky thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves.

loan.name: Alijon

texts.en: Alijon has been in an agro-business for more than 6 years. He grows onions and wheat, and also has a business fattening cattle. That is how he supports his family. He wants to buy more fertilizers and use them on onions to get a higher yield. With the money from his yield and business, he wants to help his son to marry.

loan.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-five-year-old, Mary P. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of six and thirteen. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans.

Mary has been running an African print cloth shop since 2002. She works at the business for sixteen hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her sister. Mary currently earns about US$ 200 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more African print cloth. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Mary thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy more African print cloth for re-sale

loan.name: Monica

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Monica D. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of two and thirteen. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Monica has been running a business since 2000, selling fish. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Monica currently earns about 300USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she plans to increase her stock of fish. Monica thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. loan.use: To buy more fish to sell

loan.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira Baji is the wife of M. T. and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is a half hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Tahira Baji owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last eight years. She is the mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is 4 years old and her younger daughter is 2 years old. Tahira Baji's husband has a scrap business where he sells particularly iron. He has been in this business for the last 8 years. Tahira Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron for her husband's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tahira Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia Baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy iron for scrap business

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rose M. from Mwnza. Married with four children between the ages of three and ten, Rose has been running a shop since 2006. Assisted by her husband, she sells salt, soaps, sugar, eggs, maize flour, wheat flour, and biscuits. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, currently earning about $200 per month.

Rose is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy soda, water, lotions, soaps, vouchers, rice, cooking oil, and wheat flours. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Rose thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy soda, water, lotions, soaps, vouchers, rice, cooking oil, and wheat flour.

loan.name: Rahmani's Group

texts.en:
Rahmani Baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in a small area named Riwind o Kasur, Pakistan. It is a half hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Rahmani Baji is married for the last 30 years. She is the mother of five sons. All of her sons run their own barber saloon. They have been in this business for the last 10 years. Rahmani Baji's husband makes car seat covers and sells them in the market. He has been in this business for the last 22 years. Rahmani Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy chairs, a mirror and tools for her sons' barber saloon.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Jamila Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Parveen Baji and Khursheed Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy material (chairs, mirrors) for barber saloon

loan.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small area named Riwind outside the city Kasur, Pakistan. It is half an hour in distance from city Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruit and vegetable markets. Bushra baji owns a two roomed brick house and has been living in it for the last 8 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Bushra baji's husband has worked in a factory for the last 6 years. Bushra baji herself has a milk selling business. She collects the milk from a milkshop and goes door-to-door to sell milk at houses, and collects profit on a monthly basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She is applying for a loan to expand her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine to make embroidered dresses. Samina baji and N. Jehan baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Khatoon baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Mubeen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy more milk to resell

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Esther N. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Esther has been running a pharmacy business since 2006, selling medicines. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Esther currently earns about 350USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more medicines, such as Chestcof, Strepsils, Mucolyn, Hedex and others. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks of medicines. Esther thanks you for supporting her!

loan.name: Maryam M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Maryam Baji is the widow of M. Ishaq and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is half an hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Maryam Baji has been living in this area for the last 31 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a grocery shop. The next has a shuttering business. Her younger sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her daughter makes thread and sells it in the market. Maryam Baji also helps her daughter in making thread. She is applying for a loan to buy beams to expand her son's shuttering business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Suraiya Baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her clinic.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.use: To buy beams for shuttering business

Assisted by one employee, she works at the business for eight hours per day, five days per week, currently earning about $300 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $675 in order to buy a deep freezer, and in the future plans to increase her ice cream stock. Sophia thanks you for your support!

loan.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Bibi is the wife of M. A. and lives in an area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five daughters. Her younger daughter is in 11th standard. The others are working in a cotton factory. Nasreen Baji's husband works in a factory. Nasreen Baji herself makes thread and sells it in a market. She has been involved in this business for the last 6 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a thread-making machine so that she is able to make more thread and sell it in the market to earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy wood to make furniture to resell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy another bicycle for her bicycle rental business. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loan.name: Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Ameen baji is the wife of M. and lives in an area named Riwind in the city Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 9th standard. The next to her is in 7th standard. Her younger daughter is in kindergarten. Both of her sons are in 3rd standard. Ameen baji's husband runs a grocery shop. Ameen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes of her neighbors. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

loan.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou D. est un boutiquier de plus de cinq ans d'activits, il investit dans d'autres secteurs comme le "tangana" qu'il a confi d'autres proches parents. Il fait des chiffres d'affaires de vingt trentes milles francs par jours. Il est mari et pre de deux enfants qu'il entretiens bien grce ses diffrents bnfice. Ce crdit lui a permis de renforcer ses activits. Il a une boutique scat urbam mariste et au belvdre.
texts.en:
Mamadou D. has been running shops for more than five years. He invests in other sectors such as "tangana" which he entrusted to close relatives. His revenue amounts to 20'000 to 30'000 XOF (40 to 60 USD). He's married and the father of two children whom he supports with his various revenues. This loan will enable him to bolster his business. He has a shop in Scat Urbam and in Belvdre (Dakar Region).

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Retailing of various products

loan.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady T. est une commerante exprimente dans son domaine. Elle a toujours fait du commerce produits alimentaires depuis plus de dix ans. Elle est mre de famille et grce ses activits, elle entretiens sa famille et s'occupe bien d'elle. elle fait des chiffres d'affaires de dix quinze milles francs cfa par jours. Ce crdit accord va lui permettre de renforcer ses activits et augmanter ainsi ses bnfices pour le bien tre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady T. is a merchant with a good deal of experience. She has sold foodstuffs for more than 10 years. She is the mother of a family and thanks to her earnings, she supports her family and takes good care of them. She has a turnover of about 10-15,000 CFA per day. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to bolster her business and increase her earnings for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of foodstuffs

loan.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La seora Maria Nela habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 27 aos, se encuentra acompaada del seor Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, el se dedica a la supervisin de construccin, tienen un hijo de 7 aos. Actualmente la seora Maria Nela se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpera, donde vende al por menor diferentes productos de granos basicos, tiene 2 aos de tener su negocio, donde comenz con capital propio y en los ltimos aos ha venido trabajando como mucho esfuerzo para poder ampliar su negocio, por tanto recurre al micro crdito para solicitar fondos para incrementar su inventario y obtener mayores ventas, ella esta solicitando la cantidad de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para invertirlo en su pequea pulpera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Nela lives in the town of North Batahola, in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 27-years old and lives with her companion Mr. Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, who is a construction supervisor. Together they have a 7-year old child. Currently, Mrs. Nela has a business where she sells various basic grains. She has maintained this business for the last 2-years that initially started with equity. In recent years she has been working hard to be able to expand her business and has resorted to applying for a loan to increase her stores inventory and generate more sales. She requests a loan of $6,000 to be repaid in 9 months for her little shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more inventory products for her store.

loan.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es: El seor Armando habita el barrio Pantasma, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 30 aos de edad, se encuentra acompaado de la seora Reyna Isabel de 37 aos de edad, ella es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 aos. Actualmente el seor Armando se dedica a su pequeo negocio que es una pulpera donde vende diferentes productos de granos bsicos, hace 1 ao que comenz esta actividad, ya que antes se desempeaba como guardia de seguridad, pero decidi poner su propio negocio, por tanto desea trabajar con micro crditos para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y solicita C$ 5,000 a un plazo de 6 meses, para comprar mas inventario e invertirlo en su pulpera, del tal forma esto le permita tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Armando lives in the Pantasma neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is 30 years old and lives with Reyna Isabel, a housewife, who is 37 years old. They have two children, 10 and 7 years old. Armando now operates a small grocery business where he sells various kinds of basic foodstuffs. He started the grocery a year ago when he was working as a security guard because he wanted to own his own business. He wants to use micro-loans so that he can go on growing his business and he's applying for a C$5,000 loan, for 6 months, to buy more inventory and to invest in his grocery so that he can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy more inventory and invest in grocery business.

loan.name: Mara Jess

texts.es:
Maria Jess tiene 47 aos. Ella es Presidenta de la Asociacin de Mams Tejedoras y, no es para menos, suea en grande, a nombre de la asociacin: exportacin de sus productos de lana y tener una cadena de taxis; debido a lo precaria de su calidad de vida junto con sus 2 menores hijas, de 8 y 9 aos, as como de los nfimos ingresos que tiene a pesar de tener ms de 10 aos como tejedora.
Maria Jess requiere un prstamo de 500 soles, para poder contar con un mayor capital en aras de la prxima temporada navidea que le augurara mayores ganancias y, apreciando en la foto lo diverso de su arte, es algo que no nos quepa la menor duda.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is 47-years old. She is the President of the Weaving Mothers Association. She dreams great things for the association; in particular she wants to see the wool products the women make being exported and she wants a string of transporting vehicles.

Because of their precarious quality of life with her two young girls (ages 8 and 9), as well as earning little despite having more than 10-years of experiencing weaving, Maria Jesus requests a loan of $500 to have more capital in time for the approaching holiday season as she predicts higher future sales. Also, the loan will go towards furthering the diversity of art in photography, something she has no doubt will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build capital in anticipation of higher sales and to invest in photographic art.

loan.name: Mario

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Mario V., tengo 36 aos de edad, soy casado, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de electrodomesticos los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en la ciudad y sus alrededores tambien trabajo por encaargos, gracias a este negocio tengo mi casita y le puedo proporcionar la educacion a mis hijos, pero en la actualidad necesito mas inversion ya que se aproxima la navidad y en esta epoca las ventas son muy buenas y las demandas de mis clientes se estan incrementando mucho, tambien necesito tener mas variedad de producto. por tal razon necesito un credito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Mario V.. I am 36-years-old and married. I have a business in which I sell appliances, which I distribute as a street vendor in the city and its surrounding areas. I also work by taking orders. Thanks to this business, I have a house and can educate my children. Currently I need more investment since Christmas is coming, and sales are very good during this season. My customers' demands are increasing a lot. I also need more variety of products. For this reason I need a credit to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of electronic appliances for the home

loan.name: Aida

texts.es: La seora Aida habita el barrio Carlos Fonseca, barri ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 aos de edad, se encuentra soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Actualmente la seora Ada se dedica a la docencia, prestando los servicios de docencia en primaria y a la vez se dedica a vender cosmticos, donde tiene 3 aos de dedicarse a estas actividades, ella requiere de financiamiento para poder seguir creciendo con su pequeo negocio de venta de cosmticos y perfumes, por tanto esta solicitando un crdito de C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 8 meses, para la compra de mercadera y poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y a la vez de esta forma obtener mas ingresos y poder ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aida lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 54 years old and single with 4 children. Aida works as a teacher, lending her services to elementary school teaching, and at the same time, operates a cosmetics sales business. She's been operating the business for 3 years. She needs financing to continue growing her small business, selling cosmetics and perfumes, so she's asking for a C$7,000 loan, for 8 months, to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider range of products to her customers. She wants to increase her income and be able to help improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy cosmetics for resale.

loan.name: Eleazer Rafael

texts.es: El seor Eleazar habita el barrio Villa Reconciliacin, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 24 aos de edad, se encuentra soltero, actualmente el se dedica a la sastrera, donde apoya en el negocio de su mama, negocio que inicio con ahorros de su mama y el ahora lo esta administrando y a la vez dedicndose al trabajo de sastrera, tiene 8 aos de dedicarse a esta actividad, y el esta requiriendo de financiamiento para seguir apoyando a su mama en el negocio familiar de sastrera, por tanto esta solicitando un crdito por la cantidad de C$ 6,000 aun plazo de 6 meses, para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial y de esta forma poder un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en un futuro desea ir mejorando poco a poco el negocio de sastrera que tiene su mama, para poder ir incrementando sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Eleazar lives in the Villa Reconciliacin neighborhood, located in the capital of Managua. He is 24 years old and single. He is a tailor and helps with his mothers business, which she started with her savings and which he runs while at the same time working as a tailor. He has been doing this for 8 years. He needs financing in order to continue helping his mother in the family business and is requesting a loan for C$8,000 over 6 months to buy an industrial sewing machine so he can give better service to his customers. In the future he would like to make improvements little by little to the tailoring business that his mother has and to increase his customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loan.name: Perlas De Oriente Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Perla de Oriente, esamos ubicadas en el municipio de danli, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y hemos trabajado juntas siempre, ya que somos vecinas. nuestro grupo se integra de la siguiente forma: Santos H.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, vendo cosmeticos y ropa, actividad que realizo hace varios aos y atravez de este negocio he sacado ganancias para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y asi poder mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida. Maria P.: ella vende cosmeticos y ropa, tiene mas de 6 aos de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar, este negocio es su fuente de generacion de dinero, y con las ganancias que ella obtiene ayuda a cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Margarita F.: la actividad de ella es la venta de medicina popular tiene 2 aos de vender este tipo de producto, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir en su negocio e implementar nuevos productos. por tal razon nosotras hemos dedicido obtener un credito monetario para poder abastecernos de productos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group, Pearl of the Orient, and we are located in the town of Danli. Since we are neighbors, we know each other very well, and we have always worked together. Our group is composed as follows: Santos H.: I am the coordinator of the group, and I sell cosmetics and clothes. I started selling these products several years ago, and through this business, I have made profits to help with my household expenses and in order to improve our living conditions. Maria P.: She sells cosmetics and clothes and has more than six years of experience engaging in this type of business, which she performs while traveling and at home. This business is her source of generating money, and with the profits that she gets, she helps to cover household expenses. Margarita F.: Her business is the selling of popular medicines, and she has two years experience selling these types of products. She does not have sufficient working capital to invest in her business and implement new products. For this reason, we are dedicated to getting a monetary loan in order to supply more products and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For the purchase of goods, cosmetics, clothing, medicine, etc.

loan.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: La seora Maria Fedelina habita el barrio Walter Ferreti, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 aos de edad, se encuentra casada con el seor Nestor Zeledn que es supervisor, ambos tienen 4 hijos. Actualmente la seora Maria Fidelina se dedica a la venta de lotera y de productos naturales, hace mas de 13 aos tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde en conjunto de su marido han venido trabajan con mucho esfuerzo para poder siempre ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, por tanto esta solicitando un crdito d e C$ 10,000 a un plazo de 6 meses para comprar mas productos naturales y mas lotera, de esta forma poder incrementar su clientes y su niveles de ingreso para seguir realizando mejoras en la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Fedelina lives in the Walter Ferreti neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 54 years old and is married to Nestor Zeledon who is a supervisor. They have four children. Maria Fidelina currently dedicates herself to the sale of lottery tickets and natural products. She has been in this business for more than 13 years together with her husband. They put a lot of effort into their work in order to help their family and improve their children's quality of life. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $525 which she will repay in six months. The loan will be used to purchase more natural products and lottery tickets. This will allow her to increase the number of clients and her income so that she can keep improving her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase more inventory of natural products and lottery tickets.

loan.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Teniendo ya 74 aos, el seor Nazario cuenta con un solo trabajo desde hace 42 aos: panadero, que apenas le ha permitido subsistir con sus hijos y, como se aprecia en la imagen, an le es insuficiente para poder financiar el levantamiento de un lugar seguro para vivir en su propio hogar y, especficamente, un ambiente adecuadamente implementado para poder vender sus panes bajo su techo y no en triciclo como lo hace actualmente, viendo beneficiados as, su estado de salud as como los ingresos para tan noble negocio.
Es as que el seor Nazario solicita la cantidad de 700 soles para poder terminar de construir dicho ambiente en su casa en pos de alcanzar cierta prosperidad en lneas generales para con su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Nazario is 74-years old and has been working as a baker for 42-years. He barely makes enough money to support his children as witnessed in this picture. He does not have sufficient funds to raise a safe roof under which to live and sell his baked goods; currently he sells the baked good by tricycle and knows hell see sales and improve his health for this very noble business.

Mr. Nazario requests a loan for $700 soles to finish the construction on his home to create an atmosphere in pursuit of a certain level of prosperity, in general, for their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To finish the construction on his home to work out of his house.

loan.name: Fidel

texts.es: El seor Fidel habita el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 57 aos de edad, se encuentra casado con la seora Maria Solrzano, que es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos de 16 y 7 aos de edad, son estudiante de secundaria. Actualmente el seor Fidel es transportista, el tiene su propio taxi y el mismo lo conduce, tiene 30 aos de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde inicio con esta actividad alquilando vehculos y luego solicito un financiamiento para poder obtener su propio vehiculo y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos en su familia y prestarle mejores condiciones de vida a su esposa y sus hijos, por tanto solicita este crdito de C$ 7,000 a un plazo de 10 meses para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, ya que necesita comprar material de construccin Gypsum.
texts.en:
Fidel works in the region of Maria Auxiliadora, a region located in the capital city of Managua. He is 57 years old and he is married to Maria Solorzano. She stays home with both of their children aged 16 and 7 years, and they are attending school. Fidel is a taxi driver. He owns his own taxi and he drives it himself. He has been driving it for the last 30 years and he started out by renting a car. He later requested a loan to get his own car, to have a better income for his family and provide them with a better quality of life. He is requesting a loan of C$7000, to be repaid in a term of 10 months, to renovate their home. He needs to purchase building material especially Gympsum.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase building materials to remodel their home.

loan.name: Cynthia Milagros

texts.es:
Cynthia tiene 20 aos.
