Tras haber estudiado 6 meses, viene trabajando desde hace un ao como masajista dependientemente pero en mente tiene lo siguiente: primero, volverse independiente como masajista asociada con una amiga y, segundo, estudiar Terapia Fsica (3 aos de duracin) y complementar el curso de 6 meses que tom inicialmente, ambos proyectos, de realizarse, le depararan mayores ingresos econmicos para ella y su familia as como tranquilidad en su hogar, que la imagen de su madre mostrando su foto y tarjetas del trabajo hablen por s solas de la unin y pujanza de tan humilde familia.
Para lograr tales metas, Cynthia necesita de 500 soles en aras de volver sus sueos realidad y convertir esas perspectivas en infinitas y, con tan temprana edad, convertirla en paradigma de la mujer peruana emprendedora.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 20 years old. After studying for six months, Cynthia has been working for the last year as a masseuse, but with the following in mind: first, become an independent licensed masseuse with a friend of hers and second, to study physical therapy (a three year course) which will complement the original six month course that she took. Both projects she hopes will improve her family's income level and other factors such as the tranquility of her home, the image of her work that her mother shows in these pictures and cards, and the work skills that reflect the unity and strength of this humble family. To achieve her goals, Cynthia needs a 500 soles loan to help truly achieve her dream of owning of her own business and become, despite her young age, the paradigm of the entrepreneurial Peruvian woman.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To work independently and invest in education which will improve her income

loan.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La seora Socorro se dedica a la venta de limones, al contar con familia en el norte del Per, donde prolifera el cultivo de dicho fruto, viaja cada 2 semanas a traer mercadera y los expende a los ambulantes de la zona, lo cual le resta ganancias y, si tomamos en cuenta la coyuntura mundial y del pas mismo, es que los costos se encarecen (alza de los pasajes y precio de limones) y su ganancia se limita incluso ms, por lo que le urge tomar cartas en el asunto.
La seora Socorro necesita de 500 soles en pro de poder adquirir ms mercadera y poder viajar ms seguido para poder no slo vender dicha mercadera a los ambulantes sino a comerciantes de los mercados de la zona, logrando incrementar sus ingresos y poder optar por una calidad de vida mucho mejor para su familia y, en s, para sus 2 nietos a quienes adora y vela tanto por su salud y educacin.
texts.en:
Mrs. Socorro is dedicated to selling lemons. She lives with her family in the Northern part of Peru, where there is widespread cultivation of this fruit. She travels every two weeks to bring the merchandise to the bargainers in the area, though it reduces her earnings. Taking into account the environment and the country itself, the costs is great (for shipping and the prices for lemons), thus it limits things all the more.

Mrs. Socorro needs $500 soles to buy more merchandise and to be able to travel more frequently to sell not only to the bargainers, but to other traders in the market. She wants to realize more income and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family. She also wants the best for her two grandchildren that they may have good health and the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more merchandise to increase trade.

loan.name: Carmen Raquel

texts.es:
La seora Carmen cuenta con 10 aos de experiencia en tejidos, su arte ya vio tierra extranjera a travs de una de sus hermanas, por lo que ve un atisbo del sueo que tuvo cuando apenas se iniciaba como tejedora: exportar sus productos. Su trabajo es exquisito y el hambre de xito de Carmen hizo que fingiera un stand en plena sala de su casa en pos de promocionar parte de su obra.
La seora Carmen requiere 700 soles para poder solventar tan maravillosa creatividad volcada en sus productos, que irn destinados a la compra de lana de alpaca e hilo de primera calidad, digna de exportacin peruana.
texts.en:
Carmen has 10 years of experience in knitting. Her art has been seen in other countries through one of her sisters. This has allowed her to see a hint of the dream she had when she began knitting: to export her products. Her work is exquisite and her drive for success led Carmen to fashion a kind of stand in the living room of her home in order to promote her handiwork. Carmen needs a loan for 700 soles to buy high-quality alpaca wool and thread in order to afford to keep making marvelous creations worthy of becoming Peruvian exports.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy materials for her business

loan.name: Ana Mara

texts.es:
La seora Anita tiene 48 aos. Se dedica a muchas cosas que, ni en su conjunto, logran darle una calidad de vida adecuada a ella ni a su esposo taxista de 53 ni a su hijo de 12 aos que cursa el 1 grado de secundaria, componentes de su hogar. Anita cocina menes, lava ropa y, a lo que le dedica mayor tiempo y, obviamente, lo que le depara un mayor ingreso es a los tejidos de lana.
Estando cercana la temporada navidea, poca del ao en que ms productos de lana vende, es que solicita encarecidamente un prstamo de 600 soles para poder plasmar toda aquella creatividad en los tejidos por lo que el dinero financiara los implementos necesarios para su cometido.
texts.en:
Anita (or "Little Ms. Ana") is 48 years old. She engages in a variety of endeavors that collectively succeed in providing adequate support neither for herself, her 53-year-old husband who drives a taxicab, her 12-year-old son who is in his first year of secondary school, nor for their home. Anita cooks meals, takes in laundry and weaves items out of wool, an activity to which she devotes most of her time and which obviously provides greater income. Since the Christmas season is approaching, a time of year when she sells more wool products, Anita is urgently requesting a loan of $200 (600 nuevos soles), money that would finance the supplies needed to be able to translate all that creativity into finished products.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of supplies for the Christmas season

loan.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es: La seora Ivette habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 36 aos de edad, se encuentra casada con el seor Ofilio Castro, que es comerciante; ambos tienen 3 hijos los cuales estn estudiando, viven en casa propia hace mas de 20 aos. Actualmente la seora Ivette se dedica a la venta de ropa y CD, que inicio con esta actividad con su propio dinero hace 8 aos, ella ha venido creciendo poco a poco, por tanto requiere de crdito para invertir mas en su negocio y esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 20,000 aun plazo de 12 meses para la compra de mas inventario y as poder ofrecer ms variedad a sus clientes, ya que sus planes a futuro en seguir creciendo y desarrollando mas su negocio para poder darle una mejor estabilidad econmica a su familia.
texts.en:
Ivette lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood which is located in the capital city of Managua. She is 36 years old and is married to Ofilio Castro who is a tradesman. They have 3 children who are in school and have lived in their own home for over 20 years. Ivette currently dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and CDs. She started this business with her own money eight years ago. The business has been slowly growing and she needs a loan of $1025 which she will repay in 12 months in order to purchase more inventory and to sell outside of the country. Her plans for the future are to keep growing and developing her business in order to provide better economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase clothing and CDs.

loan.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La seora Carmen tiene 56 aos y hace 5 puso su bodega donD. expenD. albarrotes y cerveza, por mencionar los que le deparan mayores ingresos. Es una tienda que apenas le da para subsistir y, al estar delicada D. salud los ltimos meses, ha visto decrecer sus ingresos pero sin rendirse, lo que resalta lo fuerte y perseverante D. su persona, quien tambin, como otra modalidad D. ingreso se dedicaba a vender menes en su barrio pero su salud le impidi continuar paralelamente con dicha labor.
La seora Carmen necesita D. 700 soles para poder solventar la inversin en su tienda que, por campaa naviD.a, suele incrementar la demanda y tuviera que comprar la mercadera necesaria para la venidera temporada.
texts.en:
Carmen is 56 years old and 5 years ago set up a small store when she sells groceries and beer, to mention what gives her the greatest income. The store barely gives her enough to live on and because she has been in poor health the past few months, she has seen her income fall. She has not given up though, which underlines what a strong and persistent personality she has. As another source of income she sold meals in her neighborhood, but her health issues prevent her from continuing with that work. Carmen needs a loan for 700 soles to pay for investment in her store because during Christmas demand increases and she needs to buy merchandise for the coming season.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loan.name: Julia Estela

texts.es:
Habiendo vuelto al negocio de la venta de ropa por catlogo hace un ao, la seora Julia, de 33 aos, se dedicaba a la venta de zapatos pero, al ser muy caros los precios para el pblico, decidi dejarlo y enrumbarse hacia la venta de ropa, rubro en el que le va bien pero es consciente de que pudiera irle mucho mejor en caso de contar con ms capital para la compra de la mercadera. la seora Julia suea algn da con poder volver al negocio de zapatos para lo cual asegura contar ya con la adecuada cartera de clientes, consiguiendo as mucho ms ingresos y, por ende, elevar su nivel de calidad de vida junto con su menor hijo y esposo.
Es por ello que requiere de un prstamo de 700 soles y poder comprar mercadera necesaria para la prxima temporada de estos meses y emprender de ahora en adelante su vida, llena de juventud y ganas de crecer.
texts.en:
Having returned to the business of selling catalog clothing a year ago, Seora Julia, 33, used to sell shoes but, because the retail prices are very dear, she decided to change to selling clothing. This line is going well for her, but she is aware that it would go much better if she had more capital to buy merchandise. Seora Julia dreams of one day being able to return to the shoe business when she is sure of the adequate finances of her clients, with the much greater income that would result in raising her level of quality of life with her minor son and her husband. This is why she needs this loan of $250, to be able to buy the merchandise necessary for the next season, starting now to get ahead in life, full of youth and the desire to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise for the future Christmas and summer seasons

loan.name: Nelly Ruth

texts.es:
Con aos D. experiencia en la venta D. menes para gente D. su barrio y uno que otro cliente espordico, la seora Nelly junto con su familia han visto una gran oportunidad en la construccin D. cientos D. departamentos que se harn en su barrio, lo que incluye cientos D. trabajadores y es ah donD. entrara a tallar el negocio D. la seora: est casi cerrado un contrato con los mismos ingenieros para abastecer D. almuerzos a gran parte D. los trabajadores en los prximos meses.
Teniendo que comprar tapers, insumos para la preparacin D. sus comidas e implementar su cocina en s y con ollas ms grandes, es que requiere del prstamo D. 900 soles, algo que ansa junto con sus 3 menores hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
With years of experience in the sale of prix fixe meals for the people of her neighborhood and some sporadic clients, Seora Nelly and her family have found a great opportunity in the construction of hundreds of apartments that will be put up in their neighborhood, including hundreds of workers. This is where she started to build her business. She has almost concluded a contract with the engineers to supply lunches to the majority of the workers in the upcoming months. Having to buy candles, ingredients for the meals, plus putting together her kitchen with larger cookers, is why she needs this loan of $300, something she, her husband, and her 3 minor children are longing to do.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To finish setting up her kitchen and living room for dinner clients, plus meal ingredients

loan.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Con recin 2 aos D. haber puesto su bodega, no le es suficiente para poder mantener a sus 2 menores hijas, ambas en edad escolar, por lo que se las ha ingeniado para poner un puesto ambulante D. venta D. salchipapa y pollo broaster as como tambin reciclar distintos materiales para su posterior venta, todo este sacrificio lo hace sola y slo para brindarle una adecuada educacin a sus hijas.
Para ello necesita D. 1000 soles porque lo que le falta no son clientes sino los insumos que venD. y, con tan noble fin D. educar a sus hijas por sobre todas las cosas, es digna D. tomarla en cuenta.
texts.en:
Only two years after establishing her shop, she found it was not enough to support her two young daughters, both of whom are of school age. As a result, she has managed to establish a portable stall selling salchipapa (sausage) and fried chicken, as well as recycling different materials for resale. She makes all this sacrifice alone and only to proviD. an adequate education to her daughters.

For this, she needs 1,000 soles because what she lacks is not customers but products to sell. It is worth taking into account her goal of educating her daughters above everything. Con recin 2 aos D. haber puesto su bodega, no le es suficiente para poder mantener a sus 2 menores hijas, ambas en edad escolar, por lo que se las ha ingeniado para poner un puesto ambulante D. venta D. salchipapa y pollo broaster as como tambin reciclar distintos materiales para su posterior venta, todo este sacrificio lo hace sola y slo para brindarle una adecuada educacin a sus hijas. Para ello necesita D. 1000 soles porque lo que le falta no son clientes sino los insumos que venD. y, con tan noble fin D. educar a sus hijas por sobre todas las cosas, es digna D. tomarla en cuenta.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Stock her shop and have capital for her other business: selling salchipapa and fried chicken.

loan.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Con casi 3 aos D. puesto su local, la seora Norma, D. 52 aos, expenD. ah menes y cervezas para sus comensales pero, inclusive con estos 2 ingresos, le es insuficiente para tamaa familia: su esposo, su hija, cuado y 2 nietas, que son su fuerza, por lo que tambin recurre a una actividad mensual: vender pachamancas.
Ningn esfuerzo es digno D. sus nietas, D. su familia, por lo que la seora Norma suea con terminar D. implementar el ambiente del local, en su propia casa, as como tambin hacerse D. ms insumos para la preparacin D. menes y compra D. cervezas, para lo cual necesita D. 700 soles D. prstamo en aras D. poder brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
With almost 3 years in the same location, Seora Norma, 52, sells set-menu meals and beer to her clients, but these two incomes together are insufficient for the size of her family: her husband, daughter, brother-in-law and 2 nieces are her strength. Seora Norma dreams of completing the decoration of her business place as well as her own home, plus buying meal ingredients and beers, for which she needs this loan of $250, in order to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To complete her business place where she sells meals and beer, plus purchasing meal ingredients and beers

loan.name: Bella Mara

texts.es:
De 42 aos, la seora Mara tiene su bodega hace 15 aos, siendo la primera en el barrio, aunque esto no ha sido sinnimo de mejores ingresos, por lo que ha tenido que idearse otros medios de ingreso como la venta de cosmticos por catlogo de una conocida marca en el medio. La gran meta de la seora Mara es sacar adelante a su hija menor hija que cursa la primaria en el colegio.
Para lo cual necesita un prstamo de 600 soles en aras de incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarle la tan aorada buena educacin a su menor hija.
texts.en:
At 42 years of age, Mara has owned her shop for 15 years. Being the first in her neighborhood has not been synonumous with better earnings. As a result, she has had to come up with other means of income, such as selling catalog cosmetics from a namebrand. Mara's greatest goal is to help her young daughter, who is in primary school, get ahead.

For this, she needs a loan of 600 soles in order to increase her income and provide the much -missed good education to her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Acquire the necessities for her shop, such as completing its construction, beer, as well as cosmetics for resale.

loan.name: Irma Reyna

texts.es:
Como fundadora del barrio, la seora Irma cuenta con un gran respaldo y clientela en su comedor, se caracteriza por velar por sus hijos como pocas madres, por que no les falte nada, absolutamente nada y as es a pesar de la avanzada edad de 2 de ellos aunque la menor es su tesoro ms grande, quiere darle lo mejor de lo mejor y, es as que, se dedica tambin al negocio naturista que implica viajes a provincias, contando con menor tiempo para su comedor pero se las ha ingeniado todos estos aos organizndolo bien.
Para el techado de cemento de su comedor, en aras de cumplir las metas que se ha trasado como madre, es que requiere de un prstamo de 700 soles.
texts.en:
As a pillar of the neighborhood, Irma has much support and clientele for her eatery. She is known for watching over her children as few mothers do, so that they lack nothing, absolutely nothing. Since 2 are older, the youngest is now her greatest treasure, she wants to give her the best of the best. This is why she has her natural foods business, requiring trips into the provinces, leaving less time for her eatery. She has managed everything well all these years, organizing well. For a cement roof for her eatery and in order to accomplish what she has undertaken as a mother, she needs this loan of $250.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To finish construction of the interior of her house for her food clients, plus to stock up on necessities for her natural business requiring trips into the provinces

loan.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Con 52 aos y 25 de ellos vendiendo salchipapas, la seora Reynalda se sacrifica por sus hijos y nietos, todo es por y para ellos, cuenta con mucha experiencia y una fiel clientela, lo que le ha permitido ir creciendo de a pocos, lento pero seguro, logrando as casi terminar de cambiar el material noble por el adecuado para su casa, que la comparte con hijos y nietos.
Requiere de 500 soles de prstamo para poder lograr tan ansiada meta, trazada desde haca 25 aos, cuando empez en un puesto ambulante situado fuera de su casa, que luce hoy en da distinta.
texts.en:
At 52, with 25 years spent selling salchipapas (sausage and fries), Seora Reynalda sacrifices herself for her children and grandchildren, everything is for them. She has plenty of experience and a faithful clientele, which has permitted her to keep growing little by little, slowly but surely. She has almost succeeded at finishing the house she shares with her children and grandchildren. She needs a loan of $175 in order to complete this long-desired task, envisioned 25 years ago, when she started in a mobile kiosk outside of her house, and now seeing the light of day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Finish construction of her salchipapa business with a roof and floor

loan.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary V. lives with her husband and their one child in the Phteah Rung Village of Pursat Province in Cambodia. She and her husband have been in the farming business since 2000. More specifically, they grow rice, and they currently earn approximately 10,000 Riel (US$2.50) per day.

Sary and her husband work extremely hard every day to generate income for the family's daily living expenses. For another source of income, Sary is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Riel (US$250) to purchase piglets to breed. In this way, she is hoping that the loan will enable her to increase her family's income.

loan.use: To purchase piglets to breed as an additional source of income

loan.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna C., 26, is a grocery seller in Prek Sdey Village in the Pursat Province and has been selling for one year. Phanna is married to Das Sophea and has two children, who are small, young and attend school. Her husband is a fish seller by transporting to customers' homes.

To fulfill her customers' requirements and to increase income, Phanna would like to request a loan of US$500 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. For another source of income, she has purchased piglets to breed. For her future plans, Phanna wants to own a large store to stock all kinds of products to sell, and to support her children to graduate and get good jobs.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

loan.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn S., 41, is farmer who grows rice in the Phteah Rung Village of PurS. Province in Cambodia. He has a great deal of experience in the rice-growing business because he has been doing so since 1988. Currently, he can earn approximately 8,000 Riel (US$2.00) per day. He lives with his wife and their three children, all of whom are in school.

Normally, Cambodian people will use an ox or buffalo as labor for plowing farmland. Because he only has one ox to help with his farming operation, Soeurn is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000 Riel (US$125) to purchase another ox to match with his existing one in order to plow his farmland in a more efficient manner.

loan.use: To improve his farming operation by purchasing another ox in order to plow the farmland

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To start a small business selling costume jewelry

loan.name: Oit

texts.en:
Oit D. is 45 years old and has bred pigs for sale since 2000, earning about $3.20 per day. Oit is married to Mr. Ul Bun, 46, a rice farmer and mill owner offering grinding services. They have five children, one of whom works in a shopping center earning around $110 per month and helping to support the family.

To increase income, Oit is requesting a loan to purchase both pig feed and more pigs to breed.

loan.use: To purchase more pigs to breed as will as pig food.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase crockery, window curtains and other goods for a small business.

loan.name: Ashuqullah

texts.en:
Ashuqullah is a young man aged 25 years old. He has studied up to ninth class and is currently studying English classes. In his spare time, he started a small business selling medicines. He opened a drugstore in his village in Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. Ashuqullah lives with his two sisters and his old mother in a small house in the village. His father is dead.

Ashuqullah plans to make a small clinic in his village in the future. He has contacted Kiva for a 50000 (AF) individual loan for 18 months to buy some different medicines and syrups for his drugstore. He also has his own capital of 8000 (AF) ($160) which he has invested into the shop. He thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To buy medicines and syrups

loan.name: Rohullamen

texts.en:
This man is Rohullamen, 33 years old and married. He lives Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He graduated from 12th class two years ago. He is a hard worker but because of some financial problems he cannot study anymore. So he started a small business as a retailer in the Khewa and he supports the whole household.

Rohullamen has one sister and two brothers. He lives with his parents in a rental house. Their lives are going well but there is a problem for Rohllamen with capital. He has just 10,000(AF) or US$ 200 and he wants to increase his income because their expenditures are too much. He wants his brothers and sister to obtain higher education so that they can help our country and the country's people in the future.

For that reason, Rohullamen wants to take 50,000(AF) as an individual loan from AFSG with a term of 18 months so he can buy some things like oil, rice, notebooks, milk, pens, etc. for his shop. And he will pay this money back on time. He thanks all those who make individual loans to Kiva borrowers possible.

loan.use: buying oil, rice, milk, etc.

loan.name: Fazalraman

texts.en:
Fazalraman is an educated man with full experience. He has a retail shop where he works. It is a long time that he has been working in this business. He has some good numbers of customers. He has a small business but when he got his first cycle loan he completed his stock, then he continued his business with more success and still he is working.

Now he has requested a second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in this business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, specially for the son who works with Fazalraman. He is sure that he can further his business with more success.

Finally, he would like to thank those who helped him by granting him his first loan and also those who will help him in this second-cycle loan. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loan.use: To enlarge his shop

loan.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is the mother of 3 children who lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a pottery business. She has been involved in this business for a long time. She is a hard worker and a talented woman. She makes clay bowls and her husband sells them in the bazzar. She got her first-cycle loan and furthered her business with more success. With the income from the first loan, she was able to open a retail shop for her husband.

Now she has requested her second-cycle loan to complete his stock and also further her own business so that she can find an opportunity to enlarge her husband's business and continue her business with more success.

Mena is happy. She would like to say that before she received her first-cycle loan, she was really very weak in her business. After that she was able to open a retail shop for her husband, so she would like to thank those that helped her already and those who will help her now in this process. And also she would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for making this process available to people like her.

loan.use: To complete her husband's stock

loan.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en:
M. Smail lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail shop. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and still he is furthering his business, attracting some good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time.

Therefore he has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loan.use: To enlarge his shop

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To invest in women's pants in order to move her small business forward.

loan.name: Comlanvi Mathias

texts.fr: N en 1966 Aklakou, Monsieur A. Comlanvi Mathias est un revendeur trs dynamique ayant le sens de lentreprenariat. C'est un conducteur de btaxi moto, mari et pre de 5 enfants. Pour rpondre aux besoins sans cesse croissants de ceux-ci, il dcide daugmenter son chiffre daffaire grce lachat d'une nouvelle moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra damliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de ses enfants et de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Comlanvi Mathias A. is a very energetic retailer with an entrepreneurial sense. A motorbike taxi driver, he is married and has five children. To meet their ever-growing needs, he decided to raise his level of business through the purchase of a new motorbike for transportation. It will enable him to improve his situation and the standard of living of his children and family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a moto taxi

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ne Afagnan en 1985, A. Ablavi est une jeune femme clibataire. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a cess lcole pour apprendre la couture. Aujourdhui elle n'arrive pas exercer cette activit mais s'est lance dans le commerce de crales quelle a hrit de sa mre. Elle achte le mas en priode dabondance et le revend dans le temps de soudure. Les bnfices de cette activit trs rentable lui serviront augmenter ses revenus et mieux subvenir ses besoins.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Afagnan, Ms. Ablavi A. is a young unmarried woman. Educated through primary school, she dropped out to learn how to sew. As the manager of a seamstress shop today, she wants to reconcile this aptitude, which she inherited from her mother, with commerce. She wants to buy corn while it is abundant now and to resell it when it is scare. This being a very gainful business, the profits will let her provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Stocking and selling corn

loan.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur G. Komi, est n le 28 Novembre 1987 Ago-Nyiv (Lom). Instruit de niveau secondaire, il raccrocha trs tt les tudes pour cder sa passion de commerce. Devenu ainsi un commerant, il gre un tablissement quil a co-ouvert avec sa sur. Aujourdhui ayant dtach son activit, il cherche un financement pour acheter et vendre des fournitures scolaires aux lves de sa localit. Les bnfices lui serviront dtendre le cadre de son activit.
texts.en:
Mr.Komi G. was born on November 28,1987 in Ago-Nyiv (Lom). Having a secondary school education, he hung up his bookbag very early on in order to submit to his passion for commerce. Having thus become a merchant, he manages an establishment that he and his sister opened. Today, having let loose his work, he is seeking financing for doing commerce in school supplies for pupils in his town. The profits will serve to expand the scope of his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell school supplies

loan.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Madame K. Sylvie est ne en 1979 Attim. Elle vit actuellement avec ses 2 enfants en charge Afagnan. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a vite cern les rouages de son commerce. Elle achte les produits de premire ncessit notamment les savons, les dtergeants, du lait et autres Lom et les revend Afagnan. Elle a besoin de financement pour augmenter la taille de son commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientle. Les bnfices lui serviront amliorer les conditions de vie des personnes sa charge sur le plan scolaire, alimentaire et sanitaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie K. was born in 1979 in Attim. She presently lives with her two children in Afagnan. She attended primary school, but quickly stepped out into the business world. She buys staples, especially soap, detergent, milk and other goods, in Lom and re-sells them in Afagnan.

Sylvie needs a loan to expand the size of her business and better satisfy her clientele. She will use the profit to improve living conditions, from the standpoint of food and health concerns, for the children for whom she is the breadwinner and also to pay school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of staple goods

loan.name: Mawoul

texts.fr: N Agbtsiko en Juillet 1976, Monsieur M. Mawoul vit aujourdhui avec sa femme et ses deux enfants Afagnan. Enseignant de profession, il a dcid dassocier le travail de caftria trs tt les matins et les soirs pour soutenir son revenu. Un financement lui permettra de se ravitailler afin dtre la hauteur des demandes de sa clientle. Des bnfices, il parviendra tendre son cadre dactivit et bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agbtsiko in July 1976, Mr. Mawoul M. now lives with his wife and his two children in Afagnan. A teacher by profession, he decided, on the side, to open a cafeteria very early mornings and evenings to supplement his earnings. A loan will allow him to build up his inventory of foodstuffs so as not to disappoint his clientele. From the profit, he will be able to expand this business and take good care of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: stocking his cafeteria

loan.name: Agbo Komi

texts.fr: Ag de 30 ans, Monsieur B. Agbo Komi est demeurant Amgnran, son village natal. Mari et pre de 2 enfants, il est mcanicien de profession, mtier quil exerce avec passion. Cependant, la chert actuelle de la vie ne lui permet pas de joindre les deux bouts. Diversifier ses sources de revenu est pour lui une solution afin de contrecarrer la baisse du pourvoir dachat. Il veut acheter une moto quil mettra en circulation pour transport. Ceci va augmenter son revenu et laider mieux faire face ses problmes de famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Agbo Komi B., age 30, lives in Amgnran, his native village. Married and the father of two, he is a mechanic by trade, work he does with passion. Yet the high cost of living these days prevents him from making ends meet. Diversifying his sources of income is one solution for him, in order to thwart the drop in buying power. He wants to buy a motorbike that he will put to use in the transport business. This will increase his income and help him address his family problems better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a moto taxi

loan.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur H. Koffi est n en 1981 Kini-Kondji dans la prfecture de Yoto. Aujourdhui demeurant Katiho, il est mari et pre de 2 enfants. Sa passion pour le commerce la amen abandonner ses tudes et ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation gnrale. Il est trs reconnu dans le milieu. Mais son principal handicap reste le manque de fond de roulement pour ravitailler sa boutique en produits alimentaires et divers afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle. Ceci lui permettra daugmenter son revenu et amliorer la qualit de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi H. was born in 1981 in Kini-Kondji, in Yoto Prefecture. Nowadays, he is staying in Katiho and is married with two children. His passion for commerce has lead him to abandon school and to open a grocery store. He is well-recognized in the area. But his main handicap remains the lack of working capital for supplying his store with food items and various goods, so that he may satisfy his customers better. Having the capital would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To supply his shop with grocery items

loan.name: Djolvi

texts.fr: Madame A. Djolvi est ne en 1967 Gbav (P/Lacs), marie un chauffeur, elle vit aujourdhui Amgnran avec ses 3 enfants. Cest une dame qui est trs reconnue dans son entourage de par son activit. En effet, elle fait le commerce de crales comme le mas, haricot et mil. Cependant les charges du mnage ne lui permettent pas de jouir de ses profits. Son ambition est dagrandir son commerce afin den profiter plus. Pour cela elle sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Ms. Djolvi A. was born in 1967 in Gbav (Lacs Prefecture). She is married to a driver and nowadays lives in Amgnran with her three children. This is a woman who is recognized among her friends and family for her work, which is in fact commerce in grains, such as corn, beans, and millet. Yet household expenses don't allow her to enjoy a profit. Her ambition is to grow her business to take better advantage of it. To do so, she is requesting financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To stock and sell grain

loan.name: Ayika

texts.fr: Ne le 31 dcembre 1979 Djrkpo-Hagou, Monsieur T. Ayika vit actuellement dans le mme village o il exerce ses activits. Mari et pre de famille, il est spcialiste de maintenance. A cela, il a ajout la vente de portables, dordinateurs et accessoires. Grce cela, il arrive subvenir aux besoins des huit personnes sa charge. Il est la recherche dun financement pour renforcer son activit surtout avec la cration dautres points de vente.
texts.en:
Born December 31, 1979, in Djrkpo-Hagou, Ayika T. currently lives in the same town from which he operates his business. Married and a father, his specialty is doing repairs. In addition, he sells laptops, desktop computers and accessories. Thanks to this business, he manages to see to the needs of the eight people in his care. He is seeking financing to expand his business, primarily by opening up additional sales outlets.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sale of laptops and accessories

loan.name: Koffi

texts.fr: N en 1985 Amgnran dans la prfecture de Vo, Monsieur H. Koffi vit dans le mme village o il exerce ses activits. Quoique clibataire, il a sa charge 5 petits frres. Pour faire face ces charges, il sadonne la vente des produits de la mdecine traditionnelle. Trs soucieux de son avenir et celui de ses frres, il manque de moyen pour redynamiser son activit en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientle. C'est pour cela qu'il sollicite un financement pour promouvoir son activit et accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Amgnran (Vo Prefecture), Mr. Koffi H. lives in the same village where he works. Although unmarried, he has five younger brothers in his care. To cope with this responsibility, he devotes himself to the sale of traditional medicines. Very concerned about his future and that of his brothers, he lacks the means to re-energize his business with the goal of satisfying his customers. This is why he is requesting financing to advance his work and to grow his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell traditional medical remedies

loan.name: Kodjo Eric

texts.fr: N le 22 novembre 1982 Vogan, Monsieur A. Kodjo Eric est un jeune trs dvou qui rside aujourdhui Amgnran. Chauffeur de profession, il na pas encore une voiture sa disposition. Ne pouvant pas rester les bras croiss, il sest donn la conduite de moto taxi. Il se dbrouille avec le revenu quil tire de cette activit pour subvenir ses besoins les plus lmentaires. Pour accrotre son revenu, il veut sacheter une moto quil mettra en circulation pour le transport des passagers.
texts.en:
Born on November 22, 1982 in Vogan, Mr. Kodjo Eric A. is a very devoted young man who today resides in Amgnran. A chauffeur by profession, he still lacks a car for his use. Unable to sit idly by, he has dedicated himself to driving a motorbike taxi. He manages to do OK on his own with the income derived from his work for meeting his most elementary needs. To grow his revenues, he wants to purchase a motorbike that he will put into use to transport travelers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a moto taxi

loan.name: Gnotouzin

texts.fr: Madame Madame A. Gnotouzin est ne en 1968 Amgnran. Marie et mre de 4 enfants, elle vit aujourdhui cheval entre Cotonou et Amgnran et exerce ses activits commerciales. Rompue la tche, elle est trs mobile et commercialise le mas, le haricot et les pices. Elle sen sort avec cette activit mais se confronte de temps en temps des manques de fonds de roulement ; ce qui entrave par moment lvolution de son activit. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un crdit pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gnotouzin A. was born in 1968 in Amgnran. Married and the mother of 4 children, she now lives in between Cotonou and Amgnran while working at her business. She is very mobile and sells corn (maize), dried beans, and spices. She manages to get by with this business but from time to time she experiences a lack of working capital which can have a negative effect on the evolution of her business. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: stocking and selling cereals

loan.name: Messan

texts.fr: N en 1980 dans le village dAmgnran, Monsieur A. Messan rside actuellement dans le mme village avec sa famille. Il est mari et pre de 2 enfants. Ayant abandonn trs tt ses tudes, il a appris la conduite, mtier quil exerce avec passion. Avec le souci davoir son propre vhicule pour pouvoir raliser plus dconomie, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirs lui permettront de mieux soccuper des besoins de sa famille avec une amlioration des conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in the village of Amgnran, Mr. Messan A. presently still lives in that same village with his family. He is married and the father of 2 children. Having left off his studies very early, he learned to drive, work he performs with passion. Intent of having his own car to use as a taxi so as to be able to save more, he is requesting a loan. The earnings he will make will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of a taxi

loan.name: Kpohoenou

texts.fr: N en 1979 Mom-Hagou, Monsieur H. Kpohoenou vit actuellement Amgnran o il exerce son mtier de photographe. Trs entreprenant et actif, il a russit se procurer des appareils de qualit qui lui permettent de raliser de bonnes prestation ses clients. Cependant, les revenus tirs de son mtier ne lui permettent pas dassurer le ncessaire sa famille. Ainsi, il veut diversifier ses sources de revenu en achetant une moto quil mettra en circulation pour le transport en commun.
texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Mom-Hagou, Mr. Kpohoenou H. currently lives in Amgnran, where he practices his trade as a photographer. A very entrepreneurial and active man, he succeeded in procuring quality cameras, which enable him to serve his clients well. Yet the income derived from his work doesn't permit him to ensure what is necessary for his family. And so, he wants to diversify his sources of income by buying a motorbike that he will put to use as a taxi.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a moto taxi

loan.name: Brada

texts.fr: Age de 39 ans, Madame W. Brada rside aujourdhui dans le village dAmgnran o elle exerce ses activits gnratrices de revenu. Marie et mre de 3 enfants, elle est couturire de profession. Paralllement la couture, elle est spcialise dans la prparation et la vente de jus de fruit, activit qui lui est trs rentable. Mais avec lendommagement de son conglateur, cette activit a cess et elle est donc sevre de ses revenus. Elle compte acheter un nouveau conglateur mais les moyens lui manquent. Elle sollicite donc un crdit cette fin.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brada W., 39, now lives in the village of Amgnran where she has her business. Married and the mother of 3 children, she is a professional seamstress. Besides sewing, she is specialized in the preparation and sale of fruit juice, which is very lucrative for her. With her freezer's break-down, however, she has had to stop this business and is missing the earnings from it. She would like to buy a new freezer but she does no have enough funds. She is asking for a loan for this purpose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of a freezer

loan.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame A. Abla est ne en 1977 Lom. Marie et mre de 2 enfants, elle vit auprs de son mari Amgnran o elle exerce sa profession de coiffeuse. En plus de la coiffure, elle fait le petit commerce surtout le stockage de crales. Pour cette saison, elle compte faire plus de stockage de crales afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle et plus rentabiliser son activit. C'est cette fin qu'elle sollicite un crdit.
texts.en:
Abla A. was born in Lom in 1977. Married and the mother of two children, she lives with her husband in Amgnran where she works as a hairdresser. In addition to fixing hair, she does a small trade in cereal grains. At this time, Able intends to increase her inventory of cereal grains to better meet customer demand and make her business show a profit. With these goals in mind, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Stocking and selling cereal grains

loan.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur H. Kodjo est n en 1965 dans le village de Dagbati et demeure actuellement Amgnran. Journaliste la station radio de la place, il est mari et pre de 2 enfants. Pour permettre sa famille de vivre dcemment, il mne des activits parallles comme le petit commerce. En cette priode dabondance de mas, il dsir faire un stockage consistant pour revendre en priode de soudure. Pour cela il sollicite un financement pour faire le stockage et la vente de mais.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo H. was born in 1965 in the village of Dagbat and is currently staying in Amgnran. A journalist at the local radio station, he is married and the father of two. To allow his family a decent living, he does other work concurrently, such as small-scale commerce. Corn is plentiful now, and he would like to stock a major inventory for resale in lean times. To do so, he is requesting financing for stocking and selling corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To stock and sell corn

loan.name: Pamphile

texts.fr: N en 1969 Abomey dans le Bnin, Monsieur Pamphile L. vit actuellement Afagnan avec sa femme et ses enfants. Il compte sa charge un total de 10 personnes. La soudure l'arc est son activit de tous les jours. Matre de 2 ateliers, il exerce cette activit depuis prs de 20 ans. Son ambition est d'avoir un crdit pour renforcer ses 2 ateliers en achetant les barres de fer et les transformer en portail, en sceau mtallique, moule et autres sur lesquels il gagne plus de bnfices. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Abomey in Bnin, Mr. Pamphile L. presently lives in Afagnan with his wife and his children. He is responsible for 10 people in all. Arc welding is his daily business. The owner of two workshops, he has been doing this work for almost 20 years. His ambition is to have a loan to bolster his two workshops by buying bars of iron to transform into gates, metal pails, molds and such items on which he earns a good profit. This will allow him to better provide for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of raw materials for his welding workshops

loan.name: Dmagnan

texts.fr: Monsieur S. A. Dmagnan est n le 14 aot 1977 Afagnan. Mari et pre de 4 enfants, il a prfr laisser sa profession de maintenance pour investir dans le commerce. Devenu une rfrence Afagnan en matire de vente de cartes de recharges pour mobiles, il a voulu obtenir de lagrment pour mieux vendre les cartes. Cette extension du champ de vente lui permettra de dgager de bnfices qui lui serviront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille notamment en matire de scolarit. C'est donc pour atteindre cet objectif qu'il sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Dmagnan A. S. was born on August 14, 1977 in Afagnan. Married and the father of four children, he chose to leave his work in maintenance to set up a shop. He has since become a reference point in Afagnan as far as sales of rechargeable cell phone cards are concerned, but he would like to obtain an agreement so as to be better placed to sell the cards. This expansion of his sales will allow him to make more profit, money he will use to support his family, and especially to pay school-related expenses. This is his goal in requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase and re-sale of rechargeable cell phone cards

loan.name: Omer

texts.fr: Monsieur D. K. Omer est un jeune homme mari et pre de 2 enfants. Il est n Afagnan en 1969 o il rside encore. Mcanographe de profession, il associe son travail lactivit de photocopie. Connaissant bien les recettes qui sortent de cette activit, Monsieur D. Omer veut acheter un nouveau photocopieur par un financement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientle. Les bnfices lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille notamment sur les plans sanitaire, alimentaire, scolaire et professionnel.
texts.en:
Mr. Omer K. D. is a young married man, father of 2 children. He was born in Afagnan in 1969 and he lives there still. Computer operator by profession, he also offers photocopy services. Since he is well aware of the remunerative nature of this business, Mr. D. wants to buy a new photocopier with this loan, in order to better satisfy the needs of his clientele. The profit will allow him to better cater for the numerous needs of his family, especially those concerning health, food, schooling and professional training.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of a photocopier

loan.name: Husna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Husna K. from Mwanza. She is divorced and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18. Husna has been selling charcoal since 2005. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her children. Husna currently earns about $100 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 USD to buy more charcoal. In the future, she plans to increase the stock and also to open new business. Husna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy charcoal

loan.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Ester T. from Mwanza, who is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 14. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Ester has been running a pharmacy business since 2000. Working at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, she currently earns about $200 per month.

Ester is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more medicine including anti-malaria drugs, panadol, shestcof, and mucolyn. In the future, she plans to open new a business. Ester thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Irene A. from Mwanza. She is married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 20. She also supports another dependant because he is an orphan. Irene has been running a tailoring business since 1995. She works 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Irene currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to buy more cloth. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Irene thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loan.use: To buy cloth

loan.name: Eya

texts.fr: Mme D. Eya est ne en 1972 Bgb dans la Prfecture du Zio au Togo. Elle marie un chauffeur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari faire face aux charges de la famille, elle sest lance dans lagriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur trs prometteur dans la rgion. Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Eya D. was born in 1972 in Bgb in Zio Prefecture, Togo. She is married to a chauffeur, and together they have three children. To assist her husband in addressing family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably in growing corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizer and to increase her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fertilizer to enrich the soil

loan.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haider, 39, is married and has three children. He lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. Haidar owns a automotive repair business, and he has asked A. Majmoua for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a compressor for painting cars. In the past he has rented a compressor from his neighbors but this is very expensive. By purchasing his own compressor, he can increase his profit by 50 percent.

loan.use: To buy a compressor

loan.name: Abra

texts.fr: Ne le 03 Avril 1945 Bgb dans le Zio, Mme Abra A. est une veuve trs dynamique avec trois (03) enfants charge. Son activit principale est la prparation et la vente de denres alimentaires dans son village. Pour faire face la demande et lexigence de sa clientle, elle sollicite un crdit pour amnager un bon cadre sous forme de restaurant et sapprovisionner en riz et mais. Ce financement lui permettra de rentabiliser son activit et de soccuper de lducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on April 3, 1945 in Bgb (Zio Prefecture), Ms. Abra A. is a very dynamic widow with three children in her care. Her main work is making and selling food in her village. To address the demand and the expectations of her customers, she is requesting a loan for fitting up a nice place as a restaurant and to get supplies of rice and corn. This financing will enable her to be profitable and to take care of the education of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To fix up a restaurant and for supplies

loan.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is the mother of one child and lives in Beirut. She is 24 years old and owns a small shop that specializes in selling lingerie. Hanan has requested a loan of $500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase more products for her shop. She believes that it is very important to have variety of styles and colors for her clients to choose from, and is confident that this loan will allow her to expand her clientele and increase her profits.

loan.use: To diversify her clothing stock.

loan.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mme Ama F. est une femme agricultrice ne en 1970 Kpvgo au Sud du Togo. Elle est marie galement un agriculteur et est mre de six (06) enfants. Elle cultive du mais quelle revend sur le march en priode de hausse de prix. Pour augmenter son rendement et accrotre ses revenus, elle sollicite un crdit pour acheter les intrants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ama F. is a farmer who was born in 1970 in Kpvgo in the south of Togo. She is married to a farmer as well, and she is the mother of 6 children. She grows corn which she sells in the marketplace when prices are high. To increase her harvest and her earnings, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to expand the surface she cultivates.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and expansion of surface under cultivation

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme Akouvi A. une femme cultivatrice dune quarantaine danne avec deux (02) enfants charge. Son activit est la culture de mais et de manioc. Cette activit lui permet daider son mari faire face aux dpenses familiales et la scolarisation de leurs enfants. Cest pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des engrais en vue daccrotre ses rendements.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi A., a farmer of about 40 who is raising 2 children, grows maize and manioc. This business permits her to help her husband meet the family living expenses and pay the school fees for their children. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer in order to expand her harvests.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of fertilizer

loan.name: Maysa

texts.en: Maysa is 27 years old and owns a small mobile phone shop in Beirut. She has requested a loan of $800 from A. Majmoua to purchase a new supply of modern cellular phones and accessories. Maysa is a shrewd businesswoman and is confident that this loan will allow her to effectively diversify her product offerings, and by so doing, attract a broader range of clients. Maysa is grateful for the opportunity provided to her by Kiva and A. Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase a new stock of mobile phones for Maysaa's shop.

loan.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Ne en 1970 Bgb dans la Prfecture de Zio au sud du Togo, Mme Adzo A. est une femme clibataire avec quatre (04) enfants charge. Pour faire face seule la scolarisation des ses enfants, elle sadonne lagriculture notamment la culture de mais. Elle sollicite pour cela un financement pour acheter des engrais en vue daccrotre ses rcoltes et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Bgb (Zio Prefecture) in the south of Togo, Ms. Adzo A. is an unmarried woman with four children in her care. To cope by herself with the schooling of her children, she dedicates herself to agriculture, notably growing corn. Thus, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizer with the intent of increasing her harvest and her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fertilizer

loan.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mme Adjo A. est ne en 1973 Adangb dans la Prfecture du Zio au sud du Togo. Elle marie un agriculteur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari faire face aux charges familiales, elle sest lance dans lagriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur trs prometteur dans la rgion. Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjo A. was born in 1973 in Adangb (Zio Prefecture) in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, and together they have three children. To help her husband address family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably growing corn, a highly promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizers and to expand her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fertilzers and to expand her arable land

loan.name: Dla

texts.fr: Mme Dla K. est ne en 1976 Kpvgo au sud du Togo Elle marie a un cultivateur avec lequel elle a eu (5) enfants pour aider son marie subvenir aux charges de la famille, elle sest lance dans le commerce notamment dans la vente des denres alimentaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour sapprovisionner en marchandise et augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Dla K. was born in 1976 in Kpvgo, in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, with whom she has five children. To assist her husband in providing for the family, she got started in commerce, notably in selling grocery items. She is requesting financing to get supplies of merchandise and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Supplies of goods

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi K. est ne en 1968 Vogan dans la Prfecture de Vo au sud .Est du Togo. Elle est veuve avec cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales, elle sest lance dans lagriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur trs prometteur dans la rgion. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite un financement pour acheter de lengrais. Ce financement lui permettra dagrandir sa surface cultivable et lamlioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi K. was born in 1968 in Vogan in Vo Prefecture, southeast of Togo. She is a widow with five children. To discharge her family responsibilities, she went into agriculture, specifically into raising corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her yield, Afi is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This funding will enable her to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fertilizer and additives

loan.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Beirut and bakes "Manniesh" bread for local bakeries and street vendors to re-sell. Manniesh is a traditional type of Lebanese bread which is usually topped with Zaater- a thyme-like herb, and cheese or minced meat. It can be found in the hands of nearly every Lebanese for either breakfast or lunch. The tasty bread is almost always served warm, and Mohammed supplies locals with soft, fresh Manniesh every day.

Mohammed has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of 500 US Dollars in order to repair his bread oven and many of his aging tools. Mohammed is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Kiva and Al Majmoua, and he is confident that this loan will enable him to sustain his business and continue to support his family.

loan.use: to repair Mohammed's bread oven and many of his tools

loan.name: Kuya

texts.fr: Marie un cultivateur, Mme Kuya D. est ne en 1958 au Ghana. Nayant reu aucune formation, elle sest galement engage dans lagriculture travers la culture du mais quelle produit et revend sur le march. Cette activit lui permet de soutenir son mari financirement. Pour augmenter son rendement, elle sollicite un financement pour lachat dintrants notamment les engrais et les semences.
texts.en:
Ms. Kuya D. was born in Ghana in 1958 and is married to a grower. Not having received any training at all, she has dedicated herself as well to agriculture through the growing of corn, which she produces and then sells on the market. This work enables her to support her husband financially. To increase her yield, she is requesting financing to buy supplies, notaly manure and seeds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Ne en 1971 Kpvgo dans la Prfecture du Zio au sud du Togo, Mme Afi B. est marie un mcanicien avec deux (02) enfants charge. Son activit principale est la prparation et la vente de denres alimentaires dans son village. Pour faire face la demande et lexigence de ses consommateurs, elle sollicite un crdit pour amnager un bon cadre sous forme de restaurant et sapprovisionner en riz et mais. Ce financement lui permettra de rentabiliser son activit et de soccuper de lducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Kpvgo in southern Togo (Zio Prefecture), Afi B. is married to a mechanic and has two children in her care. Her primary occupation is the preparation and sale of food products in her village. To meet customer demand and the expectations of her clients, Afi is requesting a loan to turn a good location into a restaurant, and to stock up on rice and corn. This funding would enable her to show a profit from her business and to attend to her childrens education.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Setting up a restaurant and purchasing provisions

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi Z. est ne en 1984 Bgb. Clibataire avec trois (03) enfants charge, elle pratique lagriculture, la culture du mais, la seule activit gnratrice de revenu dans son milieu. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et augmenter sa surface cultivable. Ce crdit lui permettra daccrotre consquemment ses revenus et de faire face la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi Z. was born in 1984 in Bgb. She is single raising 3 children, and she farms, growing maize, the only way to earn money in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and increase the area she has under cultivation. This loan will allow her to increase her earnings and provide school-fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and increase of area under cultivation

loan.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib, 44, lives in Beirut and owns a mini-market that caters to his local neighbors. Habib has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase a large stock of items for his shop. This will be Habib's second loan with Al Majmoua. His first was repaid in full and on time.

loan.use: To purchase a new stock

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Age de 48 ans, Mme Afi D. est une veuve ayant quatre (04) enfants sa charge. Aprs le dcs de son mari, elle continua lactivit commune quelle menait avec ce dernier, c'est--dire la culture du mais pour subvenir aux dpenses scolaires de ses enfants et de sa famille. Elle sollicite un crdit pour acheter des engrais et accrotre sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
48-year-old Afi D. is a widow with four children in her care. In order to pay for her childrens schooling and to support her family, after her husband passed away, she continued the business they had had together, raising corn. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fertilizer and to increase amount of land under cultivation

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi A. est ne en 1970 au Ghana. Elle est marie et mre de cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales aux cots de son mari, elle sest lance dans lagriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur trs prometteur dans la rgion. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite un financement pour acheter de lengrais. Ce financement lui permettra dagrandir sa surface cultivable et lamlioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in 1970 in Ghana. She is married and the mother of five children. In order to shoulder family responsibilities alongside her husband, she went into agriculture, into raising corn in particular, a very promising sector in the region. Afi is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to increase her yield. This funding would enable her to expand the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of agricultural additives

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr: Marie et mre de quatre (04) enfants, Mme Afi N. est ne en 1983 Bgb dans le Zio au sud du Togo. Nayant reu aucune formation, elle sest galement engage dans lagriculture travers la culture du mais quelle produit et revend sur le march. Cette activit lui permet de soutenir son mari financirement. Le sol devenant de plus en plus pauvre, pour augmenter son rendement, elle sollicite un financement pour lachat dintrants notamment les engrais et les semences.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Afi N. was born in 1983 in Bgb in the Zio area in the south of Togo. Having received no formal training, she farms maize which she sells in the marketplace. This work allows her to help her husband with family expenses. Her land becoming ever less fertile, however, she is requesting a loan to increase her harvest through inputs to her soil, notably fertilizer, and improved seed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of fertilizer and seed

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.fr: Mme Rebecca A. est ne en 1955 Bgb dans la Prfecture au sud du Togo Elle marie un cultivateur avec lequel elle a eu huit (08) enfants. Pour aider son mari subvenir aux charges de la famille, elle sest lance galement dans lagriculture notamment la culture du mais. Elle sollicite un financement pour sapprovisionner en engrais pour accrotre ses rcoltes et augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rebecca A. was born in 1955 in Bgb (South Togo). She's married to a farmer and they have eight children. To help her husband in providing for the family, she started cultivating corn. She's seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production and her revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fertilizers

loan.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheng D., 43, works as a housewife cooking food for her family members. She has four children who are enrolled in school and her husband works to generate income to support his household. He has been employed as a primary school teacher since 1990, and besides working as a teacher he works as a fisherman. He can typically make around US$ 2.60 each day.

Recently, Mrs. Cheng D. decided to request a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to use to commute to work. (Her husband is pictured because Cheng D. was not available.)

loan.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her husband to use to commute to work

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of garments to add to her inventory

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for a small business

loan.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun S. M., age 28, grows various kinds of vegetables at her paddy and resells them in a market in her community, making about $2 of income each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a fisherman in the rainy season, making around $10 each day.
Mrs. Yun S. M. would like to request for a loan to purchase more seeds for her crops. With the rest of the money, she wants to buy her husband a trailer that attaches to his motorbike for carrying heavy items, vegetables, and passengers. This will increase their profit margin.
Because Yun S. M. was not available, her husband appears in the photograph.

loan.use: To purchase a trailer to attach to her husband's motorbike

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To invest in more clothing to add to her inventory.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase more fruits to increase her sales volume.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase shoes to sell in her small business

loan.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheang Y., age 30, grows yams in her grove. She typically makes about $6 each day by selling her yams to a broker. Her husband works as a recycler, buying recyclable items from different locations and reselling them to recycling plants. He can generate about $2.50/day for his household. Pheang Y. has three children who are enrolled in school.
She is applying for a loan of $1200 from KIVA, which she will use, along with her family's savings, to purchase a truck to use to carry her yams to market. This will allow her to carry much larger loads in each trip.

loan.use: To purchase a truck to use for her business transportation

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov V., age 27, is married and lives with her husband in Memot district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.
Because government-provided electricity is not yet available in her area, the people in her community either buy electricity from a private service provider or they buy a battery to generate electricity for their household. Mrs. V. and her husband operate a business recharging batteries for the people in her community. Basically, whenever the battery is out of its power, the battery owner has to find a recharging service. Mrs. V. and her husband can make around $5 for their services.
This couple would like to request for a loan to purchase a machine which can charge many batteries at once. This will allow them to increase a number of batteries they charge as well as a their profit margin.
Her husband appears in the photograph, because Mrs. V. was not available.

loan.use: To buy a machine that can charge many batteries at one time.

loan.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N., age 42, is married with four children and lives with her husband in Bathambong Province, Cambodia. She works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her community, and typically makes around $5 of income each day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and earns about $6/day for his household.
Mrs. Sok N. started her grocery business in 2005 and she has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan to purchase more groceries to meet her growing customer demands.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory.

loan.name: Soa

texts.en:
Mrs. Soa Y., age 46, is a widow and the mother of two children, ages 18 and 21. Her 18-year-old son works as a construction worker and make around $3 each day.
Mrs. Y. buys recyclable items from different locations in her town and resells them to the recycling plant, making about $4/day of net income.
In order to make her recycling business operate faster and more easily, Soa Y. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorbike to use for business transportation. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy more recyclable items to sell so she can increase her profit margin.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for business transportation

loan.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng P. is a widow who has two children. She lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.
To improve her living conditions, Sreng P. sells local fresh vegetables and chicken at the Phsar Kok market. She typically makes about $3 of profit each day. She also breeds pigs for additional income.
Currently, her two children are employed as workers so they can generate more income for their household.
Sreng P. has operated her business for over 13 years, ever since her husband divorced her. At the time, life was such a struggle for her that she had to work very hard to feed her two little children. Now her family and her business are getting from day to day and she has a lot more customers than she had before.
She is asking for a loan to purchase more pigs to breed and to buy a motorbike to use for her business transportation.

loan.use: To purchase more pigs to breed and a motorbike to use for her business transportation.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase goods such as tablecloths and curtains to add to her inventory.

loan.name: Mrs. Khat Sophet Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat S., 42, is a group leader of four who all live in Krang Prosvay Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at the better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her business. Her husband, Mr. Tith Sophy, is a farmer. The couple has four children; one is employed in a garment factory; two are attending the local school; one is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

Mrs. Men R.'s husband represents her in the photograph.

loan.use: To buy more rice to keep in inventory to resell later at better price.

loan.name: Mrs. Ro Sarim Group

texts.en:
The group leader of five is Mrs. Ro S., age 28, and all of the members live in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand and has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

Her husband has two hectares where he cultivates rice to earn money for the family. Mrs. Ro S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other, age two, is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery products to increase the store inventory.

loan.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano has been selling fried turn-overs at the market for the past 7 years. Her business supports and feeds her family. She would like to borrow money so that she can buy more flour and ingredients to make more turn-overs. With the additional profit she hopes to provide a better lifestyle for her family.

loan.use: Purchasing more flour and ingredients for making turn-overs.

loan.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom has worked as a barber for many years. He is very talented and maybe that's why he has so many clients. Also, he doesn't charge much for his services. Now, he wants to borrow money, so he can buy newer instruments for haircutting. This way, he thinks he can offer a better service for his clients.

loan.use: Purchasing new instruments of better technology.

loan.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina has been selling groceries for 11 years. Her husband works as an accountant but the salary he makes is not enough to feed the family. Zarina began selling groceries to help support her family. She would like a loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

loan.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.
